Title: Analista de datos
Description:
En Fundación Cibervoluntarios estamos buscando un Analista de Datos que combine habilidades en ciencia de datos y análisis de datos para maximizar el valor de nuestros datos internos y externos. Si eres un profesional apasionado por el análisis cuantitativo y la visualización efectiva, y quieres contribuir a proyectos con impacto social, ¡te queremos en nuestro equipo!




¿POR QUÉ ENAMORARTE DE ESTE PROYECTO?




En Fundación Cibervoluntarios, trabajamos para cerrar la brecha digital y promover la igualdad de oportunidades a través del uso de la tecnología. Nuestra misión es empoderar a las personas mediante la innovación y la tecnología, y creemos firmemente en el poder de los datos para transformar nuestra labor y medir nuestro impacto. Valoramos un entorno laboral inclusivo y ofrecemos oportunidades continuas de desarrollo profesional y formación para nuestro equipo.

Ofrecemos una jornada laboral de 35 horas semanales con un horario intensivo en verano. Además, tendrás la oportunidad de participar en proyectos innovadores que tienen un impacto positivo en la sociedad.




¿CUÁL SERÁ TU MISIÓN?




Como Analista de Datos, tu misión será realizar análisis cuantitativos para identificar tendencias y patrones en grandes volúmenes de datos, desarrollar modelos predictivos y de clasificación, y crear visualizaciones efectivas que faciliten la comprensión de los hallazgos para diversas audiencias. Trabajarás en estrecha colaboración con el equipo de Investigación y Estudios, y otros departamentos, para apoyar proyectos basados en datos y proporcionar soluciones basadas en análisis.

Entre tus responsabilidades se encuentran:

1. Análisis de Datos:

Realizar análisis cuantitativos de datos propios y de terceros para identificar tendencias, patrones y oportunidades.
Desarrollar modelos predictivos y de clasificación utilizando técnicas avanzadas de ciencia de datos.

2. Gestión y Procesamiento de Datos:

Gestionar y procesar grandes volúmenes de datos estructurados y no estructurados.
Aplicar técnicas de limpieza, transformación y preparación de datos para asegurar su calidad y disponibilidad para el análisis.

3. Visualización de Datos:

Crear visualizaciones claras y efectivas utilizando herramientas de fuentes abiertas como Tableau, Power BI, D3.js, entre otras.
Presentar hallazgos de manera comprensible para diferentes audiencias, incluyendo personal no técnico.

4. Colaboración:

Trabajar estrechamente con el equipo de Investigación y Estudios para apoyar proyectos de investigación y análisis.
Colaborar con diferentes departamentos para identificar necesidades de análisis de datos y proporcionar soluciones basadas en datos.

5. Documentación e Informes:

Documentar métodos y resultados de análisis para garantizar la transparencia y reproducibilidad.
Preparar y presentar informes periódicos con hallazgos clave y recomendaciones para la toma de decisiones.




¿QUÉ NECESITAMOS DE TI PARA CONQUISTAR ESTE RETO?




Educación:

Título universitario en Estadística, Matemáticas, Informática, Economía, Ingeniería o campos relacionados.
Se valorarán estudios de posgrado en Ciencia de Datos, Análisis de Datos o disciplinas afines.

Experiencia:

Mínimo de 2 a 3 años de experiencia en análisis de datos y/o ciencia de datos.
Experiencia en el manejo de grandes volúmenes de datos y en la creación de visualizaciones efectivas.

Conocimientos Técnicos:

Dominio de lenguajes de programación y software de análisis de datos como Python, R, SQL.
Experiencia con herramientas de visualización de datos como Tableau, Power BI, D3.js, etc.
Familiaridad con herramientas de datos abiertos y técnicas de análisis de datos de fuente abierta.

Habilidades:

Capacidad para interpretar y analizar datos complejos de manera precisa y efectiva.
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación y presentación para transmitir hallazgos a diversas audiencias.
Capacidad para trabajar de manera autónoma y en equipo, manteniendo un enfoque en la colaboración y el impacto social.

Otros:

Alta motivación y pasión por el uso de datos para el impacto social.
Conocimiento de las tendencias actuales en análisis de datos y visualización.




¿QUÉ TE ESPERA EN CIBERVOLUNTARIOS?

Contrato: Indefinido a jornada completa, con un período de prueba de 3 meses.
Jornada: 35 horas semanales, promoviendo el equilibrio entre la vida personal y profesional.
Horario: Intensiva de lunes a viernes de 8:00-15:00h o jornada de lunes a jueves de 09:00-18:30h con 45 minutos de descanso.
Salario: 25.000 euros brutos anuales.
Modalidad de trabajo: Presencial en Madrid
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a driven and successful Data Analyst to help our client sales teams worldwide grow, meet, and exceed their business targets.




As a Data Analyst focused on supporting the Sales team, you will be responsible for building and maintaining data and reporting capabilities, performing in-depth analysis of sales patterns, estimating the effectiveness of monetisation efforts, and providing actionable insights to both the sales teams and management.




You will contribute to key areas such as lead generation, user attribution infrastructure, and monetisation solutions, playing a critical role in driving revenue growth and expanding the brand’s customer base.




We need someone who is highly proficient with data infrastructure and reporting tools, understands the sales domain, and is genuinely interested in driving business outcomes.




What’s in it for you?




Great salary | High impact role | Scale up with high potential | Career growth | 100% Remote




Responsibilities:




Support the data infrastructure for sales: the company already has a basic data infrastructure in place, including a data warehouse (Redshift), integrated sales tools, and basic sales reporting in Tableau. They expect you to adapt this infrastructure to accommodate changes, develop more advanced reports, build new integrations, and ensure the quality and accuracy of the data.
Regularly report on the performance of the sales teams: Help develop and track appropriate KPIs.
Perform deep analysis of sales data: Focus primarily on internal data but also include external data where possible. Identify patterns and provide insights regarding offers, strategy changes, lead quality, and market shifts.
Work directly with sales teams, management, and, when necessary, marketing/development: Visualise and explain sales metrics and insights at various levels of complexity.
Form hypotheses, suggest improvements, and organise testing: Collaborate with the teams to test these hypotheses and implement improvements.




Requirements:




3+ years of experience in analytics/BI, ideally related to sales or marketing domains.
Bachelor’s degree, ideally with a focus on business administration, marketing, economics, or data processing (optional—can be omitted if not critical).
Strong technical skills: Advanced SQL, ideally Python for automating tasks; understanding of basic statistics and A/B testing; experience with visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker); and the ability to work with raw data.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills: Ability to derive insights, form, and test hypotheses to improve business results.
Sales domain knowledge (familiarity with sales data and reporting, CRM systems, lead generation, and sales processes) is a significant advantage.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal: Ability to clearly explain complex analytical concepts to different audiences, from sales agents to company management.
Obsession with business results: Understanding of business impact and the ability to work independently or within a team to continuously improve outcomes.
Fluency in English (native-level preferred). Spanish is a significant advantage; Russian would also be beneficial.
Experience working with B2B apps in a growth stage is also a plus.




Ready to make a significant impact? If you’re a driven Data Analyst with a passion for sales and marketing analytics, we want to hear from you! Apply now via Prosperity and help drive growth and success for our client’s sales teams worldwide.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst & BI - Remoto España
Description:
The Wise Seeker is the leading HR technology company in unbiased talent evaluation.With over 15 years in the industry analyzing the needs and demands of the job market, we are capable of identifying the best talent for each company thanks to our team of professionals and our SaaS platform integrated with Artificial Intelligence.We are efficient, evaluate talent objectively without bias, and close hiring times in record time, delivering optimal results.

As a Data Analyst & BI Specialist, you will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets and developing BI solutions to support strategic decision-making. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to identify business needs and deliver data-driven insights.

Key Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets to identify trends and patterns.
Develop and maintain BI dashboards and reports using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into data models and visualizations.
Conduct ad-hoc analyses to support business initiatives and decision-making.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide insights to improve business processes.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity across all reports and dashboards.
Stay current with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and BI.


Benefits


Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
Flexible working hours and remote work options.
Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
A collaborative and innovative work culture.

Title: Data Analyst - Finance (f/m/d)
Description:
Purpose of Position

Awin’s Financial Analysts serve as a pivotal resource in shaping the company's financial future and strategic direction through expert data analysis and insightful financial modelling. This role enhances decision-making across the organisation by providing precise, data-driven insights and actionable recommendations to optimise performance and drive growth.

Key Tasks


Financial & Business Analytics Reporting: Develop and maintain reporting using Tableau to track key performance indicators, financial metrics, and other critical data points relevant to business operations
Financial Modelling: Create detailed financial models that forecast business performance and simulate various financial scenarios to aid in strategic planning and decision-making
Insight Generation: Analyse data and report outcomes to provide actionable insights that support business objectives and drive efficiency improvements
Stakeholder Communication: Present complex analysis and reports to stakeholders in a clear and accessible manner, ensuring that technical and non-technical audiences understand the implications and insights
Continuous Improvement: Continually refine and enhance data collection, analysis, and reporting processes using BI tools to better meet the company’s strategic needs.


Skills & Expertise


3+ years in a financial or business analytics position
Analytical, pro-active and inquisitive, with the ability to take ownership and deliver projects independently
The ideal candidate possesses exceptional communication skills, with a proven ability to distil complex technical concepts into clear, concise explanations for non-technical audiences
Proficiency with SQL and Business Intelligence tools such as Tableau is essential
Fluency in English (C1+)


Our Offer


Flexi-Week and Work-Life Balance: We prioritise your mental health and wellbeing, offering you a flexible four-day Flexi-Week at full pay and with no reduction to your annual holiday allowance. We also offer a variety of different paid special leaves.
Flexi-Office: Do you prefer to work from our cool office, from home, or in a completely different environment? With us, the choice is yours. We offer the flexibility to work wherever you want within our Awin locations.  
Health & Well Being: With our support and access to various initiatives and sports offers, you can devote yourself to your mental and physical well-being.
Development: We’ve built our extensive training suite Awin Academy to cover a wide range of skills that nurture you professionally and personally, with trainings conveniently packaged together to support your overall development. You can also improve your English skills by participating in our local language course.
Remote Working: You will receive a monthly allowance to cover part of your running costs. In addition, we will support you in setting up your remote workspace appropriately.
Appreciation: Thank and reward colleagues by sending them a voucher through our peer-to-peer program and show your appreciation for colleagues who have gone the extra mile to support you.


Established in 2000, Awin is proud of our dynamic, social and inclusive culture.

Like all businesses, we’ve had to adapt and nurture our culture in a virtual environment. Our virtual ‘Life @ Awin’ hub brings our colleagues from across the globe together for various social activities.

Diversity & Inclusion are paramount to us, and we proudly pursue and hire diverse team members. We champion uniqueness and authenticity; this is who we are at our core. Our network of affiliate partnerships are diverse and transparent, as are the employees powering our vision to build the world’s leading open partner ecosystem. We welcome all backgrounds, identities, and experiences. If you need support at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Apply now to begin the next stage of your career at a progressive company that supports both your professional and personal development.

  • Development: We’ve built our extensive training suite Awin Academy to cover a wide range of skills that nurture you professionally and personally, with trainings conveniently packaged together to support your overall development. You can also improve your English skills by participating in our local language course.
  • Remote Working: You will receive a monthly allowance to cover part of your running costs. In addition, we will support you in setting up your remote workspace appropriately.
  • Appreciation: Thank and reward colleagues by sending them a voucher through our peer-to-peer program and show your appreciation for colleagues who have gone the extra mile to support you.

Established in 2000, Awin is proud of our dynamic, social and inclusive culture.

Like all businesses, we’ve had to adapt and nurture our culture in a virtual environment. Our virtual ‘Life @ Awin’ hub brings our colleagues from across the globe together for various social activities.

Diversity & Inclusion are paramount to us, and we proudly pursue and hire diverse team members. We champion uniqueness and authenticity; this is who we are at our core. Our network of affiliate partnerships are diverse and transparent, as are the employees powering our vision to build the world’s leading open partner ecosystem. We welcome all backgrounds, identities, and experiences. If you need support at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Apply now to begin the next stage of your career at a progressive company that supports both your professional and personal development.

Title: Analista de Datos
Description:
Servinform somos una empresa de Servicios enfocada a ofrecer un servicio diferencial de alto valor a las más de 1.500 empresas que han confiado en nosotros/as a través de los más de 9.000 profesionales que integran la compañía con centros de trabajo en toda España.




Actualmente estamos gestionando un proyecto en el que incorporamos a un/a Analista de datos. Se trata de un soporte a proyectos, trabajando directamente con el área de reporting del cliente, procesando y analizando datos de los sistemas para la emisión de los informes que solicitan cada área.




¿Qué ofrecemos?




- Retribución: 25000-27000 € brutos/año en 12 pagas en función de valía del candidato/a




- Jornada completa de 7.00 a 15.00 horas de lunes a viernes.




- Contratación indefinida




- Buen ambiente de trabajo




- Incorporación en septiembre




- Ubicación del puesto en Calle Julián Camarillo 16 en Madrid




- Posibilidad de teletrabajo híbrido (2 días a la semana) o 100% teletrabajo, previo acuerdo con el cliente.




¡¡En Servinform te estamos esperando!!




** Ningún sector de nuestra sociedad puede ser entendido sin la igualdad entre hombres y mujeres, así como la integración de las personas con discapacidad. Por eso, en Servinform enfocamos la igualdad y diversidad como un factor elemental para el progreso social, trabajando día a día para cumplir este objetivo**







REQUISITOS MÍNIMOS:




Se valorará tener conocimientos en:




Oracle:




Procedimientos almacenados en lenguaje pl/sql
Lenguaje sql avanzado.
Uso de los diferentes objetos de base de datos (Tablas, vistas, índices, disparadores, Scheduler Jobs, roles de usuario, sqlloader, explain plan).

Python/Django:




Scripting Python.
Librería Pandas de Python.
Desarrollo de aplicaciones web usando el framework Django.
Control de versiones (GIT).

RedShift:




Desarrollo de procedimientos y funciones
Elaboración de consultas sql complejas para la extracción de datos

Show more

Title: Research and Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT US




As one of the largest entrepreneurship networks globally, Bridge for Billions creates, designs, and manages entrepreneurship programs with foundations, corporations, and public entities that have benefited more than 5,000 entrepreneurs in more than 140 countries. We exist to enable more early-stage entrepreneurs of all kinds to thrive, generating jobs and solutions for everyone, so our economies sustainably meet the needs of all.




Bridge for Billions, recognized by Forbes 30 Under 30, Ashoka, and Acumen, has worked with more than 100 organizations such as Coca-Cola, Novartis, VISA, and institutions such as the United Nations or IDB Lab in the development of large-scale entrepreneurship programs. In 8 years, Bridge has grown to a team of more than 50 people from nearly 25 nationalities, with headquarters in Madrid, where most of our team is based; an emerging LatAm HQ in Guatemala, with a few team members; and a few people based in different places around the world.




JOB MISSION




The researcher will drive research and analysis efforts to generate actionable insights, facilitate knowledge sharing and dissemination, engage with stakeholders and clients to align on needs and expectations, and support marketing initiatives with simplified and creatively presented data. This role will ensure effective project management, development of research tools, and documentation of best practices to enhance organizational learning and strategic decision-making.







ROLES & CONTRIBUTIONS




Research (60% of time dedicated to this role)

Design and implement rigorous research studies focused on entrepreneurship ecosystems.
Produce impact reports and publications on best practices.
Use advanced statistical and analytical tools to interpret data and extract meaningful insights.
Scope markets and develop tailored research tools and instruments.
Collect and manage large datasets ensuring accuracy and integrity.
Perform benchmarks against industry standards and competitors.
Ensure effective project management and adherence to research best practices.




Reports and Communication (20% of time dedicated to this role)

Produce highly accurate and detailed reports based on research findings.
Use data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) to create clear and compelling visual reports.
Present findings and participate in events to showcase thought leadership.
Simplify complex content and develop creative methods for data presentation.
Support marketing initiatives with simplified and creatively presented data.
Engage with academic, business, and professional communities to elevate the organization’s profile.




Internal Knowledge Management (20% of time dedicated to this role)

Develop a robust roadmap strategy for implementing knowledge management that builds upon industry best practices and leverages tooling and process advancements.
Document best practices and ensure lessons learned are shared across teams.
Support the continuous improvement of processes and systems through strategic insights derived from organizational data.
Build and drive the culture of knowledge sharing within the organization.
Create, capture, organize, and assess knowledge assets for enterprise use.







SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE NEEDED




Skills we look for this particular role:




Hard Skills

Educational Background: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Knowledge Management, Data or Information Science, Business Administration, Economy, or a related field.
Minimum 2 years of experience in a knowledge management, research, or analytical role.
Proven track record in conducting qualitative and quantitative research.
Experience in preparing impact reports, best practices publications, ecosystem analysis, etc.
Experience communicating with and influencing senior leadership as well as framing discussions to gain valuable feedback and experience.
Ability to conduct thorough literature reviews.
Expertise in developing research tools and instruments.
Thought leadership and ability to contribute to best practices publications.
Familiarity with knowledge management systems and documentation tools.




Soft Skills

Excellent presentation and communication skills.
Experience leading projects and delivering outcomes within tight timelines.
Ability to simplify complex content and present data creatively.
Capability to provide actionable recommendations based on an analysis.
Proactive in knowledge sharing and contributing to thought leadership.
Strong documentation and internal knowledge management abilities.
Excellent understanding of impact management theory and practices, including Theory of Change.




Skills we look for all Bridge team members:

Purpose Driven: This position aligns with your life's purpose, the impact you wish to make, and the person you want to become.
Values Aligned: You embody our core values of Courage, Grit, Empathy, and Gumption.
Startup Mindset: You're collaborative, entrepreneurial, and willing to take responsibility for your work outcomes, operating effectively even when working alone.
Proactive & Empathetic: You take initiative, are results-driven, and empathetic in all your interactions with team members, entrepreneurs, mentors, and partners.
Emotionally Intelligent: You have a deep understanding of people’s needs and expectations and can build trust and engagement quickly.
Passionate & Curious: You are passionate about your work and have a lifelong desire to learn.
Resilient: You have a growth mindset and the resilience to overcome challenges, understanding that systemic change requires hard work.
Effective Communicator: You have proven experience in resolving problems and communicating complex ideas clearly to diverse groups in a fast-paced environment.




RECRUITMENT PROCESS




Apply: Submit your application.
Initial Chat: A brief 30-45 minute conversation to discuss your interest and understand the role.
Business Case: You'll receive a challenge to complete within a set time frame.
Technical Interview: If your challenge is satisfactory, we'll discuss it further and assess your technical skills.
Mutual Interview: An open discussion where you can ask us any questions to ensure our company is the right fit for you.
References: With your consent, we'll contact two of your references for feedback.
Offer: If all goes well, you'll receive a job offer from us.




OFFER AND LOCATION




Transparent salaries and fair compensation structure, mid-range for the social sector:




Compensation: Annual salary ranging from €25,000-€30,000
Benefits Package: Includes health insurance through Alan and a flexible benefits program with Cobee, which covers expenses from meals to childcare and training.
Location: Madrid
Starting Date: We're eager to start as soon as we find the perfect fit.
Employment Type: This is a full-time position. This position includes a 6-month trial period to assess suitability and performance




IMPACT & TEAM




Our Vision: We're set on reshaping the entrepreneurship landscape to be more just, inclusive, and effective.
Make a Real Impact: Join us in aiding entrepreneurs worldwide. As a part of our team, you'll be at the heart of a rapidly evolving social enterprise.
Team Dynamics: We're a passionate, international crew with a shared mission. See what our team members are saying on Glassdoor.
Company Values: Our four pillars are Gumption, Courage, Grit, and Empathy.
Referral Incentive: Receive a $200 bonus for successful team referrals ($100 upon hiring and an added $100 after their first 6 months).




GROWTH & DEVELOPMENT




Annual Global Retreats: Join us in global company-wide retreats, geared toward alignment and leadership growth, facilitated by external professionals.
Personal Growth: Take advantage of a dedicated learning budget, tailored for needs like backend bootcamps or leadership training sessions.
Feedback-Centered Culture: Engage in monthly one-on-ones with your lead and partake in comprehensive quarterly reviews with your peers.
Skill Sharing: We value cross-training. Team members are urged to share expertise through talks and in-house training.




WELLBEING & TIME OFF




Vacation Days: You'll have 23 vacation days, with the option to add more, in addition to chosen local public holidays.




FLEXIBILITY & WORK SET-UP




Tech Ready: We'll equip you with a new or second-hand Macbook.
Flexible Work Options: Enjoy a blend of flexible work hours and the option to work remotely.
Office Location: If you're in Madrid, our centrally-located office awaits, complete with a bright ambiance, modern amenities, and a welcoming terrace ideal for team gatherings.

Title: Data Analyst Expert
Description:
En Keepler queremos hacer crecer nuestro equipo con personas que tengan ganas de desarrollar software basado en datos con dos objetivos: ayudar en la transformación a nuestros clientes y disfrutar del proceso de crear valor a través de la tecnología.




Si quieres ser parte de un equipo que te ofrecerá retos tecnológicos y que te exigirá una mejora y aprendizaje continuo, si no tienes miedo a reconocer errores y eres capaz de ser proactivo/a y tirar del carro cuando te toque, es posible que Keepler sea el sitio donde deberías trabajar. ¿Te interesa? Echa un vistazo a nuestra vacante de Data Analyst Expert.




¿Qué buscamos en ti?




Amplia experiencia como Data Analyst/BI Consultant.
Capacidad para comprender las necesidades actuales de las unidades de negocio y trasladarlas al equipo.
Gestión de las expectativas y buenas dotes de comunicación.
Validación de la calidad y viabilidad de los datos procedentes de nuevas fuentes.
Conocimiento experto en SQL.
Apoyo en la definición y creación de nuevos KPIs.
Definir el mejor modelo de datos en función de los KPIs definidos.
Amplia experiencia con herramientas de visualización como Power BI.
Conocimiento y experiencia en Azure.
Imprescindible inglés hablado y escrito, nivel B2-C1.




Deseable:




Experiencia y entusiasmo por trabajar con metodologías ágiles (Scrum, Kanban…).
Experiencia en entornos Big Data.
Conocimiento de Python o R enfocado al análisis exploratorio de datos.
Deseable experiencia con AWS Quicksight.




¿Qué te ofrecemos en Keepler?




Un buen ambiente de trabajo junto a compañeros/as que son unos cracks en sus tecnologías y de quienes aprenderás cada día.
Tendrás un presupuesto personal anual de 2.000 euros para que lo dediques a formación y certificaciones.
Teletrabajo con asistencia flexible a la oficina. Nuestra oficina está situada en el centro de Madrid, lo que permite disfrutar de la ciudad en un entorno inmejorable y bien comunicado.
Ayuda económica mensual para consumibles del hogar derivados del teletrabajo.
Horario flexible de entrada y salida y flexibilidad en el almuerzo, para que tu vida personal y profesional encajen sin problema.
Jornada intensiva los viernes todo el año y los meses de julio y agosto.
Ayuda alimentaria de 11 euros al día que podrás recibir en ticket restaurante o en nómina, a tu elección.
Retribución flexible para tarjeta transporte, cheque guardería y seguro médico para familiares.
Formación inglés one-to-one gratis para ti, con 8 sesiones al mes en modalidad online.
Seguro médico privado con una amplia cobertura además de seguro dental y ventajas y precio reducido para tus familiares.
Salario competitivo basado en la meritocracia que reflejará tu crecimiento profesional y podrás hacerlo crecer añadiendo skills a tu perfil. ¿Qué significa? Te lo explicamos en este artículo: http://bit.ly/2rlIVUQ
Tu evaluación y subida salarial la realizarán tus compañeros/as, nada de responsables porque aquí no lo encontrarás como tal, y tienes 2 oportunidades al año para presentarte a una subida.
Una compañía con una cultura muy colaborativa que siempre piensa en hacerte la vida profesional más fácil para que solo te preocupes en hacer bien lo que te gusta.
Tendrás acompañamiento de un buddy los primeros meses para que te ayude en la adaptación.
Un ambiente solidario y transparente donde tus decisiones afectan a todos/as en la que prima la solidaridad contigo y con el que está a tu lado.




Así entendemos Keepler, ¿te animas a trabajar con nosotros/as?




We believe en el talento apasionado por la tecnología.




We want personas con diferentes cualidades, mentes inquietas y deseo de aprender, explorar e implementar nuevas tecnologías que aporten valor a cada proyecto.




We invest en el desarrollo continuo de nuestros profesionales.




We foster una cultura de equipo y generosidad.




Salario:




El salario que te ofrecemos responde a una fórmula que tiene en cuenta tu perfil y ciertos skills claves para la compañía. Para estos perfiles, el rango salarial depende de tu experiencia y es 39k-56k euros al año con la posibilidad de complementarlo sin límite con skills. Por cada skill validado se cobra adicionalmente hasta 10k euros al año. Los skills valorados son: experiencia en Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, Kanban, Machine Learning, Machine Learning Engineering, NLU, Computer Vision y Search & Optimization. Más información sobre su funcionamiento en nuestra web: https://keepler.io/salary-calculator

Show more

  • We foster una cultura de equipo y generosidad.


Salario:


El salario que te ofrecemos responde a una fórmula que tiene en cuenta tu perfil y ciertos skills claves para la compañía. Para estos perfiles, el rango salarial depende de tu experiencia y es 39k-56k euros al año con la posibilidad de complementarlo sin límite con skills. Por cada skill validado se cobra adicionalmente hasta 10k euros al año. Los skills valorados son: experiencia en Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, Kanban, Machine Learning, Machine Learning Engineering, NLU, Computer Vision y Search & Optimization. Más información sobre su funcionamiento en nuestra web: https://keepler.io/salary-calculator

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
My client in the financial services industry is looking for a Business Data Analyst on an autonomo contract (6-12 months) with it extending to a 2-3 years project. It will be on a hybrid basis in the office 3 days a week in Madrid.




Responsibilities

Main responsible of Business requirement gathering, User Story writing and lead User Story refinement efforts within the team. Able to build small prototypes and mock-ups as part of refinement efforts.
Participate together with engineers on the design of the solution.
Work together with Stakeholders during the Acceptance stage of solutions to guarantee successful delivery.
Can understand business processes and suggest improvements to the data platform.




Requirements

Data Architecture / Data Modelling knowledge.
Python Programming for Data.
Expert in Data Analysis / SQL Programming.
Must have strong communication and stakeholder management skills.
Understanding of REST APIs / SOAP APIs ( ability to read / understand technical specifications)
Experienced in Microsoft Power BI (ability to design prototypes to support requirements)







If interested, please apply and I will be in touch to discuss the role.

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Lingokids' mission is to help 100 million families worldwide raise amazing kids through playlearning™.




Through play and interactive technology, Lingokids delivers premium, modern learning through educational subjects and life skills so kids can thrive as confident, conscious, resilient, lifelong learners — ready for school and today’s ever-changing world.




Are you ready for Playlearning?™




We’re looking for an exceptional Product Data Analyst to join our team who is passionate about analysing data, identifying trends, and making recommendations to improve our growth strategies. As a key member of our team, you will work closely with Product Managers to improve user experience.




Responsibilities

Analyse user and interaction data to identify patterns, trends, and insights related to product usage and growth.
Collaborate with product managers to develop A/B testing strategies, implement tests, and analyse results to optimise product features and user flows.
Create reports and dashboards that track key performance indicators (KPIs) for product and monetisation.
Provide actionable insights and recommendations to stakeholders based on data analysis to drive product improvements and growth strategy adjustments.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends, tools, and practices related to product led growth and monetisation.
Own analytics projects E2E. Define business problems, translate into data approaches for yourself and more junior members of the team, and deliver insight and tools that will drive change.




Desired experience

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Business, Marketing or a related field.
Proven experience working in a similar role, focusing on product or monetisation and data analysis in a fast growth business.
You have deep expertise in data focussed tools (e.g., SQL, Python) and techniques, and have a history of delivering impactful projects from start to finish.
Experience with data analytics tools (e.g., Amplitude, Looker) and A/B testing tools and techniques.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to present complex data in a clear and persuasive manner.
Self-starter with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Creative problem-solving skills and a passion for innovation.
You’re a bright, high calibre candidate who enjoys working in a warm, fast-paced and collaborative environment.




English is a must. We are a multicultural team, and we are providing a service in English so, we don't care about certificates, but we expect you to be able to communicate fluently.




You should feel equally comfortable communicating in long-form writing. We have become a fully remote company so, we believe that being articulate in both spoken and written long-form asynchronous communication is key to working efficiently together.




Experience working closely with non-technical stakeholders to refine requirements and bring them to life is a must.




Life at Lingokids

🏡 Remote working: you can choose to work remotely from within your country or visit our offices if you live in Madrid.

⚖️ Flexible hours and work-life balance: we care about the results you bring to the team. 9 to 6 and constant commuting is not for us either.

📈 Stock options: joining Lingokids means you can choose to own part of the company.

🌍 Visa sponsorship: if you need a visa to work in the EU, Lingokids will assist you during the visa process, costs included.

📚 Professional growth: up to €2.000 per year for conferences, books, and training.

💬 Language lessons: language learning is what we’re all about! We’ll cover language classes for you to learn Spanish, English or Portuguese.

🩺 Health Insurance: we offer an optional health insurance through Adeslas, featuring competitive rates to ensure your well-being.

🧠 Mental Health Support: we offer you 4 free TherapySide sessions to support your self-awareness and well-being

💳 Flexible compensation: you'll be able to include your monthly expenses in meals and transportations into your payroll (we use Cobee).

🍲 Meal allowances: every month, you will receive a 60€ allowance on your Cobee card for you to spend on the restaurants and food delivery services.

🖥 Home office setup: you'll have a 400€ allowance in your first payroll to set up your home office and a 35€ monthly allowance for remote expenses.

🙌 Feedback culture: feedback is the breakfast of champions, and we take it seriously! We have a real-time and honest feedback culture, and a formal 360º assessment every 6 months.




If you think you don't tick all the boxes, we'd still love to hear from you. Nobody checks every box, and we are looking for someone excited to join the team!

Through play and interactive technology, Lingokids delivers premium, modern learning through educational subjects and life skills so kids can thrive as confident, conscious, resilient, lifelong learners — ready for school and today’s ever-changing world.

Title: Data Analyst - Marketing Databases
Description:
Kiteris es una empresa joven y ágil dedicada a brindar servicios de gestión de servicios y proyectos TI de integración de software, basados en la entrega de excelencia, la calidad de nuestro equipo y la aportación de valor a través de la especialización y la innovación. Estamos ubicados en España y Portugal, pero trabajamos para diferentes clientes en Europa y LATAM.




Estamos buscando un perfil Data Analyst en la zona de Madrid para unirse al equipo de un importante cliente multinacional con presencia en más de 100 países, uno de los mayores grupos globales del sector de la publicidad y la comunicación. Trabajarás en un modelo híbrido, asistiendo a las oficinas del cliente dos veces por semana y teletrabajando los días restantes.




¿Cuáles serán tus tareas?

Analizarás las fuentes de datos de marketing para diseñar correctamente la integración de las fuentes de datos, con un enfoque BigData.
Te coordinarás con los stakeholders de las plataformas y proyectos.
Serás responsable del desarrollo de software para plataformas BigData en entorno Cloud.




¿Qué habilidades buscamos en el perfil?

Requisitos:

Experiencia en SQL.
Experiencia previa con fuentes de datos de marketing: Google Marketing Platform (Google Ads, CM 360, DV 360, Search Ads 360, Sizmek); Facebook Ads, Facebook Business Manager, Sprinklr, Paragone/MakeMeReach; Otros DSPs (Mediamath, Xandr/AppNexus, Adoble, Teads); DoubleVerify, IAS, MOAT.
Industria de agencias de medios.
Alto nivel de inglés.

Valorable:

Conocimientos de lenguajes de programación, especialmente Python.
Google Cloud Platform, Cloud stacks.
Git(Lab), gestión de código fuente.




¿Qué ofrecemos?

Contrato indefinido.
Revisión salarial continuada.
Formación continua personalizada.
Clases de inglés.
Seguro médico privado.
Plan de carrera dentro de la empresa. Desarrollo profesional y personal basado en la experiencia en los proyectos y en la colaboración con nuestros compañeros.
Entorno de trabajo joven y dinámico.
Participación en proyectos con empresas líderes a nivel mundial.
Incorporación a un excelente equipo humano.

Title: Data Analyst - Banking
Description:
Skill Farm Members are invited to apply for the following role:

Responsibilities:

As a Data Analyst, you will proactively connect Business areas and understand their needs, their services and products functioning and the data ecosystem, and can generate accurate data driven analysis and recommendations, asÉ

Product analysis trends to increase sales conversion, reduce product attrition, improve digital funnels, support recurrent or ad hoc inbound/ outbound communication campaigns, etc.

Customer analysis to understand customer behavior, customer life time value, determine customer segmentation and create customer evolution forecast.

Support and advice business on their reporting needs and any other analytical need.

Skills & Qualifications:

Full proficiency in Excel, SAS and SQL (knowledge of other programming languages such as R or Python will be appreciated).

At least 3-6 years of experience in a comparable role, transforming data to extract key business insights using statistical/analytical concepts.

Your communication skills enable you to work together with many different parties throughout our organization.

Willing and able to learn and to improve your technical and your interpersonal skills.

Customer centric.

Fluent English will be appreciated.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
RightHand, compañía especializada en atracción del talento digital y contratación, estamos colaborando en la búsqueda de un Data Analyst con nuestro cliente, consultoría internacional que diseña soluciones de negocio y crecimiento a través de la data, tecnología y creatividad desde 2012. Actualmente, están en pleno crecimiento y por ello, a día de hoy abarcan cinco países: Italia, (Milán, Torino y Roma), España-Madrid, Serbia-Belgrado, USA-NewYork y México-Ciudad de México. Estamos buscando incorporar en el equipo a una persona que quiera seguir creciendo y desarrollándose profesionalmente con ellos dentro del área de Data.




Funciones y Responsabilidades:

Definir análisis de datos para proporcionar insights que añadan valor a nuestros clientes.
Estudiar el "customer journey" online del usuario para optimizar sus flujos y procesos.
Diseñar soluciones de medición digital personalizadas según las necesidades del cliente, estableciendo KPIs, Dashboards y guías de etiquetado.
Brindar soporte y recomendaciones en la configuración de herramientas de medición y tagging.
Demostrar una sólida capacidad para interpretar datos, analizar problemas y presentar soluciones.
Poseer un conocimiento avanzado en Google Marketing Platform: Google Analytics 4, Google Tag Manager y Looker Studio.
Elaborar planes de medición: definición de DataLayer, creación de guía de etiquetado y validación junto a los equipos de IT.
Mantener una comunicación efectiva con los equipos de IT y Medios.
Gestionar las tareas y al equipo a cargo para la ejecución de los proyectos.
Crear dashboards en herramientas de visualización de datos.
Elaborar informes personalizados en herramientas de medición.
Tener un dominio avanzado en la elaboración de hojas de cálculo.




Si cumples con los requisitos y estás listo para un nuevo desafío en tu carrera, ¡esperamos recibir tu aplicación!

Title: KPI Analyst
Description:
Here at CORUS we are looking for a KPI Analyst to join our team in an international project.




The candidate’s key responsibilities will focus on collecting, maintaining, forecasting and reporting our KPIs.




Location: remote from Spain.




Duration: Six months (it might extend).







Your Role

As KPI Analyst you will:

Raising awareness, providing guidance and training to the organization on key dimensions and insights of our program to drive actions.
Develop all KPI reporting required for: Business Review preparation, annual and 3-year target setting, annual target assessment, HR reporting, Finance reporting, Investor Relations reporting, ad hoc requests (Bloomberg index, Dow Jones sustainability etc.).
Forecast and scenario planning as the year progresses or given changes in KPI structure e.g. volume changes.
Contribute to the quarterly Action Program reporting ensuring accurate and timely inputs and results which highlight gaps in performance.
Developing and maintain an annual calendar of KPI reporting reflecting business processes, key decision points and business investment impacting KPI performance.
Drive the combination of data sources to link metric with Financial KPIs strengthening relevance to decision making and impact on performance e.g. data modelling or correlation analysis linking KPIs with financials.
Develop and maintain a systematic database which accurately maintains KPI targets and performance and enables clear access for the appropriate stakeholders.
Translate analytic insights into concrete actionable recommendations, drawing conclusions for business improvement and influencing strategy effectively.




Required Skills and Experience

As KPI Analyst your skills and qualifications will include:

Passionate and curious about data analysis & identifying insights to facilitate action planning.
Ability to work with larger sets of data (like Excel, SPSS,...) to provide additional/ad-hoc analysis (creating cuts of data based on different stakeholder requirements in addition to agency results packs).
Analytical mindset with ability to translate from numbers to business implications.
Bachelor's or master's degree (e.g., in business studies/administration, research, data science, psychology, behaviour science, customer or change management), 5 years+ of experience in analytics role.
Experience of managing and delivering KPIs and analytics.
Experience of building systematic processes to ensure accurate and timely reporting to all levels within the organization.
Strong attention to detail and focus on accuracy avoiding errors.
Experience of conducting statistical analytics e.g. correlation or modelling to combined customer and financial data.




What do we offer:

Remote work from Spain.
Flexible remuneration and a personalized training plan.
People-focused team.
Dynamic work environment, with real possibilities for professional growth.
International projects of high technological value.




At CORUS we are very conscious of the importance of respecting diversity. No one will be excluded from this call for applications on the grounds of race, colour, age, sex, marital status, ideology, political opinions, nationality, religion, sexual orientation and/or any other personal, physical or social condition. This process is aimed at choosing the best professionals through a selection process based exclusively on merit and skills.

Show more
HTML:
Here at CORUS we are looking for a KPI Analyst to join our team in an international project.


The candidate’s key responsibilities will focus on collecting, maintaining, forecasting and reporting our KPIs.


Location: remote from Spain.


Duration: Six months (it might extend).



Your Role

As KPI Analyst you will:

  • Raising awareness, providing guidance and training to the organization on key dimensions and insights of our program to drive actions.
  • Develop all KPI reporting required for: Business Review preparation, annual and 3-year target setting, annual target assessment, HR reporting, Finance reporting, Investor Relations reporting, ad hoc requests (Bloomberg index, Dow Jones sustainability etc.).
  • Forecast and scenario planning as the year progresses or given changes in KPI structure e.g. volume changes.
  • Contribute to the quarterly Action Program reporting ensuring accurate and timely inputs and results which highlight gaps in performance.
  • Developing and maintain an annual calendar of KPI reporting reflecting business processes, key decision points and business investment impacting KPI performance.
  • Drive the combination of data sources to link metric with Financial KPIs strengthening relevance to decision making and impact on performance e.g. data modelling or correlation analysis linking KPIs with financials.
  • Develop and maintain a systematic database which accurately maintains KPI targets and performance and enables clear access for the appropriate stakeholders.
  • Translate analytic insights into concrete actionable recommendations, drawing conclusions for business improvement and influencing strategy effectively.


Required Skills and Experience

As KPI Analyst your skills and qualifications will include:

  • Passionate and curious about data analysis & identifying insights to facilitate action planning.
  • Ability to work with larger sets of data (like Excel, SPSS,...) to provide additional/ad-hoc analysis (creating cuts of data based on different stakeholder requirements in addition to agency results packs).
  • Analytical mindset with ability to translate from numbers to business implications.
  • Bachelor's or master's degree (e.g., in business studies/administration, research, data science, psychology, behaviour science, customer or change management), 5 years+ of experience in analytics role.
  • Experience of managing and delivering KPIs and analytics.
  • Experience of building systematic processes to ensure accurate and timely reporting to all levels within the organization.
  • Strong attention to detail and focus on accuracy avoiding errors.
  • Experience of conducting statistical analytics e.g. correlation or modelling to combined customer and financial data.


What do we offer:

  • Remote work from Spain.
  • Flexible remuneration and a personalized training plan.
  • People-focused team.
  • Dynamic work environment, with real possibilities for professional growth.
  • International projects of high technological value.


At CORUS we are very conscious of the importance of respecting diversity. No one will be excluded from this call for applications on the grounds of race, colour, age, sex, marital status, ideology, political opinions, nationality, religion, sexual orientation and/or any other personal, physical or social condition. This process is aimed at choosing the best professionals through a selection process based exclusively on merit and skills.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who are we?

We are South Europe Technologies (S.ET); the IT, Data and Operations Shared Service Center of BNP Paribas Personal Finance, with delivery centers in Spain and Portugal, providing the best solutions to BNPP PF entities around the world such as Cetelem (specialized, between others, in financial partnership of major retailers, consumer goods companies and car dealerships).

Among Other Services, Our Portfolio Is Composed Of


Applications Management (Architecture, Project Management, Development, and Quality Assurance).
IT Risks & Cybersecurity Services.
Platforms Management.
Data Analytics and AI.
Operations.



Our offices are in Spain (Madrid) and Portugal (Lisbon, Porto). The company brings together over 200+ employees, with expertise in various technologies (Java, .Net, Python, Tibco, APIGee) and other operational roles (Functional Analyst, Project Manager, Business Analyst, Auto Stock Financing operators). We keep growing!

Our consistent track record of services delivery means comfort for our customers and opportunities for our employees.

You will find SE.T to be full of energy and an Inclusive Workplace in which you truly can make a difference.

Would you like to join our international team that delivers end-to-end solutions (applications and operations activities) to businesses of BNP Paribas Personal Finance Group entities around the world?

In a context of maintaining the high level of existing activities while growing the number of international customers, we are looking for our Data Analyst.

Mission

We are searching for the best talent to provide analytical and reporting support to the Data Office perimeter to optimize decision making and develop cross-functional data products.

Main Responsibilities


Perform data analysis: Provide conclusions, propose improvements, identify, or solve problems, or investigate business questions based on data.
Reporting: Implement and analyze data plans based on the measurement needs of your internal customers. Automate reports, design, and manage the publication of dashboards on visualization tools such as Power BI and Tableau.
Technically responsible for the data domains under the responsibility of the Data Office: Support to the definition and implementation of controls, management of registrations and modifications of the necessary views in the Information Center/Datahub, etc.
Manage the technical development of analytical products by coordinating resources from Central analytical Hubs: Reporting, ML models, ad-hoc analysis, data exploration, etc.
Contribute to the proposals on technological platforms and governance model elaborated by the Data Office with its opinion and experience.



What We Are Looking For


Academic background: Degree / Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Statistics, Big Data or equivalent experience.
You have two years of proven working experience in the data transformation to extract key insights using statistical/analytical concepts.
Proven experience in execution and automation of ETL's based on SAS, SQL or others.
Knowledge of Phyton, Dataiku and Dremio.
You are engaged in day-to-day activities.
You have a transformation mindset, looking for the excellency.
You are a Problem-Solving and Decision-Making person, who:
Demonstrates advanced analytical and diagnostic skills dealing with issues that are ambiguous, lack known precedent or appear contradictory.
Sees the big picture and is fully aware of technology and business directions.
Has department, corporate and group objectives in focus while identifying and removing barriers.



Skills


Communication skills - Oral & Written.
Ability to collaborate/Teamwork.
Proactivity.
Organized, efficient, and able to meet deadlines.
Gives and welcomes feedback. Puts success of the business and team above own interest.
Experience in the Finance sector is a plus.
Management of the MS Office package (Excel, Power Point, SharePoint, One Note knowledge).
Management of visualization tools such as Tableau and Power BI.
Fluent level of English and Spanish is a must. Any other European language is nice to have.



About Our Culture

We are proud to create, maintain and develop business solutions for BNP Paribas Group entities around the world, while keeping a high level of service and providing added value to our customers.

Working in an Inclusive and Multicultural environment, we encourage everyone to develop their talents and skills, offering various career opportunities and internal mobility programs, within local SET teams or in other entities within the Group.

We value our employees' experience by keeping a well-balanced environment with flexibility regarding the work schedule and care for everyone's personal time.

We embraced a hybrid way of working because we believe social connection always adds value to our day-to-day activities.

Benefits


Training programs, career plans and internal mobility opportunities, national and international thanks to our presence in different countries.
Diversity and Inclusion Committee that ensures an inclusive work environment. In recent years, several employee communities have been created to organize diversity and inclusion awareness actions (PRIDE, We Generations and MixCity).
Corporate volunteering program (1 Million Hours 2 Help) in which employees can dedicate time out of their working hours to volunteer activities.
Flexible compensation plan.
Hybrid telecommuting model (50%).
31 vacation days.



Diversity and inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas Group in Spain is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Who We Are

Cint is a pioneer in research technology (ResTech). Our customers use the Cint platform to post questions and get answers from real people to build business strategies, confidently publish research, accurately measure the impact of digital advertising, and more. The Cint platform is built on a programmatic marketplace, which is the world’s largest, with nearly 300 million respondents in over 150 countries who consent to sharing their opinions, motivations, and behaviours.

We are feeding the world’s curiosity!

Job Description

The Opportunity

Reporting to the VP of Platform Intelligence, the Data Analyst – Platform Intelligence is part of a cross-departmental discipline at Cint that provides insight on how our algorithms influence feasibility, delivery, and financial performance. These insights are used to improve our products to achieve financial targets and ensure our platform is optimized to deliver at full potential.

The incumbent will collaborate closely with Product and Technology stakeholders and will consult with Commercial, Operations and Finance teams to understand, explain, and predict how platform algorithms affect clients and partners.

What You Will Do


Develop a comprehensive, nuanced, and predictive understanding of sample ecosystem dynamics (price elasticity, demand/supply clearing) and their underlying mechanics
With Cint’s Product Managers and engineers, enhance our products to confidently achieve predicted outcomes and optimize delivery
Provide advisory support to Product Development teams for subjects related to Platform Intelligence and/or insight driven product development
Create deliverables that express ecosystem dynamics simply and effectively to senior-level audiences, such as:
Visualizations of ecosystem metrics and trend analysis
Trend reports that track the impact and effectiveness of yield operations over time
Decision support documents for high-risk changes
Recommendations for development of Supply pipeline for commercial teams
Recommendations for development of Demand pipeline for commercial teams

Qualifications

What We Are Looking For:


Few years of working experience with pricing analytics and marketing or behavioral analytics
Previous experience with online market research methods/products is strongly preferred.
Explaining and defending analytical techniques in front of lay audiences
Experience with SQL and in working with large-scale databases
Experience with statistical computing languages like Python, R (statistical and data manipulation packages)
Experience in creating and maintaining dashboards using reporting or BI tool
Highly accountable self-starter and quick learner who is driven to deliver
Multiculturally competent
Excellent written and verbal communication with the ability to create data stories to drive product innovation
Ability to understand the big picture as well ensure the accuracy of details
Passionate about driving value using data and technology


Additional Information

Our Values

Collaboration is our superpower


We uncover rich perspectives across the world
Success happens together
We deliver across borders.


Innovation is in our blood


We’re pioneers in our industry
Our curiosity is insatiable
We bring the best ideas to life.


We Do What We Say


We’re accountable for our work and actions
Excellence comes as standard
We’re open, honest and kind, always.


We are caring


We learn from each other’s experiences
Stop and listen; every opinion matters
We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion.


More About Cint

In June 2021, Cint acquired Berlin-based GapFish – the world’s largest ISO certified online panel community in the DACH region – and in January 2022, completed the acquisition of US-based Lucid – a programmatic research technology platform that provides access to first-party survey data in over 110 countries.

Cint Group AB (publ), listed on Nasdaq Stockholm, this growth has made Cint a strong global platform with teams across its many global offices, including Stockholm, London, New York, New Orleans, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney. (www.cint.com)

Title: DATA ANALYST - CONTROLLING
Description:
En Mango inspiramos y unimos mediante nuestra pasión por el estilo y la cultura. Estamos en más de 115 países y nuestra presencia online se extiende a más de 110 países. Nuestro equipo está formado por personas de 112 nacionalidades y en un 78% por mujeres.

Buscamos un/a

DATA ANALYST - CONTROLLING

¿CÓMO SERIA TU DÍA A DÍA EN MANGO?

Para formar parte de nuestro equipo de Reporting dentro del departamento de Control de gestión buscamos un/a Data Analyst.

Participarás en proyectos con el objetivo de simplificar el acceso a la información, generar valor con los datos y capacitar a los usuarios de herramientas para acelerar la toma de decisiones.

Funciones


Participarás en proyectos con el objetivo de simplificar el acceso a la información, generar valor con los datos y capacitar a los usuarios de herramientas para acelerar la toma de decisiones
Crearás una red de contactos multidisciplinares en la organización para garantizar el éxito de los proyectos
Darás soporte en la elaboración y análisis del reporting mensual financiero
Darás soporte en la creación y mantenimiento de dashboards en diferentes herramientas de BI: Looker, PowerBI y SAP BO
Liderarás la automatización y simplificación del reporting mensual financiero a través de PowerBI
Realizarás análisis complejos para permitir la toma de decisiones basada en datos
Sintetizarás los datos procedentes de múltiples fuentes y desarrollar hipótesis
Proporcionarás ideas clave, recomendaciones y presentarlas a los diferentes interlocutores


¿QUÉ ESPERAMOS DE TI?


Master en Ingeniería, ADE, Estadística o Matemáticas
Experiencia mínima de 1-2 años en Análisis de datos, consultoría de BI o consultoría de negocio
Conocimientos en SQL, herramientas de BI y lenguajes de programación
Dominio de Excel
Buscamos personas con Learning Agility, influyentes, analíticas, rigurosas, con buenas dotes de comunicación, capacidad resolutiva y altamente orientada a cliente interno & negocio
Orientación a negocio y mentalidad resolutiva: capacidad de analizar, interpretar, sintetizar y comunicar impactos y tendencias a través de los datos


¿QUÉ NOS HACE ESPECIALES?


Horario Flexible (entrada de 8h a 9h30 y salida de 17h a 18h30), jornada intensiva los viernes (de 8h a 9h hasta las 14h / 15h) y mayoría de vigilias de festivos
Posibilidad de Teletrabajo
Descuento en todas nuestras líneas (Woman, Man, Kids, Teen & Home) además de un Market de muestrario para renovar tu armario dos veces al año
Servicio de comedor y cocina en las instalaciones de central. La empresa subvenciona parte del menú diario, así como los artículos de cafetería
Retribución flexible con ventajas fiscales: seguro médico, formación, descuento comedor, guarderías etc.
Transporte gratuito de empresa desde Barcelona y el Vallés
Oportunidades constantes de desarrollo con retos muy variados que generan aprendizaje en el puesto de trabajo y cursos específicos en función de tus necesidades
Workshops, meetups, comunidades de prácticas, team buildings y company meetings sobre transformación digital, moda y actividades de nuestros equipos
Servicio médico propio, servicio de fisioterapia una vez a la semana, sala de fitness y vestuarios en nuestras oficinas centrales
Formarás parte de una empresa líder en el sector de la moda, dinámica, en plena innovación, con gran concienciación y realizando acciones hacia la sostenibilidad con un ambiente de trabajo cercano, inspirador y ambicioso


You got it?

We like you!

Title: Data Analyst - PowerBI
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
En BETWEEN apostamos por ofrecerte las mejores oportunidades dentro del área tecnológica. Contamos con un equipo de más de 800 profesionales. Ser parte de nuestro equipo significa formar parte de una comunidad multicultural, con acceso a oportunidades de crecimiento y desarrollo profesional, generando impacto.




Si quieres desarrollar tus capacidades en un entorno internacional, apostando por trabajar en soluciones de I+D tanto en Ingeniería como en IT, ¡este es tu próximo destino!

Damos soporte en una gran variedad de áreas como Operaciones, Desarrollo de producto, Compras, Firmware, Software, Business Intelligence, Gestión, Transformación digital, ¡y muchas más! Además, desarrollamos soluciones tecnológicas a medida desde nuestros Hubs Tecnológicos.

La persona seleccionada desarrollará soluciones de Business Intelligence para negocio.




Deberás registrarte a través de Talent Clue, nuestro ATS.




¿Qué haré? Estas serán tus funciones principales:

Te encargarás del desarrollo de reports en PowerBI, desarrollando el modelado de los datos, transformación, creación de métricas y visualización.
Realizarás automatizaciones mediante PowerAutomate
Realizarás los DataFlows
Desarrollarás querys en SQL y extracción de datos
Realizarás mantenimiento y resolución de incidencias de los dashboards

¿Cómo lo haré?

Tendrás horario flexible (8h de Lunes a Viernes)
Podrás trabajar en modelo híbrido (2 días en oficina).
Trabajarás en un entorno internacional.




Requisitos

Grado en Ingeniería, Informática, Telecomunicaciones, ADE y tecnología, ADE, etc.
Experiencia de 3 años en PowerBI, Dax, Modelado de datos, PowerQuery, Power Automate y DataFlows.
Experiencia de 3 años en SQL
Inglés avanzado







Si eres BETWEENER obtendrás estos beneficios:

Salario: 27.000 a 35.000 b/a
Seguro médico con Sanitas.
Dispondrás de oportunidades de formación y desarrollo profesional: Idiomas, cursos en Udemy, Certificaciones, Programa The Power Business School y Bootcamps especializados (Agile, DevOps, IA & Big Data, Ciberseguridad, etc.).
Contarás con un equipo de Talento que te acompañará durante toda tu experiencia con nosotros. ¡Haremos un café una vez al mes! Así, mantendremos el contacto.
Pondremos a tu disposición un amplio abanico de retos y proyectos acordes con tus objetivos personales y profesionales.
Posibilidad de elegir cómo obtener parte de tu salario gracias a las ventajas fiscales de nuestra Retribución Flexible (Ticket restaurant, Ticket transporte, Ticket guardería).
Descuentos para acceder a centros de Fitness con Gympass.
Acceso a nuestro Club de Descuentos: Inspiring Benefits.
Programa de recomendación remunerado de Talento.
En BETWEEN, la igualdad de oportunidades es uno de nuestros valores. Nuestro compromiso es contratar al mejor talento independientemente de su religión, sexo, edad y personas con otras capacidades y promover su desarrollo profesional y personal.

Ser parte de nuestro equipo significa formar parte de una comunidad multicultural, con acceso a oportunidades de crecimiento y desarrollo profesional, generando impacto.


Si quieres desarrollar tus capacidades en un entorno internacional, apostando por trabajar en soluciones de I+D tanto en Ingeniería como en IT, ¡este es tu próximo destino!

Damos soporte en una gran variedad de áreas como Operaciones, Desarrollo de producto, Compras, Firmware, Software, Business Intelligence, Gestión, Transformación digital, ¡y muchas más! Además, desarrollamos soluciones tecnológicas a medida desde nuestros Hubs Tecnológicos.

Title: Data Analyst / Scientist Júnior en Modelos de Innovación de Riesgos
Description:
Somos Banco Sabadell




Más de 14.000 personas que trabajamos en equipo compartiendo nuestro esfuerzo para alcanzar una meta. Nos caracterizamos por nuestra implicación, espíritu de colaboración y dinamismo. Somos una entidad que en su larga y exitosa trayectoria ha sabido combinar la tradición en la forma de hacer banca, la visión a largo plazo, el crecimiento y la innovación. Una marca fuerte y reconocida en el entorno, para más de 11 millones de clientes que valoran la calidad de nuestros productos y nuestra apuesta por gestionar “su experiencia” como cliente.

Nuestra razón de ser es ayudar a personas y empresas a hacer realidad sus proyectos, anticipándonos y ocupándonos de que tomen las mejores decisiones económicas, a través de nuestros valores: el compromiso, no conformismo, profesionalidad, eficacia, empatía y franqueza.

Y además, lo hacemos mediante una gestión responsable y comprometida con el medio ambiente.

¡Únete a nosotros!




¿Qué estamos buscando?




Actualmente buscamos un perfil proactivo, con visión de negocio y habilidades interpersonales que se integre en un equipo que analiza la adecuación de diversos modelos de riesgo crediticio asociados al segmento de negocio de Banca Particulares de Banco Sabadell.




Hablemos del proyecto...




Tu misión se centrará en dar soporte a la medición y anticipación del comportamiento del cliente, mediante el desarrollo de metodologías analíticas avanzadas, que ayuden a predecir y entender cómo es, qué hace, cómo será y qué hará el cliente, repercutiendo en acciones que simplifiquen los procesos de admisión, seguimiento y recuperación, incrementando su eficiencia – eficacia y ayudando a generar el margen incremental creciente de Sabadell España.




Entre tus responsabilidades principales se encontrarán:




Colaborarás en el desarrollo de modelos enfocados a potenciar la creación de negocio mediante metodologías analíticas y de Machine Learning.
Desarrollarás hipótesis que permitan diseñar y probar experimentos analíticos, con el objetivo de identificar áreas de oportunidad y medir el impacto potencial de nuevas iniciativas.
Elaborarás la documentación de modelos requerida para su presentación a comités.
Participarás en diversos proyectos de la Dirección que afecten a los modelos tanto para la creación de negocio como para anticipar el comportamiento de los clientes.
Revisarás y mejorarás los modelos actuales en función de las directrices de cumplimento normativo interno y externo exigido por los reguladores.




¿Qué valoramos de tu candidatura?




Que tengas estudios superiores en ámbito Técnico (Matemáticas, Estadística, Ingeniería, Física o similar) empresarial (ADE, Economía o similar).
Master o Postgrado en Finanzas Cuantitativas o similar.
Experiencia mínima de 1-2 años en creación y mantenimiento de modelos de riesgo crediticio en sector Banca.
Que estés habituado y/o aportes experiencia en gestión de información, análisis de BBDD y elaboración de informes.
Valoraremos experiencia en creación de modelos estadísticos con diferentes metodologías.
Que conozcas lenguajes de programación estadística (SAS-SQL, R, Phyton), así como dominio del paquete Office.
Valoraremos que aportes un correcto nivel de Inglés (sobre todo a nivel de comprensión).




Banco Sabadell está comprometido en promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, procurando el desarrollo profesional de la plantilla y garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección, formación y promoción ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminación por motivo de género, edad, orientación sexual, religión, etnia o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social.

Banco Sabadell forma parte de la red de empresas con el distintivo de “Igualdad en la Empresa” otorgado por el Ministerio de Igualdad.




Queda totalmente prohibida la reproducción total o parcial de cualquiera de sus apartados en cualquier soporte sin el consentimiento por escrito del Grupo Banco Sabadell.

Show more

Title: Data Visualization Analyst (Multinacional)
Description:
En VISEO nos diferenciamos por la participación en proyectos innovadores de soluciones Cloud, usando tecnologías Microsoft, líderes en el mercado y donde actualmente somos Partners y aportamos más de 490 certificaciones.

Esta es una gran oportunidad para formar parte de una multinacional presente en los 5 continentes como Data Visualization Analyst.

Tu Rol:


Generación de visualización e interpretación de datos (diseño de sistemas, tableros, gráficos de información, mapeo, herramientas de datos) dando sentido al flujo de análisis y storytelling que ayude a las áreas de negocio.
Liderar junto con el Product Owner las relaciones con los equipos de negocio (comerciales y/o de operaciones), para asegurar un pleno entendimiento del área.
Apoyar a su equipo en la resolución de problemas y desafíos relacionados con reportería y análisis de la información.


Tu perfil:


Profesional con 3 años de experiencia laboral previa como analista de datos utilizando herramientas de visualización como Tableau, Power BI o similares.
Formación superior en negocios, matemáticas, económicas, finanzas, estadística o ingeniería.
Se valora experiencia en sector aéreo, turismo y viajes.
Buena capacidad de comunicación e influencia para interactuar con distintas areas de negocio.
Orientación a resultados, trabajo colaborativo y en equipo.
Experiencia y solvencia con lenguajes de consulta de datos (p. ej., SQL).
Valorable nivel de inglés alto.


Tendrás las siguientes responsabilidades en seguridad dentro de la compañía:


Acceso a la información confidencial relativa al cliente del que es responsable.
Solicitud de medidas / usuarios.
Observancia del cumplimiento de las políticas de seguridad y las políticas internas.

Title: Analista de datos Jr
Description:
Buscamos perfiles Licenciados o Ingenieros con inglés B2 para participar en el programa de formación con empleo garantizado que hemos lanzado conjuntamente con la escuela MOA. Los seleccionados recibirán una formación intensiva de 105 horas en Analítica digital y, a la finalización de la formación, se incorporarán a la plantilla de una de las empresas tecnológicas que participan en el programa.




Oferta laboral:

El salario anual de entrada será de entre 20.000 euros y 24.000 euros
Ubicación: Madrid/Barcelona, resto de España consultar
Tipo de contrato: Indefinido
Modalida: Remoto o Híbrido dependiendo del perfil




Requisitos:

Es imprescindible contar con alguna de las siguientes titulaciones: Licenciados o Ingenieros
Nivel B2 de Inglés
Muchas ganas de estudiar para saltar al sector digital
No hace falta tener experiencia

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Smadex is a leading advertising technology company founded in Barcelona in 2011 and sold to American-based and stock-listed Entravision in 2018 (NYSE::EVC). We are a fully transparent platform built with top technology, countless programmatic management features and powerful machine learning algorithms to help advertisers grow their business at scale. We are currently considered one of the top mobile ad-tech companies in the world.

We are looking for a Data Analyst with proven experience in Python,SQL, analytics and knowledge of statistics to join our Data Science Team. Working alongside our Data Engineers, the candidate should be communicative and analytical, in order to answer the complex questions that Product and Campaign performance are facing. For this purpose we use tons of data available to get powerful insights to resolve them, creating effective strategies to help improve the Smadex platform!

The role is based in Barcelona!

Your tasks and responsibilities:


Analyze large, complex data sets containing the behaviour of millions of mobile users and Apps worldwide to address strategic questions
Obtain and Report insights from our Product´s performance (ML, Audiences, Creatives, Supply, etc) in order to make decisions that will impact revenue. Have one´s say!
Develop automated dashboards and processes to ensure data influence decisions at all levels of the company
Working cross-functionally with business and technical teams to support product performance


Skills and requirements:


+2 years of experience as a Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Proven working knowledge of Python, SQL and large data sets, understanding of analytic methodologies for data evaluation
Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Engineering or Business
Strong knowledge of basic statistics concepts
Strong analytical skills with the ability to get insights
Outstanding communication and reporting skills
Excellent command of Microsoft Excel (Power Pivot & Power Query)
Excellent communication skills in English both written and spoken are mandatory
Strong experience with SQL for data exploratory analysis
Experience with A/B testing
R, Superset, PowerBI experience is a plus
Knowledge of the ad-tech industry is a plus


Please note that we do NOT provide VISA sponsorship. Candidates without a legal permit to work in Spain won't be considered.

What is in it for you:


Integrate a highly motivated and young team
Great compensation package
Top location at the heart of Barcelona with a rooftop terrace, Barbeque, and a fully stocked fridge
Great work-life balance: work from home (2 days per week), flexible hours
LinkedIn Learning
Learning and training opportunities
Meal vouchers - TicketRestaurant monthly allowance
Monthly gym allowance to use in up to 30 DIR gyms around the city
Monthly TGIF events
Regular team-building events
Fun and friendly work environment with talented marketers and engineers from over 28countries
And more!


Powered by JazzHR
