Title: BI Data Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Job Summary This role is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining business intelligence solutions using Microsoft Power BI. The role involves analyzing and interpreting complex data sets to provide actionable insights that support business decision-making and enhance organizational performance. The role also includes developing automated processes and integrating analytics to drive efficiencies and innovation. Effective communication and collaboration with business stakeholders are essential to ensure alignment and successful presentation of developed solutions.

Responsibilities


Develops and maintains Power BI reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate data-driven insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Analyzes complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform business decisions.
Designs and implements automated data processing and analytics workflows to improve efficiency and accuracy.
Partners with business stakeholders to understand their requirements and translate them into actionable BI solutions.
Ensures data quality and integrity by implementing robust data governance and validation processes.
Collaborates with data engineering teams to build and maintain data pipelines, ensuring seamless integration of data from various sources.
Leads and mentors a team of BI developers, providing guidance, training, and support to junior team members.
Communicates project progress, challenges, and solutions to stakeholders effectively, ensuring alignment and timely delivery.
Represents the BI team in cross-functional projects, driving the implementation of BI solutions and ensuring their alignment with business objectives.
Continuously evaluates and improves existing BI methodologies, staying updated with the latest trends and technologies in the field.


Education & Experience Recommended


Four-year or Graduate Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Data Science, Business Analytics, or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience.
Typically has 4-7 years of work experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or a related field, or an advanced degree with 3-5 years of work experience.


Preferred Certifications


Microsoft Power BI Certification
SQL Certification


Knowledge & Skills


Microsoft Power BI
SQL (Programming Language)
Data Analysis
Data Visualization
Data Warehousing
Business Intelligence
Data Governance
Automation (e.g., Power Automate, RPA tools)
Statistical Analysis
Basic knowledge of programming languages (e.g., Python, R) is a plus
Effective Communication
Project Management
Stakeholder Management
Results Orientation
Learning Agility
Customer Centricity


Impact & Scope


Impacts multiple teams and may act as a team or project leader, providing direction to team activities and facilitating information validation and team decision-making processes.
Show more

  • Microsoft Power BI Certification
  • SQL Certification

Knowledge & Skills

  • Microsoft Power BI
  • SQL (Programming Language)
  • Data Analysis
  • Data Visualization
  • Data Warehousing
  • Business Intelligence
  • Data Governance
  • Automation (e.g., Power Automate, RPA tools)
  • Statistical Analysis
  • Basic knowledge of programming languages (e.g., Python, R) is a plus
  • Effective Communication
  • Project Management
  • Stakeholder Management
  • Results Orientation
  • Learning Agility
  • Customer Centricity

Impact & Scope

  • Impacts multiple teams and may act as a team or project leader, providing direction to team activities and facilitating information validation and team decision-making processes.

Title: Climate Data Analyst
Description:
Climate Data Specialist, Zurich Resilience Solutions, 80%-100%

At Zurich Resilience Solutions (ZRS) we’re committed to supporting our customers and business partners through harnessing the expertise in our global network.

We have a brand new role to help shape and grow our business which is going from strength to strength.

Your role in our Climate Resilience team is to support in the development, and deployment of state-of-the-art risk assessment methods and tools. In this role you will be working closely with customer facing business units as well as internal technical functions within Zurich Insurance (e.g. Group Accumulation Management, Group Re, Commercial Insurance Underwriting) towards sourcing and developing climate data and tools for our customers. Your core responsibility in this role is to source, analyze, and visualize data sets (hazard, exposures, controls) to support in the assessment of natural hazards and climate change risks.

What You Will Do

As a Climate Data Specialist your main responsibilities will involve:

Technical Developments


Support the development and continuous update of climate and natural hazards data
Monitor global sustainability regulations and frameworks to identify needs in terms of climate data and develop these.
Support in the development of data processing and visualization tools


Customer Projects


Source and analyse data from internal and open-source databases.
Transform natural hazard and climate change exposure data into key messages and insights/conclusions to help customers build climate change resilience.


Communication


Creation, maintenance and internal sharing of natural hazard and climate change training and knowledge content
Facilitate climate data knowledge sharing across the CCRS community, as well as other internal stakeholders and customers


What You Bring

As Climate Data Specialist your skills and qualifications will ideally include:


Master’s degree in natural/environmental/atmospheric sciences.
Deep understanding of Climate Change and Natural Hazards science, models, and their practical implementation.
Experience in spatial data management, climate data, spatial analysis, and visualization, big datasets, transforming data into insights for decision-making.
The ability to clearly communicate complicated concepts in a concise and compelling manner to all levels of management and stakeholders of various levels of technical proficiency.
High level of proficiency in data analytics and tools for visualization of spatial data and software, e.g. Power BI, ArcGIS, and programming languages (R, Python, etc.).
Fluent in written and spoken English at a technical level with strong customer service orientation. Any other language is an asset.


Additional Information

We look forward to receiving your online application.

Zurich wants to attract the best talent and we acknowledge that talents might not always be available full-time. At Zurich we will consider requests for flexible working. Many of our employees work flexibly in a variety of ways. Please talk to us during the interview about the flexibility you may need.

Information for recruitment agencies

Zurich does not accept any applications from recruitment agencies for this position. We refuse any responsibility for unsolicited applications as well as any associated fees.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Company

Shalion is a data-driven company working for world-class manufacturers and brands worldwide. With its Digital Shelf Optimization and Retail Media solutions, Shalion provides innovative tools that facilitate e-commerce monitoring.

We, at Shalion, enable brands to make smarter business decisions in eCommerce, based on actionable data and insights providing information on online product prices, availability, share of search, etc. in more than 800 e-retailers and 50 different countries. Our client portfolio includes industry giants such as Heineken, Lego, Danone, and Nestlé.

The role

As a Data Analyst at Shalion, your responsibilities include:


Developing and maintaining client and internal dashboards in Looker.
Collaborating with Product teams to shape the product roadmap based on customer feedback and market insights.
Translating business requirements into technical tasks, ensuring timely delivery.
Working closely with Data Engineers to expand and enhance datasets, contributing to roadmap planning.
Ensuring data quality and consistency across dashboards.
Translating product questions into actionable insights.
Support the team in solving problems and challenges related to reporting and information analysis to create best practices in data usage and consumption.


Your profile should include the following:


2+ years of experience working as a data analyst or visualization expert.
Hands-on and strong working knowledge of SQL.
High experience level with modern visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau, Qlik Sense, or Power BI.
Solid statistical background.
Experience working with business stakeholders and engineers.
Experience in data modeling for visualization.
Communication, teamwork, and problem-solving skills.
Ability to structure information, analyze it, and extract data according to business needs


Ideally you will also have:


An advanced degree in a quantitative field such as math, physics, computer science, statistics, etc.
Experience with market research analysis.
Experience working with a modern cloud data warehouse (Redshift, Snowflake, BigQuery, or similar).
Knowledge of Git and command-line
Prior experience modeling data in LookML and dbt (data build tool)
Be fluent with one or more common data-related programming languages (Python or R).
UX skills.


Soft Skills:


Prioritization: Skillful at prioritizing tasks, gaining stakeholder buy-in, and resolving conflicts.
Resilience: Able to thrive in ambiguous situations and enjoy problem-solving.
Curiosity: Eagerness to learn and engage in constructive discussions.
Quality-oriented: Can discern data quality and value code testing for growth.


What We Offer You


The possibility to contribute to developing a company-wide data direction, processes, and standards.
Hybrid work: one remote day and four days of in-office work to boost our productivity and promote a work-life balance.
To be part of a high-performing team in a fast-paced, innovative environment.
Talented, diverse, and very friendly work environment;
The fast-growing project, where you can grow and develop
A challenging project, where you can have great contributions and impact
International environment with more than 10 nationalities
Fresh fruit every day
Office with a good location in Barcelona (Sarrià- Sant Gervasi).
Fixed-term contract.


Interview process


First interview HR screening
Second interview SQL assignment
Third interview CDO
Show more

Title: Data Analyst Apprentice
Description:
Barcelona, Spain

Hybrid

We are looking for an apprentice specialized in data analytics. Join a dynamic team in a complex Supply Chain and work for a leading perfumery company. We'll need you to leverage data in order to optimize supply chain, drive efficiency and enhance decision-making. We offer the chance to join a worldwide company promoting careers internally.

At dsm-firmenich people are at the heart of the company. We are committed to equal employment opportunities and value diversity in the workplace.

Your Key Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and organize data related to the supply chain, including data on suppliers, inventory, capacity, and Row materials.
Support regional IBP & operational processes, including inventory and supply chain management, Supply Planning, process management across AMET and EUR region.
Analyze data using statistical methods and software such as PBI, VBA, Python, or SQL to identify trends and patterns in the supply chain.
Create visualizations and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders, including senior management, developing dashboards to track progress over time.
Identify areas for improvement in the supply chain, such as reducing lead times, improving inventory management, and cost saving.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs). Stay up to date with industry trends and best practices in supply chain management and data analysis.


We bring


A rich history and a promising future of bold scientific innovation and passionate creation with our customers;
A space to grow by encouraging and supporting curiosity and an open mindset;
A culture that prioritizes safety and well-being, both physically and mentally;
A flexible work environment that empowers people to take accountability for their work and own the outcome;
Barrier-free communities within our organization where every employee is equally valued and respected – regardless of their background, beliefs, or identity;
A firm belief that working together with our customers is the key to achieving great things;


You bring


Master's degree in Statistics, Engineering, data scientist, or equivalent.
Critical thinking and proactive work style.
Analytical skills.
Pro-active, positive attitude, and willing to learn.
Proficiency in Excel, Power BI, and other data analysis tools, to create and operate reports.
Knowledge is some code language software (SQL/ Python/VBA/M)
English is must, French/Spanish is a plus
Show more

Title: Data Analytics Analyst
Description:
About The Role

We are seeking a skilled Data Analytics Analyst to support our data analysis and executive reporting initiatives. This position offers an opportunity to apply your expertise in data analytics while contributing to impactful projects within VTEX. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, excellent problem-solving skills, and a proven ability to drive insights in a dynamic environment.

Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and organize data from various sources to ensure data integrity.
Conduct in-depth quantitative analysis to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Develop and maintain data models and build beautiful dashboards using Power BI and Looker.
Generate comprehensive reports and presentations for internal stakeholders, providing clear and actionable recommendations.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and deliver data-driven solutions.
Continuously improve processes and tools to enhance data accuracy and reporting efficiency.


Who You Are


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Proficiency in Python and SQL for data analysis.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Looker and Power BI.
Proven ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
High attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality, accurate work.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively convey insights to stakeholders.
AWS Data Analytics Certification will be considered a plus.
If you have a portfolio, please share the link in your application. It will be considered a plus.


About VTEX

VTEX (NYSE: VTEX), the enterprise digital commerce platform for premier brands and retailers, is the leader in accelerating commerce transformation in Latin America and now expanding globally.

Our platform enables our customers to execute their commerce strategy, including building online stores, integrating and managing orders across channels, and creating marketplaces to sell products from third-party vendors. The VTEX platform is engineered to enterprise-level standards and features. We are trusted by more than 2,000 customers with over 2,500 active online stores across 32 countries, who rely on VTEX to connect with their consumers in a meaningful way. We have been the vendor of choice for numerous Fortune 500 companies in Latin America and are now becoming the global digital commerce vendor for enterprise brands, including Whirlpool, AB InBev, and Motorola.

According to IDC, VTEX is one of five vendors who "shaped the year 2020" and the fastest-growing digital commerce applications vendor in the top 20 market shares.

Benefits


Competitive compensation
Profit-sharing
Flexible work schedule
Possibility to join our equity program
Meal Allowance (Flash)
Transportation assistance
Health, dental, and life insurance
Child Care assistance
Extended parental leaves
Total partnership
Language scholarship: 65% subsidies in English, Spanish, Portuguese courses
Free shipping on 1000+ VTEX stores
Show more

Title: Data Analyst Intern, EMEA
Description:
What You'll Do:

As a member of our Solutions & Innovation Analytics team, you won't just analyze data; you'll be the cornerstone that connects groundbreaking ideas with real-world business applications. Here, your expertise will not only shape solutions but also empower our clients and commercial teams to make impactful decisions.

What You'll Do:


Data-Driven Innovation: Leverage cutting-edge tech like Hadoop, Vertica, Tableau, Git, Python, and SQL to transform complex business challenges into groundbreaking solutions.
Collaboration at Its Core: Work side by side with cross-functional teams to deliver insights that not only drive revenue but also foster client success.
Tech Playground: Immerse yourself in an environment where experimenting with advanced analytics tools isn't just encouraged, it's part of your daily work.
Diverse Projects: From user need identification to scaling complex data solutions, your role will be dynamic, impactful, and full of opportunities to innovate.



Who You Are:


A problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges.
Interested in solving data problems using Python & SQL, and enthusiastic about automating and scaling solutions.
Business-minded with a goal to turn data insights into actionable strategies.
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace.
Fluent in English and skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences.
Eligible to work in Spain with no restrictions.



Your Work Environment:


State-of-the-art open office with a cozy, collaborative vibe.
Flexible remote working options - balance your life the way you want.
A tech-forward, primarily digital workspace.
Choose your hours: start early or a bit later, as long as the work's done.
Need special work hours? Let's talk about it!



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: DATA ANALYST
Description:
¿Te apasiona el análisis de datos? ¿Quieres formar parte de un equipo dinámico y multidisciplinario en una empresa líder en el sector?




Nuestro cliente, destacada empresa multinacional líder en la fabricación de sistemas automotrices, está buscando un Data Analyst para su equipo de la zona de Barcelona. Esta empresa forma parte de un grupo reconocido a nivel internacional se caracteriza por su compromiso con la innovación y el desarrollo, lo que ofrece oportunidades únicas para crecer dentro de un entorno global.




¿Qué te ofrece el proyecto?

• Remuneración competitiva y contrato indefinido.

• Horario flexible .

• Oportunidades de desarrollo profesional y modalidad de teletrabajo híbrida.

• Ambiente de trabajo dinámico y equipo multidisciplinario.

• Beneficios por parte de la empresa.




¿Qué necesitas para hacer match?

• Licenciatura en Ciencias de la Computación, Sistemas de Información, Ingeniería de Datos o campo MIS equivalente

• Experiencia en el desarrollo de soluciones con aplicaciones como Power BI, SAP BusinessObjects, Oracle Business Intelligence y/o Alteryx Designer.

• Experiencia práctica en la construcción de soluciones de tableros en Power BI

• Experiencia práctica con un lenguaje de programación como Python, R, SQL o Matlab

• Habilidades moderadas a avanzadas con MS Office, particularmente Excel; se prefiere conocimiento de VBA, M y/o DAX.

• Experiencia en soporte de transformación de datos, estructuras de datos y metadatos

• Experiencia en el desarrollo de mejoras tangibles de procesos a través de la automatización

• Sólidas habilidades de gestión de proyectos y organizativas

• Creatividad para conceptualizar y desarrollar soluciones no tradicionales

• Nivel muy alto de comunicación en inglés, tanto hablado como escrito.




¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?

• Apoyar los esfuerzos de generación de informes de métricas de RR.HH. mediante el desarrollo de soluciones cuantitativas repetibles y eficientes

• Utilizar una variedad de métodos para recopilar inteligencia empresarial de fuentes internas y externas en un entorno común y transformarla en la estructura adecuada que favorezca el análisis

• Comunicar conceptos complejos a las partes interesadas no técnicas a lo largo de todo el ciclo analítico, desde la identificación de preguntas hasta la interpretación de resultados, incluidas las recomendaciones

• Apoyar el diseño, desarrollo, implementación y mantenimiento de una variedad de paneles de métricas e informes automatizados mediante herramientas como Power BI, Alteryx, Oracle Business Intelligence y SAP BusinessObjects para permitir la toma de decisiones basada en datos en toda la organización

• Realizar la validación de datos y controles de calidad para garantizar la precisión, integridad y coherencia de los datos. Realizar pruebas exhaustivas de las soluciones desarrolladas para identificar y resolver defectos y problemas.

• Colaborar con las partes interesadas clave para recopilar y comprender los requisitos comerciales, y diseñar modelos de datos eficientes y escalables que puedan satisfacer las necesidades de generación de informes y análisis.

• Desarrollar procesos para extraer, transformar y cargar datos (ETL) de varias fuentes de datos en el almacén de datos.

• Documentar especificaciones técnicas, modelos de datos y procesos ETL. Establecer mecanismos de gobernanza de datos y crear un diccionario de datos.

• Colaborar con colegas de Recursos Humanos y Tecnología de la Información.

• Apoyar la integridad de los datos de RR.HH. protegiendo la privacidad de los registros de personal de los empleados

• Identificar y brindar recomendaciones de forma independiente sobre oportunidades para mejoras de procesos

• Actuar como un sólido administrador de datos al defender las mejores prácticas de calidad de datos

• Realizar informes ad hoc, consultas de datos, otras tareas y proyectos según se asignen

Show more
HTML:
¿Te apasiona el análisis de datos? ¿Quieres formar parte de un equipo dinámico y multidisciplinario en una empresa líder en el sector?


Nuestro cliente, destacada empresa multinacional líder en la fabricación de sistemas automotrices, está buscando un Data Analyst para su equipo de la zona de Barcelona. Esta empresa forma parte de un grupo reconocido a nivel internacional se caracteriza por su compromiso con la innovación y el desarrollo, lo que ofrece oportunidades únicas para crecer dentro de un entorno global.


¿Qué te ofrece el proyecto?

• Remuneración competitiva y contrato indefinido.

• Horario flexible .

• Oportunidades de desarrollo profesional y modalidad de teletrabajo híbrida.

• Ambiente de trabajo dinámico y equipo multidisciplinario.

• Beneficios por parte de la empresa.


¿Qué necesitas para hacer match?

• Licenciatura en Ciencias de la Computación, Sistemas de Información, Ingeniería de Datos o campo MIS equivalente

• Experiencia en el desarrollo de soluciones con aplicaciones como Power BI, SAP BusinessObjects, Oracle Business Intelligence y/o Alteryx Designer.

• Experiencia práctica en la construcción de soluciones de tableros en Power BI

• Experiencia práctica con un lenguaje de programación como Python, R, SQL o Matlab

• Habilidades moderadas a avanzadas con MS Office, particularmente Excel; se prefiere conocimiento de VBA, M y/o DAX.

• Experiencia en soporte de transformación de datos, estructuras de datos y metadatos

• Experiencia en el desarrollo de mejoras tangibles de procesos a través de la automatización

• Sólidas habilidades de gestión de proyectos y organizativas

• Creatividad para conceptualizar y desarrollar soluciones no tradicionales

• Nivel muy alto de comunicación en inglés, tanto hablado como escrito.


¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?

• Colaborar con las partes interesadas clave para recopilar y comprender los requisitos comerciales, y diseñar modelos de datos eficientes y escalables que puedan satisfacer las necesidades de generación de informes y análisis.

• Documentar especificaciones técnicas, modelos de datos y procesos ETL. Establecer mecanismos de gobernanza de datos y crear un diccionario de datos.

• Colaborar con colegas de Recursos Humanos y Tecnología de la Información.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
• Job Title : Data Analyst

• Location : Barcelona, Spain

• Duration : B2B – 6+ Months Contract

• Work Mode : Hybrid




Job Description :




• Experience:

• 3+ experience as a Data Analyst with a strong focus on SQL and data analysis.

• Practical experience with PySpark or other big data processing frameworks is highly desirable.




Technical Skills:

• Proficient in SQL, with a strong understanding of database management and optimization.

• Experience with PySpark, including writing Spark jobs and working with large datasets.

• Familiarity with Python for statistical analysis and data manipulation is a plus.




Soft Skills:

• Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.

• Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data insights clearly.

• Detail-oriented with a commitment to accuracy and quality.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (100% remote in Europe)
Description:
Welcome to the good side of tech 👋

You might have heard about us, but with a different name: Doctoralia. It all started 10 years ago, when we asked ourselves: is anyone in healthcare thinking about patients? We jumped in and we empowered patients by giving them access to leave and read reviews about their visit. We then provided doctors with the technology to manage bookings easily and save time, so they could devote themselves to what they always wanted: treating patients. And today is the day in which we ask you: will you join us in the next step of making the healthcare experience more human?

Docplanner at scale

We are leaders in 13 countries so far, and more than 90 million patients trust us every month. Almost 300.000 specialists believe in us and our product, and so do leading venture capital funds such as Point Nine Capital, Goldman Sachs Asset Management and One Peak Partners. And yet, employing over 2.700 people all over the globe, we managed to keep the startup-mindset we started with over 10 years ago.



Job Description



Our primary objective is to assist business in making decisions based on data, with a particular emphasis on producing global reports as the primary and most reliable source of information. A team of 12 experts provides support to various departments, including marketing, sales, customer success, finance, and people experience, for both short-term and long-term projects. Collaborating closely with stakeholders, we strive to develop reports, analyses, models, and recommendations that enable us to gain a deep understanding of how we can enhance the satisfaction of both doctors and patients.

How would you be impacting our mission?

Derive facts from data and translate them into actionable insights and recommendations.
Support the business with identifying opportunities and making intelligent, data-driven decisions. You will execute end-to-end BI projects and be the main point of contact for the internal stakeholders.
Use (and develop!) a global database.
Create, automate and visualize reports and analysis for both top management and local teams (such as Finance, Sales, Customer Success, Marketing, Customer Experience).
When you become independent in the role you will have a chance to develop prediction/classification models using Python/R.
Work with Redshift, Git, Tableau, Airflow daily.



Qualifications



What will help you thrive?

Demonstrable experience in using SQL to derive actionable insights, either in commercial or academic setting (must have).
Knowledge of Python/R and desire to expand your knowledge.
Experience with statistical modeling and descriptive statistics.
Experience in partnership with internal stakeholders.
Experience in leading and executing end to end BI projects.
Very good level of business English.

Which skills are ‘bonus points’?

Have a degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
Are able to take a step back from the technicalities and examine them through a business lens.
Are open to cooperating with a lot of people from many teams in different countries.
Like to see instant effects of your work.
Are careful, diligent and detail-oriented.



Additional Information



What will you get in return?

Let’s talk money

Flexible remuneration and benefits system via Flexoh, which includes: restaurant card, transportation card, kindergarten, and training tax savings;
Share options plan after 6 months of working with us.

True flexibility and work-life balance

Remote first in one of our legal entities or hybrid work model in one of our office locations;
Flexible working hours;
Paid time off according to your location of work;
Additional paid holiday on your birthday or work anniversary (you choose what you want to celebrate).

Health comes first

Health insurance according to your location of work;
Access to iFeel, a technological platform for mental wellness offering online psychological support and counseling.

What does the recruitment process look like?

A 30-minute meeting with Sally Hütter - Talent Acquisition Partner for International Teams
A 60-minute meeting with Wiktor Kulikowski - BI Manager
Business Case - Prepare a Business Case and present it within the final chat (60 minutes) with Wiktor

We promote and embrace equal opportunities in our hiring process, and also every day at work. When you apply for our roles you receive equal treatment regardless of age, disabilities, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or parental status, race, color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation or any other dimension of human difference. If you require additional support in your recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to let us know. Behind those words you’re reading, there’s a person (hi!) who already helped a candidate by adapting the interviews, and now we’re lucky to have this person with us. So, even if you’ve never asked for it before, may this serve as a sign that, now, you can do so. We can only truly be equal if we adapt to each other.

“We believe all humans, in all their beautiful diversity, should have equal rights, dignity and respect. Period.” Mariusz Gralewski, CEO

Title: Digital Data Analyst
Description:
Somos DDB, somos creadores de ideas.

Ayudamos a nuestros clientes a ser líderes.

Trabajamos con ellos como socios estratégicos.

Nos sumergimos en el negocio de nuestros clientes y buscamos soluciones creativas.

Iniciamos y mantenemos vivo el diálogo de las marcas con el consumidor.

Creamos ideas con trascendencia social porque sólo así tendremos relevancia.

Perfil

En DDB buscamos un/a Data Analyst para que forme parte de nuestro equipo en la oficina de Barcelona.

Responsabilidades


Exploración de datos y creación de informes
Análisis web y entorno digital
Visualización de datos y dashboards en:
Adobe Analytics
Google Analytics y Data Studio
Otros
Estudios de consumidores, comportamiento digital, journey de usuarios, navegación y usabilidad
Segmentación y perfilado de usuarios/consumidores
Búsqueda de data para obtención de insights y generación de recomendaciones
Marketing digital para industria automoción

Requisitos


Performance de campañas Paid (especialmente SEM/Display/Programática)
Análisis de performance en social media.
Estrategia SEO
Set up/mantenimiento de Google Tag Manager
Modelos de atribución y fases de funnel
CRM
Definición de KPIs y métricas relevantes
Conocimiento entornos digitales, especialmente web
Orientación a obtención de insights estratégicos
Habilidades de presentación y comunicación


Todas las candidaturas serán consideradas para el empleo, independientemente de su raza, orientación sexual o edad.

¿Qué ofrecemos?

Modelo de trabajo híbrido: días presenciales en la oficina combinados con días de teletrabajo.

Ambiente de trabajo creativo y dinámico donde podrás desarrollar todo tu talento y podrás crecer personal y profesionalmente.

Nuestro programa DDB Concilia, con beneficios exclusivos por pertenecer a DDB, además de programas de bienestar emocional con servicios personalizados.

Todo esto y mucho más. ¿Te vienes?

Tu información personal se utilizará de acuerdo con nuestro Aviso de Privacidad. Puedes leer nuestro Aviso de Privacidad aquí cuando presentes tu solicitud.

Title: BI Specialist
Description:
Our Manifesto

At Heura we are food activists, and our mission is to provide a solution that leaves animals out of the equation, while feeding millions of people in a sustainable way. Technology gives us the opportunity to build a food system that not only solves our current challenges but also responds to our values.

We also know that great goals can only be achieved by diverse teams of people with different backgrounds, perspectives, orientations, abilities, food tastes, dress sense, and time zones - we don't just accept our differences; we fully support and celebrate them.

But ultimately, we all have one common goal: accelerating the protein transition.

And that’s why we are looking for a BI Specialist! To join the Good Rebels team and help us achieve our mission through facilitating informed and strategic decision making through the analysis and visualization of business-relevant data.

Your Challenge


Business Requirements Analysis: Collaborate with different departments to understand their needs and translate them into technical requirements. Identify key areas for improvement and optimization opportunities through data analysis.
Dashboard Design and Development: Create interactive and visually appealing dashboards to facilitate decision-making. Ensure dashboards are intuitive, easy to use, and tailored to end-users. Utilize data visualization tools such as Power BI.
Data Extraction and Transformation: Obtain data from various sources (databases, ERP systems, CRM systems, etc.) and transform it into usable information. Design and maintain ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to ensure data quality and consistency.
Data Analysis: Perform complex data analyses to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies. Generate ad hoc reports to answer specific business questions.
Data Management: Ensure the integrity, accuracy, and security of the data. Implement and maintain an efficient and scalable data model.
User Training and Support: Provide training and support to end-users to help them effectively use the dashboards. Create documentation and user guides for the developed tools and dashboards.
Continuous Improvement: Monitor dashboard performance and make adjustments as needed. Stay updated on the latest trends and technologies in BI to continuously improve offered solutions.
Communication and Collaboration: Act as a liaison between the IT department and business areas to ensure alignment of technological and business objectives. Facilitate meetings and presentations to communicate findings and recommend actions based on data analysis.
BI Strategy Development: Contribute to the development and implementation of the company's BI strategy. Ensure BI solutions are aligned with the organization's strategic objectives.
Process Automation: Identify and automate repetitive processes to improve operational efficiency. Implement automatic alerts and notifications based on critical business data.
Power BI ownership: from modelling, data sources, metric calculation, visualizations, service, effective distribution and security access



YOU WILL FEEL COMFORTABLE, ENJOY AND DO GREAT AT THIS ROLE IF YOU HAVE:


A Caring attitude towards our mission and see it as a “personal” problem to be solved professionally.
Desire to help, assist and solve people's needs with a GoodVibes attitude.
Passion for the business and a deep understanding of it to make sure your job at this role is aligned to business needs and goals.
Previous experience in similar roles, ideally at an FMCG company or a high-growth startup.
Computer engineering, computer CFGS or similar. Ideal Power BI Certification.
Proficiency with Microsoft Power BI (Desktop application and the Service, and Gateway). Any other similar BI tool such as Tableau, SAS, Qlik, Sisense, Oracle Analytics Cloud, MicroStrategy or Microsoft Excel would be beneficial.
Be familiar with data sources, data warehouses, data models, data quality, data visualization and data security.
Be able to use SQL, Python, R or other programming languages to manipulate and analyze data.
Be aware of the latest trends and innovations in BI, such as cloud computing, artificial intelligence and big data.
Excel skills with Power Query and Data Modelling
Underlying awareness of SQL Server, or any other Database Management systems
Knowledge of SAP solutions
An analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving mindset to approach everyday challenges.
Ability to prioritize and anticipate opportunities
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both English (mandatory) and Spanish.
Ability to create strong and trustful relationships with internal and external stakeholders.



Heura Life Benefits

To make this world a better place is hard work, so we support our Dream Team with:


Culture of freedom, responsibility, and constructive feedback
An entrepreneurial environment that encourages innovation
Regulatory local labour days + 5 extra ones for Vacations! (capped in 30 labour days yearly)
Flexible working environment
Private Health Insurance or Medical Allowance
Organic coffee, tea & plant-based drinks (in local offices)
Discounted gym memberships
Discounts on Heura’s products
Flexible retribution (in Spain)
After-work gatherings and other cool company events (in local offices)
and…



… Working with top-talented and amazing Good Rebels! 👇🏽

We care deeply, which leads us to have a genuine curiosity to understand the core of challenges and get the right diagnosis in order to recognize what will have the most impact.

We find the best hacker solution to each challenge; if it exists, we go for it, if not, we enjoy creating it. We ensure the structures we build are the most efficient ones: we grow two trees from one seed.

We are also high achievers: we never give up. We are fully focused on generating scalable impact taking end-to-end accountability.

None of this would make sense if we didn’t enjoy the journey. We smile and celebrate every day because we are passionate about our work and our mission.

If you see yourself here and can meet the essential requirements, we would love for you to apply. Or, do you know someone who would be a perfect fit? Let them know!

Our mission is to build a net-positive food system by accelerating the protein transition with the ambition of not just being an alternative to current problems but successors by creating value chains that integrate what matters and empowering people to be part of this change.

🌿💛
Show more

  • Computer engineering, computer CFGS or similar. Ideal Power BI Certification.
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Power BI (Desktop application and the Service, and Gateway). Any other similar BI tool such as Tableau, SAS, Qlik, Sisense, Oracle Analytics Cloud, MicroStrategy or Microsoft Excel would be beneficial.
  • Be familiar with data sources, data warehouses, data models, data quality, data visualization and data security.
  • Be able to use SQL, Python, R or other programming languages to manipulate and analyze data.
  • Be aware of the latest trends and innovations in BI, such as cloud computing, artificial intelligence and big data.
  • Excel skills with Power Query and Data Modelling
  • Underlying awareness of SQL Server, or any other Database Management systems
  • Knowledge of SAP solutions
  • An analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving mindset to approach everyday challenges.
  • Ability to prioritize and anticipate opportunities
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both English (mandatory) and Spanish.
  • Ability to create strong and trustful relationships with internal and external stakeholders.


Heura Life Benefits

To make this world a better place is hard work, so we support our Dream Team with:

  • Culture of freedom, responsibility, and constructive feedback
  • An entrepreneurial environment that encourages innovation
  • Regulatory local labour days + 5 extra ones for Vacations! (capped in 30 labour days yearly)
  • Flexible working environment
  • Private Health Insurance or Medical Allowance
  • Organic coffee, tea & plant-based drinks (in local offices)
  • Discounted gym memberships
  • Discounts on Heura’s products
  • Flexible retribution (in Spain)
  • After-work gatherings and other cool company events (in local offices)
  • and…


… Working with top-talented and amazing Good Rebels! 👇🏽

We care deeply, which leads us to have a genuine curiosity to understand the core of challenges and get the right diagnosis in order to recognize what will have the most impact.

We find the best hacker solution to each challenge; if it exists, we go for it, if not, we enjoy creating it. We ensure the structures we build are the most efficient ones: we grow two trees from one seed.

We are also high achievers: we never give up. We are fully focused on generating scalable impact taking end-to-end accountability.

None of this would make sense if we didn’t enjoy the journey. We smile and celebrate every day because we are passionate about our work and our mission.

If you see yourself here and can meet the essential requirements, we would love for you to apply. Or, do you know someone who would be a perfect fit? Let them know!

Our mission is to build a net-positive food system by accelerating the protein transition with the ambition of not just being an alternative to current problems but successors by creating value chains that integrate what matters and empowering people to be part of this change.

🌿💛

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Mission:

At Schneider Electric, you will contribute to solving the climate crisis and accelerating the energy transformation that our planet urgently needs. You will work among colleagues with very diverse personal and professional experiences, united by a vision of a better world.

Location & commitments:


Full-time job
Warsaw, Poland (office in Konstruktorska street)
Hybrid job (2 days remotely)
Your manager: Michał Sirak


Your IMPACT:


Research and identify data and analytical business needs and determine possible solutions
Conduct data discovery, profiling, analyze data lineage and determine schema
Automate data sets extractions and transformations for analytical or reporting consumption
Scale-up, productionize, and maintain developed automations
Design, build and operate robust and scalable dashboards and visualizations
Perform light statistical analysis and machine learning
Listen to stakeholders and develop a deep understanding of their needs and priorities
Tenaciously solve problems and make decisions under uncertainty
Actively contribute to scrum ceremonies including sprint planning, daily stand-up, sprint review and retrospectives


Your Profile:


University degree in: Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Economics or equivalent
Hands-on experience with Python, databases and SQL
Hands-on experience designing, building, and operating dashboards and visualizations in Tableau or equivalent
Effectively communicating complex topics with non-technical users
Experience in applying statistical analysis
Passionate about learning every day and transferring knowledge
Good command of English


Preferred qualifications:


Experience with AWS
Experience with Databricks (or cloud-based data warehouse)
Experience with PySpark


Our Offer:


EXCITING JOB in an international company, which is leading the Digital Transformation of Energy Management and Automation, with significant market share,
DEVELOPMENT - the opportunity to gain valuable work experience in a supportive team of professionals,
ONBOARDING TRANINGS to help you find your way in our company,
WIDE CHOICE OF BENEFITS - private medical care, life insurance, sports card, performance bonus, benefits cafeteria with the possibility to exchange points for selected products or services,
BENEFITS FOR EMPLOYEES’ CHILDREN from the company's social fund,
ADDITIONAL FAMILY LEAVE - for the birth of a child or adoption, to care for a family member or for bereavement (additional leave beyond the terms of labor law),
PROJECT WORK OPPORTUNITY (e.g., ambassador programme, mentoring, digitisation projects),
DIVERSE TEAM - working in a diverse team and the opportunity to use foreign languages in your daily work,
ACCESS TO TRAINING PLATFORM - training tailored to your needs and career goals,
RECOGNITION - points that can be exchanged for various products and services,
PARTICIPATION IN CSR or SUSTAINABILITY PROJECTS - 1 fully paid volunteer day per year,
EMPLOYEE REFERRAL PROGRAM - have a say in who you work with and get an attractive financial bonus,
NO FORMAL DRESS CODE - we welcome people as they are and see diversity as a value to the company.


Curiosity, Inclusion, Teamwork:

Nobody is flawless and not all career paths are the same. The important thing is that we have the will to learn and develop ourselves further. Because we know that career also means having to find your strengths first. Apply now, even if you don't fulfil all the requirements (yet). We look forward to getting to know you!

 

Your next step? Now apply online!

Looking to make an IMPACT with your career?

When you are thinking about joining a new team, culture matters. At Schneider Electric, our values and behaviors are the foundation for creating a great culture to support business success. We believe that our IMPACT values - Inclusion, Mastery, Purpose, Action, Curiosity, Teamwork - starts with us.

IMPACT is also your invitation to join Schneider Electric where you can contribute to turning sustainability ambition into actions, no matter what role you play. It is a call to connect your career with the ambition of achieving a more resilient, efficient, and sustainable world.

We are looking for IMPACT Makers; exceptional people who turn sustainability ambitions into actions at the intersection of automation, electrification, and digitization. We celebrate IMPACT Makers and believe everyone has the potential to be one.

Become an IMPACT Maker with Schneider Electric - apply today!

€36 billion global revenue

+13% organic growth

150 000+ employees in 100+ countries

#1 on the Global 100 World’s most sustainable corporations

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.

Schneider Electric aspires to be the most inclusive and caring company in the world, by providing equitable opportunities to everyone, everywhere, and ensuring all employees feel uniquely valued and safe to contribute their best. We mirror the diversity of the communities in which we operate, and ‘inclusion’ is one of our core values. We believe our differences make us stronger as a company and as individuals and we are committed to championing inclusivity in everything we do. This extends to our Candidates and is embedded in our Hiring Practices.

You can find out more about our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion here and our DEI Policy here

At Schneider Electric, we uphold the highest standards of ethics and compliance, and we believe that trust is a foundational value. Our Trust Charter is our Code of Conduct and demonstrates our commitment to ethics, safety, sustainability, quality and cybersecurity, underpinning every aspect of our business and our willingness to behave and respond respectfully and in good faith to all our stakeholders. You can find out more about our Trust Charter here

Schneider Electric is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.

Title: Data Analyst Intern, Emerging, EMEA
Description:
What You'll Do:

As a member of our Performance Media Analytics team, you won't just analyse data; you'll be the cornerstone that connects groundbreaking ideas with real-world business applications. Here, your expertise will not only shape solutions but also empower our clients and commercial teams to make impactful decisions:


Client insights: you will analyze complex data from multiple sources to understand the performance of our advertisers campaigns and generate innovative and impactful insights
Data-Driven Innovation: Leverage cutting-edge tech like Hadoop, Vertica, Tableau, Python, and SQL to transform complex business challenges into groundbreaking solutions.
Reporting tools and metrics: you will develop and scale reports and metrics that will present actionable insights to teams across the business and strategic leadership teams
Tech Playground: Immerse yourself in an environment where experimenting with advanced analytics tools isn't just encouraged, it's part of your daily work.
Collaborative projects: you will work on ad hoc projects with different teams to automate analyses globally, improve our internal processes and our way of working and scale knowledge across the company.



Your Work Environment:


Flexible remote working options - balance your life the way you want.
A tech-forward, primarily digital workspace.
Need special work hours? Let's talk about it!



Who You Are:


A problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges.
Interested in solving data problems using Python & SQL, and enthusiastic about automating and scaling solutions.
Business-minded with a goal to turn data insights into actionable strategies.
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace.
Fluent in English and skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences.



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.


Show more

Title: Data Analyst II (They/She/He)
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.

💪 Our career development philosophy.

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Join our team and become an integral part of Glovo's Global Operations! We provide a dynamic and challenging environment filled with numerous opportunities for growth and development.

Couriers are the cornerstone of Glovo’s marketplace. We are seeking a Data Analyst who can strike the perfect balance between creativity and data-driven precision, turning seemingly impossible projects into reality.

In this role, you will be responsible for delivering insights and data to drive the core strategies of the Courier Supply Excellence team. By leveraging analytics, you will globally identify methods to enhance courier engagement at the order, hourly, and monthly levels. The KPIs you will influence are crucial to operations, as every decision made will directly affect the whole operational investment.

THE JOURNEY


Bring your boldest ideas to life and make an immediate global impact.
Understand and address local and regional needs by stepping into the shoes of the couriers and truly understanding their perspective.
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo’s operations.
Offer analytical support to teams across more than 20 countries by deepening the understanding of Glovo's operational model.
Enhance the strategies we use to define each market’s approach.
Manage dashboards and create new tools to improve the department’s metric visibility.
Develop analytical frameworks and models, while effectively communicating with the entire department.
Dive deep into data to identify key factors and actions to improve KPIs, taking accountability for outcomes.
Innovate to contribute to the ongoing improvement of courier profitability.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Statistics or similar
+2 years of work experience providing internal teams with the necessary data to make the right decisions, banking / financial background is a plus
Strong analytical and coding skills: SQL and Excel proficiency (or extensive coding experience), and BI platforms experience (Looker, Tableau, PowerBI,…)
Python and experience working with analysis tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Scikit, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R is highly valued
Strong strategic vision and business mindset
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Comfortable working in high-growth and high-performance start-ups with a fast-paced
Professional English


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!
Show more

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Data Analyst sector Automoción
Description:
CT es una empresa líder en tecnología, que proporciona servicios de innovación e ingeniería en los sectores aeronáutico, espacial, naval, automovilístico, ferroviario, energético y de plantas industriales. CT impulsa los límites de la tecnología a través de la innovación, y lleva la eficiencia a otro nivel cubriendo todo el ciclo de vida de los productos, desde el diseño y la fabricación hasta el soporte postventa. Con más de 30 años de experiencia, el éxito de CT está impulsado hoy en día por más de 1.800 ingenieros expertos repartidos en siete países, en tres continentes.

Actualmente Estamos Buscando Incorporar Ingeniero/as De Datos Para Diferentes Proyectos De Automoción En Las Empresas Más Importantes Del Sector En Barcelona, Para La Realización De Las Siguientes Tareas


Analizar datos de producción, calidad y rendimiento de vehículos para identificar mejoras operativas y optimizar procesos.
Crear informes y dashboards visuales para comunicar insights a equipos de ingeniería, manufactura y dirección.
Colaborar con diferentes departamentos para implementar soluciones basadas en datos que mejoren la eficiencia y la calidad del producto.
Formación en Ingeneria
Experiencia previa en automoción
Valorable experiencia en departamentos de I+D o departamento de test/validaciones.
Nivel de Ingés alto
Conocimientos en lenguajes de programación
Manejo de bases de datos
Conocimientos de IA, IoT y Big Data


¿Qué ofrecemos?


Modalidad de trabajo híbrida (3 días presenciales y 2 días de teletrabajo).
Horario de 08h a 17:30h, viernes media jornada.
Desarrollo profesional continuo.
Retribución competitiva.
Clima laboral participativo, inclusivo y dinámico. ¡Nos encanta trabajar en equipo!
Formar parte del lugar donde los ingenieros aman trabajar.


Buscamos una persona proactiva, motivada, con ganas de seguir creciendo en el mundo industrial, con ganas de nuevos retos dentro del mundo tecnológico.

Si te sientes identificado no dudes en aplicar!

Title: Business Insights Analyst
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.

💪 Our career development philosophy.

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

We are looking for a world-class analyst to become part of our SEE (Southeastern Europe) Growth team. Are you able to translate data into actionable insights? Are you looking for a challenging experience in the fast and rapidly changing environment helping to build a product that will disrupt the On-demand market? If your answer is YES and you are eager to join a strongly data-driven and results-focused team we are looking forward to meeting you!

THE JOURNEY


Understand business needs of SEE countries under your scope and create insightful analysis helping your team to make the right decisions to boost Glovo presence and orders.
Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base focusing on traffic, conversion and retention rates and leveraging on levers such as pricing, promotions, events, CRM and other marketing levers etc.
Drive projects end-to-end translating business challenges into insights and actions
Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base, step change retention rates and maximize profitability
Take ownership of the reporting of KPIs by creating customized tools and using the available ones
Ensure these tools are scalable and up-to-date
Assist your colleagues in gaining access to the right data, and Communicate and simplify concepts to the audience's needs
Drive clarity and solve ambiguity using data-driven approaches
Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with both our consumer and business products, identify growth opportunities, and execute on projects to drive growth and engagement


What You Will Bring To The Ride


2-3 years of work experience on analytical roles leading analysis and turning insights into actions
Bachelor's degree in Math, Engineering, Business, Stats or Quantitative field
SQL proficiency is mandatory / Python is a plus
Ninja expertise with Excel / Google Sheets is a must
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker or Qlikview
Business acumen and passion for end-to-end project management (from ideation and analysis into implementation).
Hands-on attitude is a must. You’ll have to roll up your sleeves!
Proficiency in English
Strong consumer understanding skills


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!
Show more

Title: Checkout Data Analyst
Description:
Checkout Data Analyst (They/She/He) - (Hybrid)

As you contemplate your future, you might be asking yourself, what's the next step? Start your journey with us!

We're seeking an experienced Checkout Data Analyst to join our Checkout team in Barcelona (hybrid), which is passionate about data, automation, analysis and innovation and loves to work in a collaborative and agile environment. If you're ready to soar, we're ready to take you there.

Why eDreams ODIGEO

Join the world's leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe.

20 million customers – 44 markets – 5 brands – 5.4M members in Prime

16.2 million bookings FY23 - More than 50,000 bookings per day - 100 million daily user searches

1400 employees – More than 50 different nationalities - 99% permanent contracts - 36.3 average age

We're a leading travel tech company, revolutionising the travel booking experience through our consumer insight, innovative technology, market leadership, and Prime, the world's first travel subscription program.

What you will do:

The Role's Key Responsibilities and Tasks

As an eDOer, you will have clear objectives, great challenges and a clear overview of how your work contributes to the global company project and its customers. As a Checkout Data Analyst in the Checkout team you will be in charge of:


Responsible for execution of key analysis, being the data entry point for the business team and taking ownership of the different data sources from the business side. Understand the business needs, gather the data and present the key insights
Own team metrics identifying the drivers of over and underperformance and providing data driven recommendations for how we can improve the KPIs performance
Turn business questions into functional analysis, extract relevant and actionable insights working with data from many different data sources using SQL/BQ and work with your stakeholders to make them happen
Elaborate business cases to support strategic product decisions
Design and execute measurement experiments; Analyse performance and user behaviours in the A/B Tests experiments or Pre-Post run by the business stakeholders
Create dashboards and tracking: ensuring production data is always accurate and available for key stakeholders and business processes that depend on it to contribute to the monitoring and tracking of our business KPIs, as well as, foster data-driven decision making across the organisation. Work with data engineering and data science teams to be able to leverage relevant data
Contribute to the delivery of strategic projects: participate in the delivery of key initiatives, giving support from the business side to ensure progress and effective delivery of the desired outcomes. Work together with stakeholders in the execution of the projects, giving support from the analytical and business side



What you need to succeed:

Job Requirements

Bring your unique perspective, speak up, and offer disruptive solutions. You'll have the opportunity to learn and grow while making a real impact on our team. Here's what you need to succeed:


Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Experience in a role with strong analytical component
Strong knowledge of SQL is a requirement, as well as experience in working with databases and large sets of data; python/R programming skills and experience with Looker Studio, Power BI will be valued
Advanced Office skills. Strong experience with analytical tools, ideally with Microsoft and Google Office package (Excel, etc.)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with high attention to detail
Strong organisational and communication skills
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment
A self-starter and team player, who also enjoys having fun!
Business Proficiency in English



What’s in it for you?

The best talent deserves the best benefits

At eDO, we want you to be a part of our success story and great culture.

Here's what we offer:


A rewarding Compensation package! 💥 Prime Plus membership, competitive salary and benefits package, including flexible benefits, performance-based bonuses, birthday day off, discounts and partnerships, relocation support and the possibility of choosing your equipment and, even better, keeping it for free after 3 years.
Continuous learning to fuel your growth and explore new horizons! 📚 Learn and grow with free Coursera access, soft skills workshops, tech training, leadership development, and more. Plus, enjoy a great onboarding program.
Grow opportunities to empower your career, and unleash your potential! 🚀 Personalised career paths and the eVOLVE Program will help you discover, grow, and thrive. Internal mobility opportunities let you pursue horizontal career changes and promotions.
Your Well-being is our priority. Embrace Freedom and Flexibility! 💙 At eDO, we value flexibility, employee care, and transparency. We offer a hybrid home-office model focused on outcome, not time-in-seat. You'll be able to find the right work-personal life balance that suits you best.
Work hard, party hard! We believe in having fun and connecting with colleagues! 🎉 Join eDO for after-work events, padel tournaments, parties, and more. Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices.
Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! 💫 Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You'll work in an Agile mindset environment with recognition at our core.



Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at eDO? Follow us on LinkedIn and discover more about life at eDO!

I f you are ready for a career opportunity with unmatched benefits, continuous learning, and a supportive work-life balance, look no further! Take your career to new destinations by applying now and help our diverse, inclusive, and passionate team shape the future of travel.

Apply now!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status. Our people are the key to our success. Each one of them is unique in their own way and the respect for their uniqueness is and will always be a passion and motivation.

I f you are ready for a career opportunity with unmatched benefits, continuous learning, and a supportive work-life balance, look no further! Take your career to new destinations by applying now and help our diverse, inclusive, and passionate team shape the future of travel.

Apply now!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company.
