Integrada en el Grupo Mutua Madrileña y participada por CaixaBank, la aseguradora ocupa también una posición relevante en otros ramos principales como Hogar, Accidentes o Decesos.


En los últimos años se ha convertido en una entidad de referencia gracias a la implantación de un modelo de negocio basado en el crecimiento sostenido y rentable, que sitúa al cliente en el centro de la estrategia. A través de su acuerdo de bancaseguros con CaixaBank, SegurCaixa Adeslas comercializa sus productos en la mayor red bancaria de España. Adicionalmente, la aseguradora cuenta con una red tradicional con más de 4.000 puntos de venta y atención al cliente.


Estamos convencid@s de que las personas son el principal valor de nuestra compañía y por eso SegurCaixa Adeslas se muestra absolutamente comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades entre hombres y mujeres. Nuestro Plan de Igualdad persigue hacer efectivo este principio y por ello, el proceso de selección de nuestras ofertas garantiza la igualdad de oportunidades a todas las candidaturas.


Seleccionamos para incorporar en Barcelona a un/a Senior Data Analyst para el Dpto. de Planificación y Gestión de la Información.

Las funciones a realizar serán las siguientes:


  • Elaborar seguimientos comerciales sobre las campañas desarrolladas por Marketing.
  • Anticiparse a las necesidades de la Dirección General de Negocio en la definición, mantenimiento y creación de informes de seguimiento comercial.
  • Revisar y garantizar la fiabilidad de los datos que se muestran en los seguimientos, así como su distribución en plazo.
  • Realizar mejoras en los informes de seguimiento actuales e implementar automatizaciones que permitan ahorrar tiempo para desarrollar nuevas tareas.
  • Realizar presentaciones ah-hoc para la Dirección y la red comercial.
  • Buscar nuevas fuentes de datos para la realización de nuevos informes de seguimiento.
  • Auditar las fuentes origen de información a fin de mantener la fiabilidad de los datos.
  • Interacción con el área de sistemas para llevar a cabo el desarrollo de requerimientos, revisión de funcionales y validación de pruebas de las peticiones realizadas por Negocio.


Requisitos:


  • Formación: Titulación universitaria (Matemáticas/Ingeniería/Informática/ADE o Economía o similares).
  • Experiencia: 8-10 años desarrollando funciones similares en empresas del sector asegurador y/o consultoría.
  • Informática y aplicaciones: Programación en SQL y VBA, Business Objects y nivel experto en Ms Office (Access, Excel, PowerPoint).
  • Experiencia en la gestión de bases de datos y en la coordinación de proyectos.


Ofrecemos:

  • Contrato indefinido y flexibilidad de horarios
  • Desarrollo profesional dentro de empresa líder en el sector
  • Interesantes beneficios sociales

Title: HR Data Analyst (100% remote-friendly within Spain/Poland)
HTML:
Welcome to the good side of tech 👋

You might have heard about us, but with a different name: Doctoralia. It all started 10 years ago, when we asked ourselves: is anyone in healthcare thinking about patients? We jumped in and we empowered patients by giving them access to leave and read reviews about their visit. We then provided doctors with the technology to manage bookings easily and save time, so they could devote themselves to what they always wanted: treating patients. And today is the day in which we ask you: will you join us in the next step of making the healthcare experience more human?

Docplanner at scale

We are leaders in 13 countries so far, and more than 90 million patients trust us every month. Almost 300.000 specialists believe in us and our product, and so do leading venture capital funds such as Point Nine Capital, Goldman Sachs Asset Management and One Peak Partners. And yet, employing over 2.700 people all over the globe, we managed to keep the startup-mindset we started with over 10 years ago.

Job Description

Our primary objective is to assist business in making decisions based on data, with a particular emphasis on producing global reports as the primary and most reliable source of information. A team of 12 experts provides support to various departments, including marketing, sales, customer success, finance, and people experience, for both short-term and long-term projects. Collaborating closely with stakeholders, we strive to develop reports, analyses, models, and recommendations that enable us to gain a deep understanding of how we can enhance the satisfaction of both doctors and patients.

How would you be impacting our mission?

  • Derive facts from data and translate them into actionable insights and recommendations;
  • Support the People Experience (HR) team with identifying opportunities and making intelligent, data-driven decisions. You will execute end-to-end data projects and be the main point of contact for the internal stakeholders;
  • Leverage reporting, data analytics, data quality and visualization to provide insights for routine and ad-hoc operational requests;
  • Co-creating key definitions of KPIs, and ensuring their global alignment.


Qualifications

What will help you thrive?

  • Demonstrable experience in using SQL to derive actionable insights;
  • Have 2+ years of experience in the business/ data/ HR analysis area;
  • Experience in working with business oriented teams, knowing how to adjust their way of explanation to the audience;
  • Experience in data management and visualization (experience in Tableau is a plus);
  • Experience in conducting quantitative and qualitative research; can work with multiple sources of data;
  • Experience in leading and executing end-to-end Data projects;
  • Strong presentation skills, with the ability to influence and engage diverse audiences;
  • Strong written and oral communication skills in English.

Which skills are ‘bonus points’?

  • Have a degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field;
  • Experience in working in an international team;
  • Can take a step back from the technicalities and examine them through a business lens;
  • Like to see the instant effects of your work;
  • Are careful, diligent, and detail-oriented.


Additional Information

What will you get in return?

Let’s talk money

  • Flexible remuneration and benefits system via Flexoh, which includes: restaurant card, transportation card, kindergarten, and training tax savings;
  • Share options plan after 6 months of working with us.

True flexibility and work-life balance

  • Remote first in one of our legal entities or hybrid work model in one of our office locations;
  • Flexible working hours;
  • Paid time off according to your location of work;
  • Additional paid holiday on your birthday or work anniversary (you choose what you want to celebrate).

Health comes first

  • Health insurance according to your location of work;
  • Access to iFeel, a technological platform for mental wellness offering online psychological support and counseling.

What does the recruitment process look like?

  • A 30-minute Screening Call with one of our Talent Acquisition Partners: Lilly Kilian or Anna Reinhardt;
  • Meet our CPO Lucjan Samulowski within two separate 60-minute meetings.
  • A 60-minute technical interview with Wiktor Kulikowski - BI Manager
  • A 60-minute business case review with Lucjan and Wiktor

We promote and embrace equal opportunities in our hiring process, and also every day at work. When you apply for our roles you receive equal treatment regardless of age, disabilities, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or parental status, race, color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation or any other dimension of human difference. If you require additional support in your recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to let us know. Behind those words you’re reading, there’s a person (hi!) who already helped a candidate by adapting the interviews, and now we’re lucky to have this person with us. So, even if you’ve never asked for it before, may this serve as a sign that, now, you can do so. We can only truly be equal if we adapt to each other.

“We believe all humans, in all their beautiful diversity, should have equal rights, dignity and respect. Period.” Mariusz Gralewski, CEO

Title: Customer Service Data Analyst
Description:
As you contemplate your future, you might be asking yourself, what's the next step? Start your journey with us!

We are now looking for a technical Business Analyst for Customer Support. The Customer Support area has been transformative during the pandemic. During the last year it has been transformed from a supporting department to a key differentiator against the competition. We have developed some features that revolutionized the way people manage their bookings and made travelling more flexible from a consumer point of view.

Why eDreams ODIGEO

Join the world's leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe.

20 million customers – 44 markets – 5 brands – 5.4M members in Prime

16.2 million bookings FY23 - More than 50,000 bookings per day - 100 million daily user searches

1400 employees – More than 50 different nationalities - 99% permanent contracts - 36.3 average age

We're a leading travel tech company, revolutionising the travel booking experience through our consumer insight, innovative technology, market leadership, and Prime, the world's first travel subscription program.

What you will do:

The Role's Key Responsibilities and Tasks

As an eDOer, you will have clear objectives, great challenges and a clear overview of how your work contributes to the global company project and its customers. As a Customer Service Data Analyst you will be in charge of:


Responsible for execution of key analysis, being the data entry point for the business team and including taking ownership of the different data sources from the business side. Understand the business needs, gather the data and present the key insights: “Contribute to the Customer Support strategic roadmap with numbers”
Analyze Data from the whole area, we serve both the Product area as well as all our centers. This means you’ll be answering questions like how can we best utilize our VIP agents as well as going into depth about how we can improve our chatbot
Elaborate business cases to support strategic product decisions: e.g. should we train more agents? what is the next feature we should develop? should we double down on our efforts and redirect more customers to the chat bot ?
Create dashboards and tracking: master the internal Business Intelligence tools to contribute to the monitoring and tracking of our business KPIs. Work with data engineering and data science teams to be able to leverage all our internal data
Contribute to the delivery of Customer Service strategic projects: participate in the delivery of the key internal projects, giving support from the business side to ensure progress and effective delivery of the desired outcomes. Work together with product and call centers in the execution of the projects, giving support from the analytical and business side



What you need to succeed:

Good to have

Bring your unique perspective, speak up, and offer disruptive solutions. You'll have the opportunity to learn and grow while making a real impact on our team. Here's what you need to succeed:


Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, etc.),
2-4 years experience in a role with strong analytical component
Strong knowledge of SQL is a requirement, as well as experience in working with databases and large sets of data; python programming skills and experience with Google DataStudio will be highly valued
Advanced Office skills. Strong experience with analytical tools, ideally with the Google toolset (spreadsheets, google docs, etc)
Strong analytical skills, fast-learner, with high attention to detail and focused on results and productivity
A self-starter and team player, who also enjoys to have fun!
Business Proficiency in English



What’s in it for you?

The best talent deserves the best benefits

At eDO, we want you to be a part of our success story and great culture.

Here's what we offer:


A rewarding Compensation package! 💥 Prime Plus membership, competitive salary and benefits package, including flexible benefits, performance-based bonuses, birthday day off, discounts and partnerships, relocation support and the possibility of choosing your equipment and, even better, keeping it for free after 3 years.
Continuous learning to fuel your growth and explore new horizons! 📚 Learn and grow with free Coursera access, soft skills workshops, tech training, leadership development, and more. Plus, enjoy a great onboarding program.
Grow opportunities to empower your career, and unleash your potential! 🚀 Personalised career paths and the eVOLVE Program will help you discover, grow, and thrive. Internal mobility opportunities let you pursue horizontal career changes and promotions.
Your Well-being is our priority. Embrace Freedom and Flexibility! 💙 At eDO, we value flexibility, employee care, and transparency. We offer a hybrid home-office model focused on outcome, not time-in-seat. You'll be able to find the right work-personal life balance that suits you best.
Work hard, party hard! We believe in having fun and connecting with colleagues! 🎉 Join eDO for after-work events, padel tournaments, parties, and more. Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices.
Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! 💫 Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You'll work in an Agile mindset environment with recognition at our core.



Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at eDO? Follow us on LinkedIn and discover more about life at eDO!

If you are ready for a career opportunity with unmatched benefits, continuous learning, and a supportive work-life balance, look no further! Take your career to new destinations by applying now and help our diverse, inclusive, and passionate team shape the future of travel.

Apply now!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status. Our people are the key to our success. Each one of them is unique in their own way and the respect for their uniqueness is and will always be a passion and motivation.


Show more

  • Grow opportunities to empower your career, and unleash your potential! 🚀 Personalised career paths and the eVOLVE Program will help you discover, grow, and thrive. Internal mobility opportunities let you pursue horizontal career changes and promotions.
  • Your Well-being is our priority. Embrace Freedom and Flexibility! 💙 At eDO, we value flexibility, employee care, and transparency. We offer a hybrid home-office model focused on outcome, not time-in-seat. You'll be able to find the right work-personal life balance that suits you best.
  • Work hard, party hard! We believe in having fun and connecting with colleagues! 🎉 Join eDO for after-work events, padel tournaments, parties, and more. Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices.
  • Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! 💫 Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You'll work in an Agile mindset environment with recognition at our core.


Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at eDO? Follow us on LinkedIn and discover more about life at eDO!

If you are ready for a career opportunity with unmatched benefits, continuous learning, and a supportive work-life balance, look no further! Take your career to new destinations by applying now and help our diverse, inclusive, and passionate team shape the future of travel.

Apply now!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status. Our people are the key to our success. Each one of them is unique in their own way and the respect for their uniqueness is and will always be a passion and motivation.

Title: Services Data analyst and engineering
Description:
Job Summary


This role is responsible for data collection procedures, including accurate and relevant data for machine learning models, extracting and analyzing data from the primary and secondary database. The role ensures data integrity and compliance by performing data cleansing and data validations. The role performs root-cause analysis and recommends or executes corrective actions when data related system problems occur. The role applies developed subject matter knowledge to solve common and complex business issues within established guidelines and recommends appropriate alternatives.


Responsibilities


Designs and establishes secure and performant data architectures, enhancements, updates, and programming changes for portions and subsystems of data pipelines, repositories or models for structured/unstructured data.
Analyzes design and determines coding, programming, and integration activities required based on general objectives and knowledge of overall architecture of product or solution.
Writes and executes complete testing plans, protocols, and documentation for assigned portion of data system or component; identifies and debugs, and creates solutions for issues with code and integration into data system architecture.
Leads a project team of other data engineers to develop reliable, cost effective and high-quality solutions for assigned data system, model, or component.
Collaborates and communicates with project team regarding project progress and issue resolution.
Analyzes data inaccuracies, identifies opportunities and supports the development of automated solutions to enhance overall quality of the enterprise data.
Identifies problematic areas and conducts research to determine the best course of action to correct the data; identifies, analyzes and interprets trends and patterns in complex datasets.
Works cross-functionally with different departments to assess, define, and develop report deliverables.
Represents the software data engineering team for all phases of larger and more-complex development projects.
Provides guidance and mentoring to less experienced staff members.


Education & Experience Recommended


Four-year or Graduate Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Software Engineering, Statistics/ Mathematics, or any other related discipline or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence.
Typically has 4-7 years of work experience, preferably in data analytics, data engineering, data modeling, or a related field or an advanced degree with 3-5 years of work experience.


Preferred Certifications


Programming Language/s Certification (SQL, Python, or similar)


Knowledge & Skills


Agile Methodology
Amazon Web Services
Apache Hadoop
Apache Kafka
Apache Spark
Big Data
Computer Science
Data Analysis
Data Engineering
Data Modeling
Data Pipelines
Data Warehousing
Extract Transform Load (ETL)
Java (Programming Language)
Machine Learning
Microsoft Azure
Python (Programming Language)
Scala (Programming Language)
Scalability
SQL (Programming Language)


Cross-Org Skills


Effective Communication
Results Orientation
Learning Agility
Digital Fluency
Customer Centricity


Impact & Scope


Impacts multiple teams and may act as a team or project leader providing direction to team activities and facilitates information validation and team decision making process.


Complexity


Responds to moderately complex issues within established guidelines.


Disclaimer


This job description describes the general nature and level of work performed in this role. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, skills, responsibilities, knowledge, etc. These may be subject to change and additional functions may be assigned as needed by management.

Title: FX Data Analyst (Product)
Description:
At Kantox, we are looking for a FX Data Analyst (Product) to join our amazing Product Strategy team and help us to make our Clients' dashboards shine, build strong business cases together with our Sales team, and create tools to bring innovation and efficiency in the processes 🚀

Meet the team:

Simon - CPO

Andrea - FX Data Analyst Team Lead

Gabriela - FX Data Analyst

Lucas - Senior Product Owner

Ignacio - Product Owner

Laura - Senior Product Designer

Saagar - Product Designer

Mission:

The FX Data Analyst in Kantox blends product development with data analysis, offering a unique position to learn, which means great growth potential and many future opportunities.

The main goals of the role are:


Act as a Product Owner for our clients' Power BI dashboards. We want ALL our clients to have access to dashboards to track the performance and the value of our automation software. You'll formalise the go-to-market strategy, streamline the process, write specifications for the Data and the PowerBi teams, keep stakeholders in the loop, and coordinate the deployment of standard dashboards to as many clients as possible. By understanding clients' needs in detail, you'll also help shape our product development. Post-launch, you'll lead quality checks, train teams, and track usage metrics to ensure everyone gets the most out of our awesome dashboards
Play a key role in the Commercial Team, supporting in the initial phase the creation of business cases, i.e. providing insightful simulations through the internal tool and ad-hoc analyses. You'll collect and preprocess data from prospects, generate simulations, and deliver key KPIs to assess strategy effectiveness. Once you master the simulations, you'll shift focus to training and supporting the Sales team, empowering them to run simulations independently and assisting with the most complex and stimulating cases
Dive into prospects' FX exposure and trading data to deliver game-changing insights and tools for the Sales cycle. You'll exploit your tech skills into powerful tools, with the Bloomberg terminal as your secret weapon for top-notch analysis



Requirements

Must haves:


Strong academic background in engineering, finance, economics or business administration with a relevant master's degree or similar
Knowledge and interest about trading and/or foreign exchange (FX) products
Proficiency with MS Excel / Google Sheets for data analysis
Basic knowledge of Power BI (or similar) interface and features
Basic SQL queries for data extraction and manipulation
Basic understanding of Python/R syntax and data structures
Proficient in English



Mindset:


Fast learner; you will go through an intensive training program during your onboarding
Tech-appetite!
Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills
Hands-on attitude, very organised and able to meet deadlines



Benefits

What we offer


Competitive salary
Sponsored learning budget
Free private health insurance
Free Spanish, English and French lessons
Relocation package if needed
31 days of annual vacations
Gym discounts and free sports activities
Ticket Restaurant with monthly credit and regular cross-team lunches
Daily fresh fruit and a beautiful office with 360-degree views of Barcelona



Our culture


An environment of innovation, accountability, and constructive feedback
A diverse and multicultural team of over 40 different nationalities
Grow your role and build your career with our learning and development opportunities
A collaborative and inclusive culture of sharing and teamwork. Build connections for life
Hybrid working and flexible hours so you can work when and where you feel best
Some testimonials: "The culture and the people at Kantox make me want to recommend Kantox as a place to work. There is a good balance between learning and growing and support from fellow team members. I feel like the people are very welcoming and make Kantox an easy place to feel at home."



About Kantox

Kantox is a leading fintech company developing sophisticated Currency Management Automation software solutions that help companies to automate their foreign exchange processes and leverage currencies for growth.

We are a 170-person strong team, split between London and Barcelona. So far, we've raised over €30 million and became profitable in 2018. Thanks to our clients, we continue to grow at a fast pace. Clients in 75 countries have already exchanged more than USD $18 billion with us!

In October 2022, BNP Paribas signed an agreement for the acquisition of Kantox. Kantox will continue to operate as an independent company, now with the experience and market power of BNP Paribas behind it. The acquisition is subject to regulatory approvals and is expected to be completed in the coming months.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

Kantox is deeply committed to diversity, equity and inclusion both in our hiring practices and in our experiences as a Kantox employee.

We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer and encourage all applicants regardless of race, religion, or belief (if any), color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, gender, gender identity, pregnancy and maternity, sexual orientation, age, marital and civil partnership status, or disability status.
Show more

  • Strong academic background in engineering, finance, economics or business administration with a relevant master's degree or similar
  • Knowledge and interest about trading and/or foreign exchange (FX) products
  • Proficiency with MS Excel / Google Sheets for data analysis
  • Basic knowledge of Power BI (or similar) interface and features
  • Basic SQL queries for data extraction and manipulation
  • Basic understanding of Python/R syntax and data structures
  • Proficient in English


Mindset:

  • Fast learner; you will go through an intensive training program during your onboarding
  • Tech-appetite!
  • Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills
  • Hands-on attitude, very organised and able to meet deadlines


Benefits

What we offer

  • Competitive salary
  • Sponsored learning budget
  • Free private health insurance
  • Free Spanish, English and French lessons
  • Relocation package if needed
  • 31 days of annual vacations
  • Gym discounts and free sports activities
  • Ticket Restaurant with monthly credit and regular cross-team lunches
  • Daily fresh fruit and a beautiful office with 360-degree views of Barcelona


Our culture

  • An environment of innovation, accountability, and constructive feedback
  • A diverse and multicultural team of over 40 different nationalities
  • Grow your role and build your career with our learning and development opportunities
  • A collaborative and inclusive culture of sharing and teamwork. Build connections for life
  • Hybrid working and flexible hours so you can work when and where you feel best
  • Some testimonials: "The culture and the people at Kantox make me want to recommend Kantox as a place to work. There is a good balance between learning and growing and support from fellow team members. I feel like the people are very welcoming and make Kantox an easy place to feel at home."


About Kantox

Kantox is a leading fintech company developing sophisticated Currency Management Automation software solutions that help companies to automate their foreign exchange processes and leverage currencies for growth.

We are a 170-person strong team, split between London and Barcelona. So far, we've raised over €30 million and became profitable in 2018. Thanks to our clients, we continue to grow at a fast pace. Clients in 75 countries have already exchanged more than USD $18 billion with us!

In October 2022, BNP Paribas signed an agreement for the acquisition of Kantox. Kantox will continue to operate as an independent company, now with the experience and market power of BNP Paribas behind it. The acquisition is subject to regulatory approvals and is expected to be completed in the coming months.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

Kantox is deeply committed to diversity, equity and inclusion both in our hiring practices and in our experiences as a Kantox employee.

We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer and encourage all applicants regardless of race, religion, or belief (if any), color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, gender, gender identity, pregnancy and maternity, sexual orientation, age, marital and civil partnership status, or disability status.

Title: Data Analyst - Account Management Operations (They/She/He)
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.

💪 Our career development philosophy.

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

In this role you will be part of the Account Management Team at Glovo Headquarters, that is focused on growing and retaining Glovo partners. You will be directly responsible for overseeing, challenging and rethinking the processes, data & tools of the post-sales operational landscape, based on solid data driven conclusions, so that they can be implemented on a global scale.

THE JOURNEY


Stakeholder management: Partner closely with senior sales leaders and cross functional partners to align on strategy
Communication: find simple ways to convey insights and recommendations from sophisticated analysis results to business leaders.
Data Analysis: Utilize advanced data analysis techniques to interpret complex datasets; Analyze and report weekly and monthly metrics to identify trends and stop opportunities for improvement.
Process Optimization: leverage critical thinking skills to analyze Account Management processes and lead the implementation of optimization strategies to drive efficiency and effectiveness in sales operations.
Automation: Design and implement automation solutions to remove manual processes.
Planning: Partner with Account Management leadership to set performance targets for local teams, recommend actions for improvement and work together to integrate positive changes within the operational environment.
Forecast: provide analytical and operational support to continuously improve our forecasting, pipeline management, and methodologies and processes.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


Bachelor or equivalent in Business Administration, Economics, Mathematics, Finance, Accounting
4+ years of work experience with 2+ years in Sales Operations, preferably in a fast-growing B2B environment.
Technical and Proficient in data. Analyzing data sets with SQL queries, or crafting models and prototype tools, data is a core part of your toolkit.
Experience with BI tools and data visualization like Tableau, Power BI or Looker.
Experience with Salesforce.
Experience in complex problem solving, and working in a fast paced environment.
Demonstrated ability in critical thinking and process optimization, with a proven track of identifying inefficiencies and implementing solutions to enhance business operations.
Verbal and written communication skills. Strong consensus building and executive presence to communicate and defend plans.


Nice to have


Experience with Python or R is a strong plus.
Experience with forecasting and target setting, using data to establish future goals.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Data Analyst / Pentaho
Description:
For one of our clients in Barcelona, we are looking for a professional with over 2 years of experience in Pentaho.

Position: Data analyst/ pentaho

Profile: We are looking for a data analyst / pentaho with more than 2 years of experience.

Project: Financial Services Enhancement Program

Methodology: Fully remote work, with occasional attendance at general meetings in the office (at least once every two months).

Essential Requirements:

Minimum of 2 years of experience in Pentaho development.
Strong programming skills in Pentaho, as this will be the primary daily task.
Ability to communicate effectively in Spanish.

Desirable Requirements/Soft Skills:

Experience in the banking sector is valued but not mandatory.
Knowledge in Business Intelligence (BI) and Data Warehouse modeling.
Familiarity with Snowflake and how to model a Data Warehouse.

Conditions:

Location: Barcelona, hybrid model
Schedule: 5 days per week, full-time
Contract: Freelance, services with Huxley
Hourly Rate:
Junior: 32-35-38 euros per hour
Mid: 40-45 euros per hour
Senior: 45-50 euros per hour
Start Date: ASAP

If you are interested, send us your CV and we will contact you as soon as possible!

Title: Services Data Analyst and Engineering
Description:
Job Summary


This role is responsible for data collection procedures, including accurate and relevant data for machine learning models, extracting and analyzing data from the primary and secondary database. The role ensures data integrity and compliance by performing data cleansing and data validations. The role performs root-cause analysis and recommends or executes corrective actions when data related system problems occur. The role applies developed subject matter knowledge to solve common and complex business issues within established guidelines and recommends appropriate alternatives.


Responsibilities


Designs and establishes secure and performant data architectures, enhancements, updates, and programming changes for portions and subsystems of data pipelines, repositories or models for structured/unstructured data.
Analyzes design and determines coding, programming, and integration activities required based on general objectives and knowledge of overall architecture of product or solution.
Writes and executes complete testing plans, protocols, and documentation for assigned portion of data system or component; identifies and debugs, and creates solutions for issues with code and integration into data system architecture.
Leads a project team of other data engineers to develop reliable, cost effective and high-quality solutions for assigned data system, model, or component.
Collaborates and communicates with project team regarding project progress and issue resolution.
Analyzes data inaccuracies, identifies opportunities and supports the development of automated solutions to enhance overall quality of the enterprise data.
Identifies problematic areas and conducts research to determine the best course of action to correct the data; identifies, analyzes and interprets trends and patterns in complex datasets.
Works cross-functionally with different departments to assess, define, and develop report deliverables.
Represents the software data engineering team for all phases of larger and more-complex development projects.
Provides guidance and mentoring to less experienced staff members.


Education & Experience Recommended


Four-year or Graduate Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Software Engineering, Statistics/ Mathematics, or any other related discipline or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence.
Typically has 4-7 years of work experience, preferably in data analytics, data engineering, data modeling, or a related field or an advanced degree with 3-5 years of work experience.


Preferred Certifications


Programming Language/s Certification (SQL, Python, or similar)


Knowledge & Skills


Agile Methodology
Amazon Web Services
Apache Hadoop
Apache Kafka
Apache Spark
Big Data
Computer Science
Data Analysis
Data Engineering
Data Modeling
Data Pipelines
Data Warehousing
Extract Transform Load (ETL)
Java (Programming Language)
Machine Learning
Microsoft Azure
Python (Programming Language)
Scala (Programming Language)
Scalability
SQL (Programming Language)


Cross-Org Skills


Effective Communication
Results Orientation
Learning Agility
Digital Fluency
Customer Centricity


Impact & Scope


Impacts multiple teams and may act as a team or project leader providing direction to team activities and facilitates information validation and team decision making process.


Complexity


Responds to moderately complex issues within established guidelines.


Disclaimer


This job description describes the general nature and level of work performed in this role. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, skills, responsibilities, knowledge, etc. These may be subject to change and additional functions may be assigned as needed by management.

Title: Technical Analyst - BI Data Analyst
Description:
Overview

WELCOME TO SITA

We're the team that keeps airports moving, airlines flying smoothly, and borders open. Our tech and communication innovations are the secret behind the success of the world’s air travel industry.

You'll find us at 95% of international hubs. We partner closely with over 2,500 transportation and government clients, each with their own unique needs and challenges. Our goal is to find fresh solutions and cutting-edge tech to make their operations run like clockwork. Want to be a part of something big?

Are you ready to love your job? The adventure begins right here, with you, at SITA.

About The Role & Team

Our team is in search of a BI Data Analyst with experience in an operational role, focusing on building and maintaining high-quality data sets. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data quality and controls, with a proven track record of enhancing data-driven decision-making processes. As a BI Data Analyst, you will be responsible for maintaining the transforming raw data into meaningful insights and ensuring the integrity and accuracy of our data infrastructure.

What You’ll Do


Develop Power BI Reports: Create comprehensive and interactive reports and dashboards in Power BI, utilizing data to deliver quality data sets that enable actionable insights to business stakeholders.
Ensure Data Quality: Monitor data sets, employing advanced data validation and cleansing techniques to maintain high standards of data integrity and quality.
Data Integration and Transformation: Monitor and build integration and transformation from various sources, preparing it for in-depth analysis and visualization in Power BI.
Optimize Power BI Performance: Tune Power BI data sets and dashboards for optimal performance, ensuring efficient data refreshes and query execution against data sources.
Documentation and Compliance: Maintain accurate and comprehensive documentation of data models, ETL processes, and reporting frameworks within PostgreSQL and Power BI environments, adhering to data governance and privacy standards.



Qualifications

ABOUT YOUR SKILLS


Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology or Data Science with a strong emphasis on analytics.
At least 4 years working experience in a BI/Data Analyst role, with a focus on data quality and controls, particularly using Power BI for reporting and analytics.
Certification in Power BI or equivalent professional training
Proficiency in managing relational databases with a good understanding of its advanced features like support for various data types (numbers, text, JSON, XML, arrays), ensuring data integrity, and leveraging SQL for database access and manipulation.
Knowledge of agile methodology principles
Clear communication skills, capable of mentoring and guiding teams with a focus on financial analytics.
You are assertive, highly motivated, with the ability to influence outcomes, drive issues to closure, and pursue challenging goals vigorously.
You possess good communication skills, capable of engaging in various forms of discussions.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
You exhibit proficient data management and analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.



NICE-TO-HAVE


Using Azure DevOps for project management and collaboration.



What We Offer

We’re all about diversity. We operate in 200 countries and speak 60 different languages and cultures. We’re really proud of our inclusive environment. Our offices are comfortable and fun places to work, and we make sure you get to work from home too. Find out what it's like to join our team and take a step closer to your best life ever.

🏡 Flex Week: Work from home up to 2 days/week (depending on your team’s needs)

⏰ Flex Day: Make your workday suit your life and plans.

🌎 Flex Location: Take up to 30 days a year to work from any location in the world.

🌿Employee Wellbeing: We’ve got you covered with our Employee Assistance Program (EAP), for you and your dependents 24/7, 365 days/year. We also offer Champion Health - a personalized platform that supports a range of wellbeing needs.

🚀Professional Development: Level up your skills with our training platforms, including LinkedIn Learning!

🙌🏽 Competitive Benefits: Competitive benefits that make sense with both your local market and employment status.

SITA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value a diverse workforce. In support of our Employment Equity Program, we encourage women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities to apply and self-identify in the application process.

Title: Associate Data Scientist
Description:
Career Growth, Flexibility and Collaboration!

Entrust is an innovative leader in identity-centric security solutions, providing an integrated platform of scalable, AI-enabled security offerings. Headquartered in Minnesota, we offer our colleagues the ability to work globally, in a flexible and collaborative environment. Our team makes an impact!!

The Company: Entrust relies on curious, dedicated and innovative individuals whom anticipate the future and provide solutions for a more connected, mobile and secure world. Entrust’s technologies and expertise help government agencies, enterprises and financial institutions in more than 150 countries serve and safeguard citizens, employees and consumers.

We Believe: Securing identities is most effective when we value all identities. We are committed to ensuring that, through diversity and inclusion, the many voices that make up our communities are heard. From unconscious bias training for managers to global affinity groups that create connections both within and across our enterprise, Entrust expects and encourages all individuals to accept and respect one another. And, of course, to be themselves.

We are looking for Associate Data Scientist

Position Overview

In this role, as the Product Data Scientist, you will support the Product organisation to take data driven decisions. You will work on complex and never before explored problems delivering insight on unique and interesting datasets. This role is a hands-on delivery-oriented role with a healthy mix of leading a team while owning one of the key delivery workstreams.

Responsibilities


Technical hands-on delivery on measuring product performance through the product development cycle i.e. design experiments to test the hypothesis, define success metrics of features, define the data points needed capturing to facilitate accurate measurement.
Apply technical data skills (data science, statistics, coding/scripting) to produce strategic as well as tactical insights that will aid product strategy, discovery and planning
Work in partnership with product managers, applied scientists, engineers and product improvement teams to define, measure and communicate product metrics
Ensure alignment in analytical delivery between Product, R&D and BI Team
Help and educate a diverse group of data users to utilise Onfido’s tools and data assets


Requirements


Last year of a Master's degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, Economics, etc.)
Fluency with Data Science standard technologies such as SQL, Python and different BI tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau etc..)
Be a self-starter who takes the initiative in spotting opportunities and finding ways to solve business problems using data
Demonstrable technical experience using analytical tools, statistics and data science techniques to build experiments, test hypotheses and conduct analysis
Ability to be creative and think outside the box


Desirable


Experience in working with technology and product development teams
Good understanding of Agile methodologies
Experience in using big data & cloud technologies
SaaS and Product analytics background, understanding how to devise metrics and KPIs in a SaaS environment


About Entrust

Entrust is an innovative leader in identity-centric security solutions, providing an integrated platform of scalable, AI-enabled security offerings. We enable organizations to safeguard their operations, evolve without compromise, and protect their interactions in an interconnected world – so they can transform their businesses with confidence. Entrust supports customers in 150+ countries and works with a global partner network, we are trusted by the world most trusted organizations.

For more information, visit www.entrust.com. Follow us on, LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram, and YouTube

HTML:
Career Growth, Flexibility and Collaboration!

Entrust is an innovative leader in identity-centric security solutions, providing an integrated platform of scalable, AI-enabled security offerings. Headquartered in Minnesota, we offer our colleagues the ability to work globally, in a flexible and collaborative environment. Our team makes an impact!!

The Company: Entrust relies on curious, dedicated and innovative individuals whom anticipate the future and provide solutions for a more connected, mobile and secure world. Entrust’s technologies and expertise help government agencies, enterprises and financial institutions in more than 150 countries serve and safeguard citizens, employees and consumers.

We Believe: Securing identities is most effective when we value all identities. We are committed to ensuring that, through diversity and inclusion, the many voices that make up our communities are heard. From unconscious bias training for managers to global affinity groups that create connections both within and across our enterprise, Entrust expects and encourages all individuals to accept and respect one another. And, of course, to be themselves.

We are looking for Associate Data Scientist

Position Overview

In this role, as the Product Data Scientist, you will support the Product organisation to take data driven decisions. You will work on complex and never before explored problems delivering insight on unique and interesting datasets. This role is a hands-on delivery-oriented role with a healthy mix of leading a team while owning one of the key delivery workstreams.

Responsibilities

  • Technical hands-on delivery on measuring product performance through the product development cycle i.e. design experiments to test the hypothesis, define success metrics of features, define the data points needed capturing to facilitate accurate measurement.
  • Apply technical data skills (data science, statistics, coding/scripting) to produce strategic as well as tactical insights that will aid product strategy, discovery and planning
  • Work in partnership with product managers, applied scientists, engineers and product improvement teams to define, measure and communicate product metrics
  • Ensure alignment in analytical delivery between Product, R&D and BI Team
  • Help and educate a diverse group of data users to utilise Onfido’s tools and data assets

Requirements

  • Last year of a Master's degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, Economics, etc.)
  • Fluency with Data Science standard technologies such as SQL, Python and different BI tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau etc..)
  • Be a self-starter who takes the initiative in spotting opportunities and finding ways to solve business problems using data
  • Demonstrable technical experience using analytical tools, statistics and data science techniques to build experiments, test hypotheses and conduct analysis
  • Ability to be creative and think outside the box

Desirable

  • Experience in working with technology and product development teams
  • Good understanding of Agile methodologies
  • Experience in using big data & cloud technologies
  • SaaS and Product analytics background, understanding how to devise metrics and KPIs in a SaaS environment

About Entrust

Entrust is an innovative leader in identity-centric security solutions, providing an integrated platform of scalable, AI-enabled security offerings. We enable organizations to safeguard their operations, evolve without compromise, and protect their interactions in an interconnected world – so they can transform their businesses with confidence. Entrust supports customers in 150+ countries and works with a global partner network, we are trusted by the world most trusted organizations.

For more information, visit www.entrust.com. Follow us on, LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram, and YouTube

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Who We Are

Cint is a pioneer in research technology (ResTech). Our customers use the Cint platform to post questions and get answers from real people to build business strategies, confidently publish research, accurately measure the impact of digital advertising, and more. The Cint platform is built on a programmatic marketplace, which is the world’s largest, with nearly 300 million respondents in over 150 countries who consent to sharing their opinions, motivations, and behaviours.

We are feeding the world’s curiosity!

Job Description

The Opportunity

Reporting to the VP of Platform Intelligence, the Data Analyst – Platform Intelligence is part of a cross-departmental discipline at Cint that provides insight on how our algorithms influence feasibility, delivery, and financial performance. These insights are used to improve our products to achieve financial targets and ensure our platform is optimized to deliver at full potential.

The incumbent will collaborate closely with Product and Technology stakeholders and will consult with Commercial, Operations and Finance teams to understand, explain, and predict how platform algorithms affect clients and partners.

What You Will Do


Develop a comprehensive, nuanced, and predictive understanding of sample ecosystem dynamics (price elasticity, demand/supply clearing) and their underlying mechanics
With Cint’s Product Managers and engineers, enhance our products to confidently achieve predicted outcomes and optimize delivery
Provide advisory support to Product Development teams for subjects related to Platform Intelligence and/or insight driven product development
Create deliverables that express ecosystem dynamics simply and effectively to senior-level audiences, such as:
Visualizations of ecosystem metrics and trend analysis
Trend reports that track the impact and effectiveness of yield operations over time
Decision support documents for high-risk changes
Recommendations for development of Supply pipeline for commercial teams
Recommendations for development of Demand pipeline for commercial teams

Qualifications

What We Are Looking For:


Few years of working experience with pricing analytics and marketing or behavioral analytics
Previous experience with online market research methods/products is strongly preferred.
Explaining and defending analytical techniques in front of lay audiences
Experience with SQL and in working with large-scale databases
Experience with statistical computing languages like Python, R (statistical and data manipulation packages)
Experience in creating and maintaining dashboards using reporting or BI tool
Highly accountable self-starter and quick learner who is driven to deliver
Multiculturally competent
Excellent written and verbal communication with the ability to create data stories to drive product innovation
Ability to understand the big picture as well ensure the accuracy of details
Passionate about driving value using data and technology


Additional Information

Our Values

Collaboration is our superpower


We uncover rich perspectives across the world
Success happens together
We deliver across borders.


Innovation is in our blood


We’re pioneers in our industry
Our curiosity is insatiable
We bring the best ideas to life.


We Do What We Say


We’re accountable for our work and actions
Excellence comes as standard
We’re open, honest and kind, always.


We are caring


We learn from each other’s experiences
Stop and listen; every opinion matters
We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion.


More About Cint

In June 2021, Cint acquired Berlin-based GapFish – the world’s largest ISO certified online panel community in the DACH region – and in January 2022, completed the acquisition of US-based Lucid – a programmatic research technology platform that provides access to first-party survey data in over 110 countries.

Cint Group AB (publ), listed on Nasdaq Stockholm, this growth has made Cint a strong global platform with teams across its many global offices, including Stockholm, London, New York, New Orleans, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney. (www.cint.com)

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Pozuelo de Alarcón, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
Grenergy es un productor independiente de energía (IPP) que integra el desarrollo, construcción, operación y mantenimiento de plantas de energía renovable a gran escala. La compañía incorpora además sus propios equipos dedicados a la originación de PPAs, financiación estructurada y M&A, generando eficiencias como consecuencia de la integración de todo el proceso.




A finales de 2019, dimos el salto a Mercado Continuo (Bolsa de Madrid), consolidando nuestro crecimiento y permitiéndonos continuar con nuestro ambicioso plan de expansión internacional. En la actualidad, contamos con presencia en 12 países: España (HQ), Chile, Colombia, Perú, México, Argentina, Italia, Alemania, Reino Unido, Polonia, Rumanía y Estados Unidos.




Grenergy ya cuenta con cerca de 1GW de proyectos en operación y construcción, y con un pipeline de 10GW de proyectos solares y eólicos en distintas etapas de desarrollo. Además, en 2021, la compañía ha invertido recursos para avanzar en el desarrollo de un pipeline adicional de casi 5GWh de proyectos de almacenamiento.




Debido a este crecimiento y a la fuerte apuesta de Grenergy, actualmente buscamos incorporar a un/a Data Analyst en nuestro equipo de Asset Management:




Cómo será tu día a día:




Desarrollar y mantener procesos de extracción de datos desde diferentes fuentes externas mediante el uso de APIs. Asegurar la integración y la calidad de los datos extraídos.
Gestión de Bases de Datos: Diseñar, implementar y mantener bases de datos eficientes y seguras. Asegurar la integridad, consistencia y disponibilidad de los datos.
Mejora permanente en las herramientas de reporting, incorporando las buenas prácticas presentes en el mercado.
Control y reporte del desempeño técnico-económico de activos fotovoltaicos y eólicos de la Compañía.
Colaboración interdepartamental: Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con otros equipos
Técnicos y financieros para entender las necesidades de datos y proporcionar soluciones eficientes.




Requisitos de la posición:




Ingeniería informática, Industrial, ADE o similar.
Al menos 1 año de experiencia en un rol similar.
Deseable formación en Big Data y/o Data Science.
Deseable experiencia en el sector energético y/o productivo industrial.
Nivel de inglés B2.
Microsoft office avanzado: Excel, Power BI, Power Point.
Dominio de SQL o similar. Experiencia con herramientas y lenguajes de programación para la extracción y manipulación de datos (Python, Java, etc.).
Familiaridad con herramientas de integración y ETL.
Comprensión de principios de seguridad y privacidad de datos.
Herramientas de automatización de scripts (AirFlow, PowerAutomate, etc).
Conocimientos en cloud (Azure) y arquitectura.
Buenas habilidades comunicacionales, proactividad y trabajo en equipo.
Motivación y pasión por el desarrollo de las energías renovables.




Ofrecemos gran desarrollo profesional y estabilidad en un sector en auge, en una empresa cotizada en pleno crecimiento y expansión internacional, así como buen ambiente en un equipo joven y dinámico.




Grenergy se compromete a ofrecer igualdad de oportunidades laborales, sin discriminación, a todos los empleados y candidatos sin distinción de raza, sexo, edad, ascendencia, color, religión, discapacidad, estado civil, origen, identidad de género, orientación sexual o cualquier otra característica.

Title: Analista de datos Junior
Description:
Somos una multinacional canadiense especializada en consultoría tecnológica, con presencia en 21 sectores en más de 400 ubicaciones en todo el mundo, proveemos servicios de consultoría de negocio y de TI integrales, escalables y sostenibles que están analizados globalmente y entregados localmente.




Estamos buscando un/a Analista de Datos (junior) para impulsar nuestro equipo y realizar un trabajo de calidad del dato y realización de modelos de control para un cliente estratégico dentro de un gran proyecto.




Habilidades y Competencias Técnicas:

•Experiencia con Power BI

•Experiencia con SQL

•Experiencia con Python

•Conocimientos en el sector seguros




Grupo CGI ofrece:




-Contratación indefinida

-Horario flexible.

-Proyectos estable de larga duración.

-Pertenecer a un equipo de trabajo altamente cualificado en una empresa joven en proceso de expansión.

-Trabajar en un ambiente de trabajo amigable, donde la estrecha relación con los managers y con RRHH facilita el espíritu emprendedor, el intercambio de ideas, la iniciativa y el desarrollo de las personas.

-Formación en distintas tecnologías.

-Desarrollo profesional.




Si tienes capacidad de trabajo y ganas de seguir aprendiendo en una empresa dinámica y en constante crecimiento... ¡Esta es tu oportunidad!

Title: Data Analyst (Beca)
Description:
Así somos:

VML es una agencia de innovación y crecimiento en un mundo en constante evolución. Contamos con un legado de un siglo de experiencia combinada, donde la creatividad se une a la tecnología para potenciar la inspiración.




Nuestra experiencia abarca todo el recorrido del cliente, ofreciendo profundos conocimientos en comunicación, comercio, consultoría, CRM, CX, datos, producción y tecnología. Proporcionamos soluciones integrales que resultan en proyectos revolucionarios.




Contamos con un equipo global de más de 30. 000 empleados en más de 150 oficinas en 64 mercados, cada uno contribuyendo a una cultura que valora la conexión, el sentido de pertenencia y el poder de las diferencias.




Este es el reto:

Buscamos a una persona que haya cursado o esté cursando alguna carrera relacionada con el análisis de datos y Big Data.




Nos ayudarás en las labores diarias en un proyecto internacional, utilizando herramientas como Phyton, SQL o Power BI.




Requisitos:

Tener disponibilidad para incorporarte el 7 de octubre.
Tener conocimientos básicos de las herramientas descritas.
Tener interés por desarrollarte en el mundo de data
Buen nivel de inglés hablado y escrito.
Poder firmar un convenio de prácticas con tu centro educativo sería genial.




La experiencia en VML:

Nuestras becas son un espacio donde hay lugar para el debate, la innovación y la transformación.
Las prácticas son remuneradas y la jornada laboral es de 25h/semana.
Nuestro modelo de trabajo es híbrido, pero se requerirá una mayor presencialidad en nuestras oficinas de Madrid.
No tenemos dress code. Ven como quieras a trabajar.




Próximos pasos:

Si has llegado hasta aquí es porque hemos conseguido llamar tu atención.😉

Apúntate a la oferta y el equipo de People echará un vistazo a tu CV. Si coincide con lo que buscamos, recibirás una llamada para conocernos mejor y que podamos contarte más sobre VML y sobre el rol.




Si necesitas un tip para el proceso: simplemente queremos que seas tú.




¿Te vienes? 🚀

Title: Data Analyst / Analista de Datos - Energy Research
Description:
👩‍💻 Data Analyst

📍 Madrid, Spain

💰 Competitive Salary + Bonus

🏠 2 Days Working From Home




Company:

My client operates within the research function of the energy markets sector, focusing on the analysis and interpretation of market dynamics, trends, and data.




Role:

Develop analyses and convey insights to enhance clients' decision-making by actively engaging in all aspects of client projects. This includes identifying issues, forming hypotheses, conducting analyses, and synthesising conclusions into actionable recommendations.
Combine strong quantitative skills with dedication and perform effectively in team-oriented environments.




Requirements:

Strong knowledge of the Energy Market.
Experience working in the Energy sector.
The ability to gather, analyse, and interpret complex quantitative data and information.
Solid experience with Python and Excel 5.
Must have a degree in Environmental Science, Physics, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field.




What's in it for you?

Combine strong quantitative skills with dedication and performance in team-oriented environments.
Work in a dynamic and intellectually stimulating yet supportive environment.
Enjoy autonomy and the opportunity to substantially influence major decisions in the energy sector.
Grow into an industry expert.
Opportunity for progression within the company.




Next Steps:

This is a chance to be a "Go-to" for the industry, with your work and insights globally recognised.




As long as your happy working in English, and looking to drive forward in your career then please do hit apply!




Empresa:

Mi cliente opera dentro de la función de investigación del sector de mercados energéticos, enfocándose en el análisis e interpretación de las dinámicas del mercado, tendencias y datos.




Rol:

Desarrollar análisis y transmitir perspectivas para mejorar la toma de decisiones de los clientes participando activamente en todos los aspectos de los proyectos de los clientes. Esto incluye identificar problemas, formular hipótesis, realizar análisis y sintetizar conclusiones en recomendaciones accionables. Combinar habilidades cuantitativas sólidas con dedicación y desempeñarse de manera efectiva en entornos orientados al trabajo en equipo.




Requisitos:

Conocimiento sólido del mercado de energía.
Experiencia laboral en el sector energético.
Capacidad para recopilar, analizar e interpretar datos e información cuantitativa compleja.
Experiencia sólida con Python y Excel.
Debe tener un título en Ciencias Ambientales, Física, Ingeniería, Matemáticas o un campo relacionado.




¿Qué te ofrece esto?

Combina habilidades cuantitativas sólidas con dedicación y rendimiento en entornos orientados al trabajo en equipo.
Trabaja en un entorno dinámico e intelectualmente estimulante, pero a la vez de apoyo.
Disfruta de autonomía y la oportunidad de influir de manera significativa en decisiones importantes en el sector energético.
Crece como un experto en la industria.
Oportunidad de progreso dentro de la empresa.




Próximos pasos:

Esta es una oportunidad para convertirte en un referente en la industria, con tu trabajo y perspectivas reconocidos a nivel global.

HTML:
👩‍💻 Data Analyst

📍 Madrid, Spain

💰 Competitive Salary + Bonus

🏠 2 Days Working From Home


Company:

My client operates within the research function of the energy markets sector, focusing on the analysis and interpretation of market dynamics, trends, and data.


Role:

  • Develop analyses and convey insights to enhance clients' decision-making by actively engaging in all aspects of client projects. This includes identifying issues, forming hypotheses, conducting analyses, and synthesising conclusions into actionable recommendations.
  • Combine strong quantitative skills with dedication and perform effectively in team-oriented environments.


Requirements:

  • Strong knowledge of the Energy Market.
  • Experience working in the Energy sector.
  • The ability to gather, analyse, and interpret complex quantitative data and information.
  • Solid experience with Python and Excel 5.
  • Must have a degree in Environmental Science, Physics, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field.


What's in it for you?

  • Combine strong quantitative skills with dedication and performance in team-oriented environments.
  • Work in a dynamic and intellectually stimulating yet supportive environment.
  • Enjoy autonomy and the opportunity to substantially influence major decisions in the energy sector.
  • Grow into an industry expert.
  • Opportunity for progression within the company.


Next Steps:

This is a chance to be a "Go-to" for the industry, with your work and insights globally recognised.


As long as your happy working in English, and looking to drive forward in your career then please do hit apply!


Empresa:

Mi cliente opera dentro de la función de investigación del sector de mercados energéticos, enfocándose en el análisis e interpretación de las dinámicas del mercado, tendencias y datos.


Rol:

Desarrollar análisis y transmitir perspectivas para mejorar la toma de decisiones de los clientes participando activamente en todos los aspectos de los proyectos de los clientes. Esto incluye identificar problemas, formular hipótesis, realizar análisis y sintetizar conclusiones en recomendaciones accionables. Combinar habilidades cuantitativas sólidas con dedicación y desempeñarse de manera efectiva en entornos orientados al trabajo en equipo.


Requisitos:

  • Conocimiento sólido del mercado de energía.
  • Experiencia laboral en el sector energético.
  • Capacidad para recopilar, analizar e interpretar datos e información cuantitativa compleja.
  • Experiencia sólida con Python y Excel.
  • Debe tener un título en Ciencias Ambientales, Física, Ingeniería, Matemáticas o un campo relacionado.


¿Qué te ofrece esto?

  • Combina habilidades cuantitativas sólidas con dedicación y rendimiento en entornos orientados al trabajo en equipo.
  • Trabaja en un entorno dinámico e intelectualmente estimulante, pero a la vez de apoyo.
  • Disfruta de autonomía y la oportunidad de influir de manera significativa en decisiones importantes en el sector energético.
  • Crece como un experto en la industria.
  • Oportunidad de progreso dentro de la empresa.

Title: DATA TRAINEE
Description:
¡Oportunidad de Empleo!




Importante Empresa Tecnológica está en busca de un profesionales que quieran unirse a nuestro equipo dinámico y en constante crecimiento. Si quieres impulsar tu carrera profesional, esta es tu oportunidad.




Si estás buscando una empresa donde desarrollarte, crecer y aprender dentro de un sector en auge, nos encantaría conocerte pues buscamos recién titulados (as) con posibilidad de realizar prácticas para el departamento de DATA.




Buscamos personas apasionadas por aprovechar los datos para generar conocimientos y tomar decisiones informadas, con amplia capacidad analítica, alto ritmo de producción y autonomía para llevar tareas a cabo.




FUNCIONES:

Soporte analítico
Ayudar en las tareas de recopilación, limpieza y preprocesamiento de datos.
Manipular datos utilizando lenguajes de programación como Python o SQL.
Contribuir a tareas básicas de análisis de datos, como estadística descriptiva, análisis de datos exploratorios y prueba de hipótesis.
Ayudar a crear visualizaciones y paneles para comunicar los hallazgos de datos de manera efectiva.
Contribuir al desarrollo de modelos de datos y algoritmos.
Participar en la implementación de soluciones basadas en inteligencia artificial y aprendizaje automático.
Apoyar en la identificación de oportunidades para mejorar los procesos de datos.
Mejora y mantenimiento de modelos de Power BI




REQUISITOS:

Formación académica en matemáticas, estadística, física, ingeniería o informática.
Conocimientos Técnicos/Herremientas:
Conocimientos en SQL, Python o R.
Conocimientos de BigQuery, DBT, Airflow y Power BI.
Habilidades analíticas y de resolución de problemas excepcionales.
Capacidad para trabajar de manera independiente y colaborativa en un entorno dinámico.




OFRECEMOS:




Trabajo híbrido
Jornada flexible
27 días de vacaciones
Bolsa económica de 500€
Oportunidad de trabajar en proyectos reales y relevantes.
Mentoría y apoyo continuo de profesionales experimentados.
Ambiente de trabajo dinámico y colaborativo.




Si estás listo/a para llevar tu carrera al siguiente nivel y formar parte de una empresa que valora la innovación y el desarrollo profesional, te invitamos a postularte.

Title: DATA ANALYST - CONTROLLING
Description:
En Mango inspiramos y unimos mediante nuestra pasión por el estilo y la cultura. Estamos en más de 115 países y nuestra presencia online se extiende a más de 110 países. Nuestro equipo está formado por personas de 112 nacionalidades y en un 78% por mujeres.

Buscamos un/a

DATA ANALYST - CONTROLLING

¿CÓMO SERIA TU DÍA A DÍA EN MANGO?

Para formar parte de nuestro equipo de Reporting dentro del departamento de Control de gestión buscamos un/a Data Analyst.

Participarás en proyectos con el objetivo de simplificar el acceso a la información, generar valor con los datos y capacitar a los usuarios de herramientas para acelerar la toma de decisiones.

Funciones


Participarás en proyectos con el objetivo de simplificar el acceso a la información, generar valor con los datos y capacitar a los usuarios de herramientas para acelerar la toma de decisiones
Crearás una red de contactos multidisciplinares en la organización para garantizar el éxito de los proyectos
Darás soporte en la elaboración y análisis del reporting mensual financiero
Darás soporte en la creación y mantenimiento de dashboards en diferentes herramientas de BI: Looker, PowerBI y SAP BO
Liderarás la automatización y simplificación del reporting mensual financiero a través de PowerBI
Realizarás análisis complejos para permitir la toma de decisiones basada en datos
Sintetizarás los datos procedentes de múltiples fuentes y desarrollar hipótesis
Proporcionarás ideas clave, recomendaciones y presentarlas a los diferentes interlocutores


¿QUÉ ESPERAMOS DE TI?


Master en Ingeniería, ADE, Estadística o Matemáticas
Experiencia mínima de 1-2 años en Análisis de datos, consultoría de BI o consultoría de negocio
Conocimientos en SQL, herramientas de BI y lenguajes de programación
Dominio de Excel
Buscamos personas con Learning Agility, influyentes, analíticas, rigurosas, con buenas dotes de comunicación, capacidad resolutiva y altamente orientada a cliente interno & negocio
Orientación a negocio y mentalidad resolutiva: capacidad de analizar, interpretar, sintetizar y comunicar impactos y tendencias a través de los datos


¿QUÉ NOS HACE ESPECIALES?


Horario Flexible (entrada de 8h a 9h30 y salida de 17h a 18h30), jornada intensiva los viernes (de 8h a 9h hasta las 14h / 15h) y mayoría de vigilias de festivos
Posibilidad de Teletrabajo
Descuento en todas nuestras líneas (Woman, Man, Kids, Teen & Home) además de un Market de muestrario para renovar tu armario dos veces al año
Servicio de comedor y cocina en las instalaciones de central. La empresa subvenciona parte del menú diario, así como los artículos de cafetería
Retribución flexible con ventajas fiscales: seguro médico, formación, descuento comedor, guarderías etc.
Transporte gratuito de empresa desde Barcelona y el Vallés
Oportunidades constantes de desarrollo con retos muy variados que generan aprendizaje en el puesto de trabajo y cursos específicos en función de tus necesidades
Workshops, meetups, comunidades de prácticas, team buildings y company meetings sobre transformación digital, moda y actividades de nuestros equipos
Servicio médico propio, servicio de fisioterapia una vez a la semana, sala de fitness y vestuarios en nuestras oficinas centrales
Formarás parte de una empresa líder en el sector de la moda, dinámica, en plena innovación, con gran concienciación y realizando acciones hacia la sostenibilidad con un ambiente de trabajo cercano, inspirador y ambicioso


You got it?

We like you!

Title: Data Analyst Power BI
Description:
En Logicalis Spain estamos buscando un perfil de Analista de Datos con fuertes conocimientos en Power BI para unirse a nuestro equipo de análisis de datos donde serás responsable de transformar datos complejos en insights claros y accionables mediante la creación y optimización de informes y dashboards en Power BI.




El equipo de Data & Analytics de Logicalis trabaja con clientes nacionales e internacionales, llevando a cabo importantes proyectos de inteligencia artificial y analítica avanzada, estrategia del dato, gobierno, integración y arquitectura, abarcando todo el ciclo de vida del dato.




FUNCIONES

Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener informes y dashboards interactivos en Power BI que proporcionen insights clave para diferentes áreas de la empresa.
Optimizar modelos de datos en Power BI para mejorar el rendimiento y la eficiencia de los informes, asegurando tiempos de respuesta rápidos y uso eficiente de recursos.
Crear y mantener medidas y cálculos complejos utilizando DAX para proporcionar análisis avanzados y personalizados.
Utilizar Power Query para transformar y preparar datos provenientes de múltiples fuentes, asegurando que los datos sean precisos y estén listos para el análisis.
Crear visualizaciones de datos efectivas y persuasivas que comuniquen insights de manera clara y concisa.
Asegurar que los informes y dashboards estén actualizados y reflejen los datos más recientes, implementando actualizaciones y mejoras continuas.




REQUISITOS

Mínimo 2 años de experiencia trabajando con Power BI en un entorno profesional.
Experiencia avanzada en Power BI, incluyendo la creación de informes y dashboards complejos.
Experiencia en la integración de Power BI con otras plataformas y sistemas empresariales.
Dominio de DAX para crear cálculos y medidas avanzadas.
Sólida experiencia con Power Query para la transformación y preparación de datos.
Conocimientos en lenguajes de programación como SQL, Python, o R.
Valorable certificaciones en Power BI o análisis de datos.




BENEFICIOS

> Incorporación inmediata a compañía líder del sector IT con un alto grado de expertise en el área de Data & Analytics dónde nos encontramos en pleno proceso de expansión.

> Estabilidad laboral a través de contrato indefinido con amplias oportunidades de desarrollo profesional y crecimiento en la compañía.

> Modalidad de trabajo 100% remoto con flexibilidad para ir puntualmente a la oficina.

> Paquete retributivo muy competitivo acorde a la valía del candidato.

> Posibilidad de acogerse a planes de retribución flexible (tarjeta restaurante, tarjeta transporte y tarjeta guardería).

> Seguro médico y GYMPASS.

> Planes de formación adaptados a cada perfil (cursos técnicos, certificaciones oficiales, formación de idiomas...).

> Portal de descuentos especiales para empleados.

> Buen ambiente de trabajo y entorno muy colaborativo.
