Title: Data Engineer
Description:
M/F







DESAFIO:




Esta posição, integrada na equipa de Data Intelligence, constitui uma oportunidade única para se focar na centralização, coerência, fiabilidade e velocidade dos dados para várias áreas de negócio. É uma função essencial para otimizar o desempenho das análises e do conhecimento obtido pela organização.

Este profissional terá um papel fundamental no desenvolvimento de métodos e processos que garantam a organização correta e segura dos dados, que envolve a criação de modelos de dados consistentes e normalizados, além de assegurar a qualidade dos dados armazenados, preparados e disponibilizados através de pipelines para uso analítico e operacional.










PRINCIPAIS RESPONSABILIDADES:




• Desenvolver e Automatizar Pipelines: criar, automatizar e manter pipelines de dados usando processos CI/CD para transformar dados em informações úteis e acionáveis.

• Colaboração: colaborar com analistas de negócio e dados para melhorar os modelos de dados que alimentam as ferramentas de BI, aumentando a acessibilidade dos dados e promovendo decisões orientadas por dados em toda a organização.

• Governança de Dados: assegurar que as políticas de segurança de dados estejam alinhadas com os regulamentos de proteção de dados.

• Monitorização da Qualidade dos Dados: desenvolver, testar e manter sistemas para monitorizar a qualidade dos dados, garantindo que os dados de produção estejam sempre atualizados e disponíveis para os principais intervenientes e processos empresariais.

• Desenvolvimento de Estratégia: colaborar com todas as unidades de negócio e equipas técnicas para desenvolver a estratégia de uma arquitetura de dados a longo prazo.

• Apoio à Equipa: partilhar conhecimentos técnicos e de dados com outros membros da equipa, ajudando na coordenação de projetos e prioridades.










PERFIL:




• Formação Académica: Licenciatura Informática, Engenharia, Ciências de Dados (áreas similares)

• Experiência: +3 anos de experiência prática em engenharia de dados

• Conhecimentos Técnicos: experiência com plataformas cloud, modelação de dados, batch e streaming workloads, e bases de dados

• Tecnologias: familiaridade com tecnologias como Snowflake, Airflow, Python, Kafka, Azure Data Factory, entre outras

• Microsoft BI: conhecimento em tecnologias Microsoft BI (SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, Power BI)

• Habilidades Analíticas: capacidade analítica forte e atenção aos detalhes

• Relacionamento Interpessoal: excelente relacionamento interpessoal e habilidade para trabalhar em equipa

• Proatividade: dinamismo, proatividade e autonomia.







O QUE OFERECEMOS:




• Ambiente Inovador: trabalho com as tecnologias mais recentes num ambiente dinâmico

• Crescimento Profissional: oportunidades de desenvolvimento profissional contínuo

• Colaboração: um ambiente de trabalho colaborativo e de apoio mútuo.

• Impacto Real: participação em projetos que têm um impacto direto e significativo nos negócios.







Se és apaixonado por dados e ambicionas fazer parte de uma equipa que valoriza inovação e colaboração, gostaríamos de ter a oportunidade de te conhecer!

Se és apaixonado por dados e ambicionas fazer parte de uma equipa que valoriza inovação e colaboração, gostaríamos de ter a oportunidade de te conhecer!

Title: Data Engineer (m/f)
HTML:
A Dellent é uma empresa de consultoria especializada em Sistemas de Informação e Telecomunicações. O nosso objetivo é conseguirmos ajudar os nossos consultores e candidatos a integrarem projetos que vão ao encontro dos seus interesses, motivações e expectativas.

Se és um profissional apaixonado pelo universo automóvel e pela inovação na mobilidade, e queres enfrentar novos desafios, estás no sitio certo. Procuramos pessoas que queiram fazer parte de um projeto líder no setor, contribuindo para a transformação e excelência num ambiente dinâmico e desafiante.

Procuramos um(a) Data Engineer para um projeto híbrido ou remoto no Porto.

Como é Ser Data Engineer?

  • A integrar na equipa de Analytics, procuramos Data Engineer com capacidade de reunir grandes e complexos conjuntos de dados que atendam aos requisitos de negócios funcionais/não funcionais;
  • Desenho e Implementação de projetos de Analytics;
  • Identificar, definir e implementar melhorias de processos internos: automatizar processos manuais, otimizar a entrega de dados, redesenhar a infraestrutura para maior escalabilidade, etc.

O Que Valorizamos

  • Licenciado(a) em Engenharia Informática, Sistemas Informação ou similar;
  • Experiência na área de Analytics;
  • Experiência em DataWarehouse | SQL Server;
  • Preferencialmente experiência em Power BI;
  • Elevado sentido de responsabilidade, espírito de equipa, autonomia, proatividade e capacidade de adaptação;
  • Bons conhecimentos de Inglês e, preferencialmente, espanhol e francês;
  • Facilidade de comunicação e de relacionamento interpessoal;
  • Gosto pelo trabalho em equipa;
  • Capacidade de autonomia e organização;
  • Capacidade de análise;
  • Pro-atividade e dinamismo.

O que oferecemos?

  • Seguro de Saúde;
  • Plano de formação ajustado e personalizado, com um orçamento para gastares nas formações e livros técnicos que considerares necessários;
  • Feedback constante e acompanhamento para que possas crescer profissionalmente;
  • Processo de onboarding remoto;
  • Eventos de equipa todos os semestres para que possas viver novas aventuras;
  • Descontos e ofertas exclusivas nos nossos parceiros;
  • Cultura de proximidade e transparência. As tuas ideias e necessidades são ouvidas e valorizadas por nós!

Candidaturas

Submete a tua candidatura aqui. Para além disso, se também quiseres estar a par das novidades do mercado de trabalho sabe mais aqui.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We're building the future of advertising and are looking for innovative minds to help us do it.

Darkroom is a vertically integrated digital agency pioneering the next generation of consumer-facing brands. A category leader in results-driven growth marketing, Darkroom’s success is attributed to our unique partnership model, purposefully built to launch brands to market and accelerate growth across direct-to-consumer. We work with game-changing brands such as Crate & Barrel, Popchips, FEED, Olipop, & CALPAK.

Position Overview:

We're seeking a Data Engineer with a strong background in ETL processes, BigQuery, and Python to support a wide array of data engineering projects for our agency and enterprise clients. This role will focus on maintaining and optimizing our data infrastructure, ensuring the seamless flow of data, and providing the backbone for our data-driven decision-making.

This role supports teams working in US Eastern Standard/Daylight Time and should be flexible to support and work in these times.

What You’ll Do:


Design, build, and maintain scalable ETL processes to support data flow from various sources.
Maintain and optimize our BigQuery database, ensuring high performance and data integrity.
Write, troubleshoot, and optimize SQL queries to support various data needs.
Use Python to automate data processes, integrate data sources, and enhance data workflows.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Operations, Product, Marketing & Sales, Finance, and Engineering, to solve complex data problems.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports in Looker Studio to provide actionable insights to clients and internal teams.
Ensure continuous improvement of data processes through iterative testing and learning strategies.


You Should Apply If This Sounds Like You:


1 - 3 years of industry experience in data engineering, with a focus on maintaining and optimizing large-scale data systems.
Expertise in BigQuery, SQL, and Python for data processing, automation, and analysis.
Proven experience with ETL processes and tools.
Familiarity with data visualization tools, especially Looker Studio.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to manipulate, analyze, and interpret large datasets.
Experience in e-commerce marketing, with a strong understanding of platforms like Shopify, Meta (formerly Facebook) Ads, and Google Ads, is a plus.
Self-starter with an entrepreneurial spirit who thrives in a fast-paced environment.


What It’s Like to Work at Darkroom:

We're building the future of advertising and are looking for the minds to help us do it. We only seek out the best—from our clients to our people. Our team is our most sacred asset, and we offer highly competitive salaries and the following perks:


Unlimited Vacation Policy and Holidays: Rebooting is one of the most important parts of growth. At Darkroom, you have access to a flexible vacation policy, and 10 holidays throughout the year to keep you recharged and sharp.
Remote-First Culture: With hubs in LA, The Bay Area, New York, Philly, Lisbon, São Paulo, and Pakistan, we offer a strong community base and endless opportunities for growth.
Endless Opportunities for Growth: Our agency is founded on an interdisciplinary approach, giving Darkroomers insights into services far beyond your job description. Grow your skills and interests beyond your niche and stay at the forefront of the industry through total immersion in cross-functional collaboration.


Equal Opportunity Statement:

Darkroom is an equal opportunity workplace—we are dedicated to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national orientation, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
As one of the world's leading logistics companies, we have opened a new IT Hub in Porto, Portugal. Our vision is to lead the transformation of the logistics industry into a technology-enabled, data-driven value chain. We envision a world where product teams can easily discover and consume data across domains and source systems on a central data platform in a consistent way. We will achieve this by building a data network based on the new KN technology platform. Within this data network, data stores are the curated data products that represent the KN business as a digital twin. Join our fascinating and international working environment and be part of the team responsible for the further development of our digital logistics processes.

Your Role

As an IT Business Analyst for our Data Stores, you will be the domain and application expert, working closely with the engineering team. You will play a key role in designing and maintaining the conceptual and logical domain model behind our data products covering sea, air and road logistics. You will translate user cases and requirements relevant to our stakeholders into development-ready user stories. You will also work closely with the highly skilled engineering team in Hamburg and Porto and support them throughout the entire software lifecycle!

Your Responsibilities


Support all product management related tasks required to build and operate our data products.
Support the product team in requirements engineering: You will define the requirements of a use case and support the prioritization of requirements.
Specify user stories and epics to translate the roadmap into manageable elements to be implemented according to agile principles.
Test implemented features and support the team with root cause analysis in case of bugs.
Support product management by articulating tactical and strategic requirements to management, business stakeholders, and developers.
Support the maintenance of product related documentation.
Provide guidance, support, and mentorship to other team members.


Your Skills And Experiences


3+ years of requirements engineering/feature specification experience in software development or experience from working in a business intelligence team.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, including technical writing skills in English. Enjoy writing concise user stories and have strong experience writing good documentation.
Ability to gather and analyze requirements, abstract and communicate complex content to various stakeholder groups at all levels of the organization.
Experience working with data modeling or other formal specifications in complex environments, ideally at enterprise scale.
Self-starter, able to motivate the team in a dynamic environment. Team player, you enjoy working collaboratively and are willing to develop and empower others.
Master's degree in a logistics field with demonstrated technical aptitude or master's degree in a technical field (computer or natural sciences, engineering, business) with demonstrated interest in logistics.
Experience with the applied tech stack is a plus (Jira, Confluence, Enterprise Architect, AWS, Kafka, XML/XSD, Avro).
Fluency in written and spoken English. Portuguese and/or German is a plus.


Good Reasons to Join

Your work has a direct impact on the future of logistics and IT. Your team is made up of experts who are shaping the IT industry in Portugal and around the world. We want you to feel comfortable in our working environment, where you will be dealing with different cultures. That is why we offer flexible working hours and the opportunity to work remotely. We value teamwork, continuous learning and diversity. Kuehne + Nagel offers you a tailor-made career with individual planning and team leaders who will support you in every way. On a personal level, we support you with a wide range of work-life balance options, supplementary health insurance and our EAP - Employee Assistant Program.

Title: Data Engineer (Hybrid @Porto)
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Engineer

Seniority: 6+

Type of position: Hybrid (2x/week at Porto Office)




The amazing you, will have:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field;
6+ years of experience as a Data Engineer;
Expertise on end-to-end Data Pipeline Development, ETL processes and Alteryx;
Knowledge in Data Mesh concepts (Starburst, Trino);
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala;
Strong knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases;
Experience with Big Data technologies such as Databricks, Hadoop, Apache Spark, Kafka;
Availability for a hybrid regime at Porto (Portugal);
Fluency in English is mandatory.




To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you´ll have (plus):

French AND/OR Portuguese fluency.







Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!




Who are we?




Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Data Engineer (Portugal-based Remote/Hybrid)
HTML:
Sword Health is on a mission to free two billion people from pain as the world’s first and only end-to-end platform to predict, prevent and treat pain. Delivering a 62% reduction in pain and a 60% reduction in surgery intent, at Sword, we are using technology to save millions for our 2,500+ enterprise clients across three continents. Today, we hold the majority of industry patents, win 70% of competitive evaluations, and have raised more than $300 million from top venture firms like Founders Fund, General Catalyst, and Khosla Ventures. Recognized as a Forbes Best Startup Employer in 2023, this award highlights our focus on being a destination for the best and brightest talent. Not only have we experienced unprecedented growth since our market debut in 2020, but we’ve also created a remarkable mission and value-driven environment that is loved by our growing team. With a recent valuation of $2 billion, we are in a phase of hyper growth and expansion, and we’re looking for individuals with passion, commitment, and energy to help us scale our impact. Joining Sword Health means committing to a set of core values, chief amongst them to “do it for the patients” every day, and to always “deliver more than expected” on behalf of our members and clients. This is an opportunity for you to make a significant difference on a massive scale as you work alongside 800+ (and growing!) talented colleagues, spanning two continents. Your charge? To help us build a pain-free world, powered by technology, enhanced by people — accessible to all. As a Data Engineer you will be responsible for creating and delivering client reports, based on snapshots of our data warehouse. The ideal candidate will possess strong SQL skills, excellent communication abilities, and a keen eye for detail. you will work closely with both technical teams and non-technical stakeholders to align requirements and ensure that all reporting needs are met accurately and efficiently. What you'll be doing:

  • Develop and maintain SQL queries to extract data from the data warehouse for client reports
  • Maintain our Reporting framework and adding features to it (new layout capabilities)
  • Create and automate the delivery of data snapshots
  • Communicate complex technical processes and requirements clearly to non-technical stakeholders
  • Work closely with the Customer Success Manager to understand the reporting needs and ensure accurate alignment with their requirements
  • Ensure data accuracy and integrity in all reports and snapshots provided to clients
  • Troubleshoot and resolve any issues related to data extraction, transformation, and delivery
  • Collaborate with internal teams to optimize and improve data reporting processes
  • Maintain thorough documentation of all processes and procedures related to client reporting


What you need to have:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field (or equivalent experience)
  • Proven experience in a data reporting, for at least 2 years minimum
  • Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with data warehousing concepts
  • Experience with dbt and airflow are a plus
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain technical processes to non-technical stakeholders
  • Exceptional attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy
  • Proven ability to align requirements and deliverables with client needs
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment


What we would love to see:

  • Familiarity with data visualization tools and techniques is a plus
  • Comfortable with Customer Facing meetings
  • Capability of translating technical conversations to non technical stakeholders


To ensure you feel good solving a big Human problem, we offer:

  • A stimulating, fast-paced environment with lots of room for creativity
  • A bright future at a promising high-tech startup company
  • Career development and growth, with a competitive salary
  • The opportunity to work with a talented team and to add real value to an innovative solution with the potential to change the future of healthcare
  • A flexible environment where you can control your hours (remotely) with unlimited vacation
  • Access to our health and well-being program (digital therapist sessions)
  • Remote or Hybrid work policy


*Please note that this position does not offer relocation assistance. Candidates must possess a valid EU visa and be based in Portugal. US - Sword Benefits & Perks:

  • Comprehensive health, dental and vision insurance*;
  • Equity shares*;
  • Discretionary PTO plan*;
  • Parental leave*;
  • 401(k);
  • Flexible working hours;
  • Remote-first company;
  • Paid company holidays;
  • Free digital therapist for you and your family. *Eligibility: Full-time employees regularly working 25+ hours per week Portugal - Sword Benefits & Perks:
  • Health, dental and vision insurance;
  • Meal allowance;
  • Equity shares;
  • Remote work allowance;
  • Flexible working hours;
  • Work from home;
  • Unlimited vacation;
  • Snacks and beverages;
  • English class;
  • Unlimited access to Coursera Learning Platform. *US Applicants Only: Applicants must have a legal right to work in the United States, and immigration or work visa sponsorship will not be provided.* SWORD Health, which includes SWORD Health, Inc. and Sword Health Professionals (consisting of Sword Health Care Providers, P.A., SWORD Health Care Providers of NJ, P.C., SWORD Health Care Physical Therapy Providers of CA, P.C.*) complies with applicable Federal and State civil rights laws and does not discriminate on the basis of Age, Ancestry, Color, Citizenship, Gender, Gender expression, Gender identity, Gender information, Marital status, Medical condition, National origin, Physical or mental disability, Pregnancy, Race, Religion, Caste, Sexual orientation, and Veteran status

Title: Data Engineer (Scala)
Description:
Transformation, adaptability and innovation are part of our DNA.

We are passionate about technology and we want to be part of your story!

Do you want to make your career goals in IT real?

Do we share the same passion?

You have come to the right place, Smart!




What does it take to become a SMART Data Engineer (Scala) ?

The data engineer will participate in the development of various modules developed in Spark with Scala, in Hive, in HBase, in Indexima, and with interactions with Rest API and external databases such as SQLServer and Oracle. They will work in SCRUM in a team whose members are based between Portugal and France.

The data engineer will be involved in the technical design of the modules, their implementation and the automation of tests, and will also have to interact with operations to implement the modules.




Required qualifications :

Experienced with Scala
Experience with Big Data and NoSQL Technology (Hadoop, Spark, Hive, SolR, HBase, Kerberos)
English B2+




Nice to have:

Experience in an Agile environment (SCRUM)
Knowledge of ZIO, MONIX, CATS libraries is valued (functional programming)
Knowledge of Kafka and Schema Registry
Knowledge of Rest API




Why be SMART?

We make the projects we take part in real

We love what we do and take pride in the results of our work

We are simple and efficient We value our people

We are a dynamic team with integrity and trust




Join us and apply for this opportunity!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Alter Solutions Portugal is an IT Consultancy Company, promoter of Digital Transformation, part of the Alter Solutions Group, created in 2006, in Paris.

In 2022, Alter Solutions joined the act digital group, constituting a global community of talent in Technology, with presence in twelve countries: Germany, Belgium, Brazil, Canada, United States of America, Morocco, Spain, France, Luxembourg, Poland, Portugal and Serbia. Also in 2022, we were certified as a Great Place to Work©.

In Portugal, we partner with over 120 clients and a team of over 500 people, working in projects for industries as diverse as banking, insurance, transportation, aviation, energy, and telecom.

Headquarters of the Nearshore IT center, Alter Solutions Portugal has a dedicated team of around 30 specialized professionals, integrated into projects with several internationally renowned clients.



Job Description


You will work in the capacity of a Data Engineer focusing on the data deliverables for Business and Studio.
Designing and building data models to support Data Science, Business Intelligence, and downstream data sets.
Building APIs and data products to better integrate data throughout our systems and processes.
Monitoring the data pipelines and communicating any issues to leadership and partners.
Working closely with business partners and developers to ensure proper requirements are documented and agreed to for our different initiatives.
Partnering with developers and leadership to coordinate cross-function and cross-team efforts.


Qualifications


Proven experience with Data Engineer/Data Quality Engineer in a fast-paced environment
An expert developer using SQL and SQL-like query languages
Have deep expertise in Python and have experience organizing Python-based projects
Vast Experience with Databricks
Vast Experience with Spark for Big Data
Vast experience with ETL and ELT
Experience with Snowflake
Experience with Cloud AWS and/or Azure

Would be Nice to have:

Experience with Data BuildTool - DBT
Experience with Orchestrators such as Airflow
Have a strong understanding of different data modeling methodologies (Kimball, Inmon, Data Vault)
Experience with IaC's such as Terraform or Cloud Formation
Experience with CI/CD automation - using Jenkins

Title: Senior Data Governance Officer
HTML:
Company Description

Natixis in Portugal is a Centre of Expertise whose mission is to transform traditional banking by developing innovative solutions for the business, operations and work culture of Groupe BPCE worldwide.

Natixis in Portugal is part of the Global Financial Services division, where it applies technology for the development of financial expertise in its two global business lines – Corporate & Investment Banking and Asset & Wealth Management – and, transversally, for the entities of Groupe BPCE.

The Centre of Expertise, based in Porto, currently has more than 2,400 employees from over 30 nationalities, organised in three main departments: Information Technology, Banking Support Activities and Compliance. These teams work in an integrated, inclusive and transversal way, supporting and creating value for all the business lines and platforms of the group. The project in Porto is one of the biggest investments in Human Resources ever made by Groupe BPCE worldwide.

A disruptive mindset and a culture of proximity and agility identify Natixis in Portugal Team and reflect the company's mission to transform traditional banking at a global scale: a perfect match in the Portuguese dynamics and entrepreneurial ecosystem.

In 2024, Top Employers Institute has awarded Natixis in Portugal the Top Employer Portugal accreditation for the second time. This certification recognizes excellence in people practices, following the example of our head office, in France, who was certified Top Employer France for the eight year in a row.

Job Description

Team presentation and main goal:

As part of the Finance Direction, you will integrate the Financial Data Integrity department (FDI) which oversees the labelling of financial data for CIB activities of Natixis (balance sheet and off-balance sheet).

You will join a team of 6 people in Porto.

As a Senior Data Governance Officer, of a major French banking institution with international dimension, you will:

  • Support Data Management initiatives for Internal & Regulatory framework toward improvement of the quality of reports produced by Natixis CIB;
  • Participate in the Data monitoring for CIB activities (Financing, Global market, etc.)

You will be in contact with the other teams of FDI, internal Finance partners and Finance IT teams.

Main tasks and goals:

As a Senior Data Governance Officer, your primary tasks will be:

1- Data Systems and Analytics:

  • Develop solutions for data extraction, exploration, and transformation using SQL and other technologies;
  • Interface between business line and IT to translate business requirements into data sources and queries, supporting the creation of KPI metrics for dashboards;
  • Design and implement data architectures, along with new dashboards, to enhance business intelligence capabilities;
  • Manage and improve the use of data visualization tools like Power BI, ensuring the effective presentation of data to stakeholders;.
  • Own the creation and maintenance of scheduled reporting, including Power BI dashboards, to regularly inform business decisions.

2- Requirements and Coordination:

  • Oversee the full lifecycle of business requirements, from elicitation and analysis to documentation, management, and solution translation;
  • Plan and conduct workshops, interviews, and prototyping sessions to collect, clarify, and confirm business requirements;
  • Coordinate with Finance IT to monitor and prioritize the remediation plans and overall business requirements;
  • Ensure the effective coordination and implementation of financial issues remediation with relevant committees and IT teams.

3- Data Governance and Strategy (Technical View & Impact):

  • Participate in the coordination of the Data Domain Office (DDO) network for finance, including involvement in framework committees and data quality frameworks for projects regarding all technical request;
  • Contribute to the strategic planning of DM roadmap, aiming to align data management practices with business objectives regarding the technical impact.

4- Monitoring and Collaboration:

  • Monitor the implementation of business requirements and data strategies in collaboration with IT teams.
  • Support the management and enhancement of data visualization and BI solutions, fostering a culture of data-driven decision making.
  • Collaborate with various teams to promote cross-functional unity and ensure the seamless integration of technical data insights into business processes.

Additional information:

You will be part of a bi-localised team with a local manager and a functional manager Paris based, with regular interactions Paris team.

The ability to develop a network within the various teams of the Natixis ecosystem, and an aptitude for collaborative and group work are key factors of success in this position.

Qualifications

  • Master’s degree in Finance, Math, Data Analytics, Data Science or Data Engineering;
  • Data Management and Governance;
  • BCBS 239;
  • Banking environment, regulations, and products;
  • Data Analyst, with expertise in data visualization tools like Power BI and Tableau;
  • Data manipulation using DAX, M, Excel, SQL, and Python;
  • Synthesize complex datasets into clear visualizations and dashboards;
  • Big Data environments and technical tools for data analysis;
  • English (mandatory) and French (as a plus).

Soft Skills:

  • Strong communication and relationship-building skills;
  • Analytical mindset with problem-solving capabilities;
  • Curious, proactive, and able to work in a fast-paced environment;
  • Teamwork orientation and coaching skills to foster a collaborative atmosphere.

Only CV´s in English will be considered.

Additional Information

At Natixis, we are committed to fostering a working environment where each and every one of our people is treated with dignity and respect and where every voice is heard. Our differences make us collectively stronger and are a source of fulfilment, innovation and performance.

In the framework of its Diversity, Equity & Inclusion policy, Natixis in Portugal has implemented a Blind CV Screening process, with the purpose of reducing hiring bias. A blind CV excludes any personal details which refer to the applicant’s gender, age or ethnicity. When applying for our positions, please submit a blind CV, that is, with no picture, name, gender, age, nationality, ethnicity and address. Your personal statement, work experience, courses and certifications, education, skills and contact information is what matters to us.

#MuchMoreThanJustAJob

Early morning. Campo 24 de Agosto. In 4 minutes, you are clocking in at the office. Start your day having breakfast with the Team and grab fresh fruit on the way to your seat, in one of Porto’s most typical neighborhoods. This Purple Day is going to be a busy one: daily meeting ensuring all team members are on the same page regarding work status, priorities and blockers, language class and, just after, a Talent Management meeting with your manager, discussing your career path.

Lunch break. Today, your Team is onboarding newcomers, but also welcoming French colleagues: the perfect excuse to walk downtown and bond over a francesinha. When returning, inhale nature and peace of mind in Natixis Urban Garden (look at the crops; ready to harvest!).

Back inside. Brainstorming session on a new, exciting project in our disruptive and immersive Manaus Village. The afternoon went flying (tasks, meetings, some jokes with your teammates). End it on a high note: celebrating cultural diversity with a Diwali, the Indian festival of lights.

Tomorrow, you attend a conference led by influential speakers in your industry and, the day after, you will work from home, benefitting from some focus time to complete that report and soft skills course on LinkedIn Learning. Once you are done with your work for the day, strike the right note playing with Natixis band or be part of a board games session. If that is too steady for you, meet your colleagues to catch some waves or sail the Douro river during golden hour.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Hey there, future Data Engineer at Enlitia! 🌟 Ready to revolutionize renewable energy data? Join us in challenging the status quo. As a Data Engineer, you'll sync and harmonize global wind and solar data, forming the backbone for machine learning, process optimization, and operational excellence. You'll design and develop data engineering pipelines using the best tools to ensure data availability and consistency. Collaborate with cross-functional teams and communicate results effectively. If you're organized, motivated, and passionate about sustainability, we'd love to hear from you!

Key Responsibilities


Data Integration: Integrate new data sources, ensuring data consistency, reliability, and efficiency—like making sure all your ducks (or bytes) are in a row.
Database Management: Develop and optimize databases and data warehouses for top performance and reliability—because nobody likes a sluggish database. 🚀
ETL Processes: Create and manage ETL processes to move and transform data effectively—consider yourself the ultimate data mixologist. 🍹
Data Quality: Implement robust data quality checks to ensure data integrity throughout its lifecycle—keeping those data gremlins at bay.
Performance Tuning: Optimize data systems and pipelines for peak performance and scalability—because who doesn’t want their data to run like a well-oiled machine?
Documentation: Document data processes, architectures, and pipelines comprehensively—so future you doesn’t have to play detective.
Compliance: Ensure all data practices comply with relevant privacy and security regulations—keeping everything above board and out of trouble.
Collaboration: Work closely with data scientists, analysts, and stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver effective solutions—be the data whisperer everyone loves. 💬


Minimum Requirements

Requirements


Hold a BSc, MSc, or PhD in Computer Science, Electronic Engineering, or Systems Engineering—because we like our Data Engineers powered up. 🎓
3+ years of experience in data engineering or a related field. Show us your analytical battle scars (metaphorical, of course).
Proven experience with data pipelines design and orchestration, ideally with time-series data. Your data prowess speaks for itself. 📈
Proficiency in programming languages, mainly Python and SQL. Experience with OOP, Unix, and Git is essential. You're a coding ninja with these tools. 🥷
Experience specifically with MySQL, PostgreSQL, and TimescaleDB. These databases should be your playground.
Experience managing and manipulating relational databases. Knowledge of non-relational databases is a plus.
Basic knowledge of Docker is expected, as having some hands-on experience with it would be beneficial, although it's not a strict requirement.
Experience with APIs is an additional requirement, reflecting the need for modern data engineering practices.
Strong knowledge of ETL processes and data warehousing. You're the architect of our data world.
Understanding of big data frameworks and tools is a plus. Big data challenges are your playground.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills. No puzzle is too complex for you. 🧩
Strong communication and presentation abilities. You turn complex data into compelling stories.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment. Collaboration is your middle name (literally). 🤝
Attention to detail and a commitment to data quality. You ensure our data is always top-notch.


Nice To Have


DBT, Go, Unix/Bash. If you have experience in these areas, it's a significant plus!


Benefits And More


Extra vacation days, everyone deserves some time to recharge.
Healthcare insurance, because health is wealth.
Meal tickets, we know debugging builds an appetite.
Office options in Lisbon and Porto, because great work deserves a great location.
Learning allowance, knowledge is power.


About Us

At Enlitia, we're not just another startup; we're crafting the future of renewable energy with our top-notch algorithms and boundless enthusiasm. Join us in driving innovation and making sustainability more than just a buzzword.

Ready to enlighten the future?

Join us at Enlitia where tech meets sustainability, and every line of code makes a difference. Apply now and let's create a future we can all be proud of.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
Fundada em 2005, em Lisboa, a agap2IT é uma organização europeia na área dos Sistemas de Informação, Ciência e Tecnologia. A capacidade de intervir globalmente aliada à elevada experiência e know-how técnico, funcional e de negócio da equipa, garantem a excelência da resposta aos mais exigentes desafios.

Com o espírito agapiano e valores como a valorização humana, empreendedorismo e responsabilidade social, mais do que um projeto, terás a oportunidade de criares uma carreira à tua medida.

Descrição do perfil:

  • Licenciatura em Engenharia Informática ou similar;
  • 3 anos de experiência como Data Engineer;
  • Experiência com linguagens de programação (Python, Java, Scala,…)
  • Experiência com tecnologias de big data como Databricks e/ou Hadoop e/ou Spark;
  • Conhecimentos de Bases de Dados (SQL e/ou NoSQL);
  • Familiaridade com criação de pipelines é valorizada;
  • Experiência em ambientes cloud (AWS ou Azure ou GCP);
  • Conhecimentos gerais de programação orientada a objetos são valorizados;
  • Sólido conhecimento de inglês;
  • Conhecimento de francês é valorizado.


Os nossos incentivos agapianos são:

  • Seguro de saúde;
  • Seguro de vida e acidentes pessoais;
  • Formações (técnicas, comportamentais e linguísticas) e certificações (técnicas) gratuitas;
  • Protocolo com plataforma de descontos em diferentes setores;
  • Plano Vodafone (comunicações e banda larga móvel);
  • Acesso a consultas de nutrição, psicologia e medicina geral gratuitas;
  • Acompanhamento de progressão de carreira contínuo e personalizado.


Na agap2IT defendemos a igualdade e valorizamos a diversidade. Criamos um ambiente seguro, diversificado e onde as oportunidades são iguais para todos os colaboradores!

Não discriminamos com base em idade, etnia, orientação sexual, género, deficiência ou qualquer fator que não seja o mérito.

Todas as candidaturas com competências para o cargo são bem-vindas. Junta-te a nós!

Title: Data Developer
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique, and amazing YOU!




@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, teamwork.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability, or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




ONLY APPLY IF YOU ARE LEGAL TO WORK HERE IN PORTUGAL




We are looking for an Amazing: Data base Developer




Seniority: 4 years




Technical skills:

KSH development
Java development Spring Boot, Spring Batch
Python development (Data handling)
Toolchain CI/CD (principle, tools, automated test...)
Cloud concept with container, Object Storage (COS) and exchange protocol (type S3)

Proficiency knowledges:

Security rules and protocols
Exchange file protocols (CFT)
Distributed architecture
Integration of technical components with associated flows (3-party architecture, SAML authentication, Web services, https, etc.)
LINUX environment




English (C1)




The amazing you, will have:

French (B2 / C1)




ONLY APPLY IF YOU ARE LEGAL TO WORK HERE IN PORTUGAL




Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term;

Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity. Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster;

International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work;

Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):

In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you;

Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home;

Full Onsite projects: if you prefer the company of your colleagues!

Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psychologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!




Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Innovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Analytics Engineer - Saudi Arabia
Description:
Make an impact by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there’s a constant need to be innovative.

Be part of the team that combines business knowledge, technological edge and a design experience. Our different backgrounds and know-how are key in developing solutions and experiences for digital clients.

Face challenges and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there’s always room for your energy and creativity.

About The Role

Analytics Engineer is responsible to provide clean and transformed data ready for analysis using ETL/ELT. Analytics Engineers should have an analytical perspective about the big picture around the data involved in the process.

Their mission is to design and implement data pipelines and analytical tools to support data-driven decision-making within an organization.

They work closely with data analysts, data scientists, and other stakeholders to understand their requirements and deliver robust analytical solutions to drive the company to be aligned and focused on its goals.

As a part of your job, you will:


Designing and implementing data integration workflows using ETL tools such as Informatica, Talend, or Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS).
Transforming data to meet the requirements of the target system or data warehouse.
Loading transformed data into a data warehouse or other storage systems for reporting and analysis.
Collaborating with Data Analysts to ensure data integration solutions support the organization's reporting and analysis needs.
Monitoring and optimizing data integration processes to ensure data is loaded efficiently and accurately.



What are we looking for?


Know-how in working on development using languages as SQL, PL/SQL, and TSQL, among others;
Knowledge of Databases in Microsoft SQL Server;
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and technologies (e.g., Redshift, BigQuery, Snowflake);
Familiarity with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and tools (experience in Informatica Cloud is valued);
Experience in TIBCO Data Virtualization is valued;
Understanding of statistical analysis and data modeling techniques (e.g. Star Schema, Data Vault);
Knowledge of cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and their data services.



Personal traits:

Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams and Clients

Teamwork skills but also sense of autonomy

Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included

Willingness to collaborate with other players

Strong communication skills

We want people who like to roll up their sleeves and open their minds. Believe this is you? Come join the Team!

Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions – addressing Telecommunications, Energy & Utilities, Financial Services and other markets' strategic opportunities.

Serving Clients in 25+ countries, Celfocus delivers solutions such as accelerating digital network transformation in Autonomous Networks, elevating and monetising business services in B2B2x ecosystems, and providing highly relevant customer experiences through Hyper-personalisation solutions.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About us




We love data.

Envisioning advanced data architectures and bringing them to live is our passion.

reeeliance is a consultancy specializing in Data Management, Fast Data, Advanced Analytics, and DataOps. We further support our clients in modernizing their SAP landscape and moving their business to the cloud.




Based in Hamburg, Berlin, and Porto, we combine strategic foresight with sound data and software engineering craftsmanship to define, build, and operate scalable information ecosystems for our international clients, helping them transform into real data-driven enterprises.




About the role




Data is undeniably one of the world's most valuable resources. However, it's futile if it's not in the right place or the right setup. We strive to place data where it's needed most and can be used to its fullest potential.




Become a valued member of our data integration team and build with us highly scalable data architectures and fast data pipelines for our multinational clients. Our use cases range from data warehouse and lakehouse architectures implementations over IoT and data streaming setups to sophisticated AI scenarios, in industries ranging from manufacturing, consumer products, healthcare to banking and insurance, just to name a few.




Our Tech Stack at a glance

Coding: SQL, Python | Data Pipeline: Matillion, VaultSpeed | Data Storage: Snowflake, Azure Synapse | DevOps: Azure DevOps, GitLab




Your responsibilities:




In this role you have the chance to design, build and maintain data pipelines according to the client's business needs and embed them end-to-end into the given data stack
As a Data Engineer you will maintain and optimize the data infrastructure required for data extraction, transformation, and loading from a wide variety of data sources
You build, maintain, and deploy data artifacts on cloud platforms
You will ensure of data accuracy, integrity, privacy, security, and compliance by applying data quality assurances methods
Your responsibility will include monitoring of data pipeline performance as well as the implementation of optimization strategies
You will work together with both reeeliance and client staff as part of an agile team




Our requirements:




Proficiency in both classic and recent data modeling concepts
Applicable knowledge in data warehousing architectures and best practice design
Experience and confidence in using at least one ETL tool and proficiency in Python
Ability to read and understand complex data flows paired with strong SQL skills
Hands on experience in orchestrating data pipelines within cloud platforms like AWS or Azure
Problem-solving attitude
Independent working style
Experience with working as part of a team in agile project setups
A university degree in computer science, information technology, or related discipline
Articulate with impeccable verbal and written communication skills in English. Strong & discerning listener. Another language skill is a plus




What we offer:




Responsible roles in international projects
Space to grow and to take over responsibility
Dedicated onboarding program
Work with the cutting-edge technology
A permanent employment in a family-friendly company,
Working in a multinational team (more than 15 nationalities)
Flexible working hours
Participation in regular team events in Berlin and Hamburg
Further training opportunities
Modern equipment
Classes of German language
And many other Job perks (childcare subsidy, company pension scheme, job bike, etc…)




We are looking for passionate people to join our growing team.




JOIN US – and grab your opportunity!




Please have in mind only short-listed candidates will be contacted.




For any questions, please write to marija.sekularac@reeeliance.com or send a DM.

Show more

Data is undeniably one of the world's most valuable resources. However, it's futile if it's not in the right place or the right setup. We strive to place data where it's needed most and can be used to its fullest potential.


Become a valued member of our data integration team and build with us highly scalable data architectures and fast data pipelines for our multinational clients. Our use cases range from data warehouse and lakehouse architectures implementations over IoT and data streaming setups to sophisticated AI scenarios, in industries ranging from manufacturing, consumer products, healthcare to banking and insurance, just to name a few.


Our Tech Stack at a glance

Coding: SQL, Python | Data Pipeline: Matillion, VaultSpeed | Data Storage: Snowflake, Azure Synapse | DevOps: Azure DevOps, GitLab


Your responsibilities:


  • In this role you have the chance to design, build and maintain data pipelines according to the client's business needs and embed them end-to-end into the given data stack
  • As a Data Engineer you will maintain and optimize the data infrastructure required for data extraction, transformation, and loading from a wide variety of data sources
  • You build, maintain, and deploy data artifacts on cloud platforms
  • You will ensure of data accuracy, integrity, privacy, security, and compliance by applying data quality assurances methods
  • Your responsibility will include monitoring of data pipeline performance as well as the implementation of optimization strategies
  • You will work together with both reeeliance and client staff as part of an agile team


Our requirements:


  • Proficiency in both classic and recent data modeling concepts
  • Applicable knowledge in data warehousing architectures and best practice design
  • Experience and confidence in using at least one ETL tool and proficiency in Python
  • Ability to read and understand complex data flows paired with strong SQL skills
  • Hands on experience in orchestrating data pipelines within cloud platforms like AWS or Azure
  • Problem-solving attitude
  • Independent working style
  • Experience with working as part of a team in agile project setups
  • A university degree in computer science, information technology, or related discipline
  • Articulate with impeccable verbal and written communication skills in English. Strong & discerning listener. Another language skill is a plus


What we offer:


  • Responsible roles in international projects
  • Space to grow and to take over responsibility
  • Dedicated onboarding program
  • Work with the cutting-edge technology
  • A permanent employment in a family-friendly company,
  • Working in a multinational team (more than 15 nationalities)
  • Flexible working hours
  • Participation in regular team events in Berlin and Hamburg
  • Further training opportunities
  • Modern equipment
  • Classes of German language
  • And many other Job perks (childcare subsidy, company pension scheme, job bike, etc…)


We are looking for passionate people to join our growing team.


JOIN US – and grab your opportunity!


Please have in mind only short-listed candidates will be contacted.


For any questions, please write to marija.sekularac@reeeliance.com or send a DM.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About us

bolttech is an international insurtech with a mission to build the world’s leading, technology-enabled ecosystem for protection and insurance. With a full suite of digital and data-driven capabilities, bolttech powers connections between insurers, distributors, and customers to make it easier and more efficient to buy and sell insurance and protection products.




In this position you will…

We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our growing team of data enthusiasts. The hire will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up.




You will be responsible for…

▪ Working with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.

▪ Keeping our data separated and secure across national boundaries through multiple data centers and AWS\GCP regions.

▪ Assembling large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements. Role Profile_bolttech_v4_2021.07.28 Classified as C2 - General Business

▪ Creating and maintaining optimal data pipeline architecture.

▪ Creating data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.

▪ Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.

▪ Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using Databricks, SQL and AWS ‘big data’ technologies.

▪ Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency, and other key business performance metrics.

▪ Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.




For you to be successful…

…we expect you to be able to demonstrate the following key competencies:




▪ Customer Focus: You have a strong commitment to understanding and anticipating internal/external customers and partners’ diverse needs and expectations and strive to deliver customer-centric solutions.

▪ Impactful: You take action and deliver, focusing on continuous improvement and creating optimal outcomes.

▪ Creative: You have creative ideas, test out new approaches and you are able to identify and take advantage of new opportunities or innovations at the right time.

▪ Adaptable: You adjust your style and approach in a nimble manner demonstrating a flexible, resilient and proactive approach in order to be successful.

▪ Curious: You are curious and eager to learn and acquire new knowledge and skills, you seek to consistently encourage and understand fresh perspectives.




You will require the following qualifications and skills

▪ 5 years of experience in a Data Engineer role, who has attained a Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field.

▪ SQL knowledge and experience working with relational and noSQL databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.

▪ Experience Designing, building and optimizing data pipelines, and data sets.

▪ Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.

▪ Experience in setting up and implementing data platforms such as new infrastructure, VPC setting, security settings and configurations on cloud platform such as Azure, GCP or AWS. ▪ Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.

▪ Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency, and workload management.

▪ A successful history of manipulating, processing, and extracting value from large, disconnected datasets.

▪ Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable ‘big data’ data stores.

▪ Strong project management and organizational skills.

▪ Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.

▪ They should also have proven experience using the following software/tools:

o Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres, Oracle, mySQL and mongoDB

o Experience with Databricks (mandatory)

o Experience with data pipeline orchestration and workflow management tools: Airflow, Astronomer, etc. (mandatory)

o Experience with AWS cloud services: S3, EC2, EMR, RDS, Redshift, Glue

o Experience with GCP cloud services: GCS, Dataproc, GCE, BigQuery, GKE.

o Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python (mandatory), Java, C++, Scala, etc.

o Experience with Git R




Diversity and Inclusion

At bolttech, we are diverse and inclusive. We value each person's unique skills, background, and identity. We never discriminate on cultural background, religion, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital or family status or any legally protected status. Everyone belongs. And because everyone’s different, we’re also flexible in the ways we work, so each person can bring their best efforts every day

Title: Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst
Description:
This job will provide you with an opportunity to further your career alongside some of the best and most passionate technology experts from around the world in a leading company within the test, measurement and data analytics industry. You will be a strong contributor collaborating closely with colleagues from various business functions.

At HBK, we live up to our three values: Be True, Own It and Aim High. We believe in absolute integrity – it’s how we win for stakeholders, the environment and each other. We believe in teamwork and keeping our promises – to ourselves and others. Finally, we believe in being bold and positive. This is how we perform at our best and achieve greater success.

HBK is a leading organization in Testing and measuring environment who are on a journey to ensure that we are utilizing data-driven insights to make strategic business decisions. We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to join our dynamic team. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in leveraging SAP DataSphere and SAP Analytical Cloud to enhance our data analytics and reporting capabilities. The team is currently rebuilding our data landscape, and this is a real opportunity to drive change within the business area.

Job Summary:

As a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, you will take a leadership role in gathering, analyzing, and transforming data into actionable insights that drive informed decision-making HBK. Drawing upon your extensive expertise in SAP DataSphere and SAP Analytical Cloud, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver advanced data solutions and enhance operational efficiency.

Key Responsibilities:


Data Strategy: Develop and execute a comprehensive data strategy that leverages SAP DataSphere and SAP Analytical Cloud to meet the organization's analytical needs and objectives.
Advanced Analytics: Apply advanced statistical and predictive analytics techniques to uncover trends, patterns, and insights in data, enabling more informed decision-making.
Reporting Excellence: Lead the design and maintenance of sophisticated, interactive reports and dashboards using SAP Analytical Cloud. Create highly visual and intuitive data visualizations for use by business stakeholders.
Data Integration and Governance: Oversee the integration of data from diverse sources, ensuring data quality, consistency, and adherence to data governance policies. Collaborate with IT and data engineering teams to optimize data pipelines.
Performance Optimization: Continuously enhance the performance of SAP DataSphere and SAP Analytical Cloud, including optimizing data processing and reporting capabilities.
Business Requirements Analysis: Work closely with business leaders to understand their analytical needs and translate these requirements into actionable data solutions.
Data Modeling Expertise: Design and implement complex data models to facilitate advanced reporting and analytics, encompassing both logical and physical data models.
Data Security and Compliance: Ensure strict data security and compliance with internal policies and industry regulations throughout all data handling and reporting activities.
Mentorship and Training: Provide guidance and training to other analysts and end-users on SAP DataSphere and SAP Analytical Cloud, fostering self-service analytics adoption.


Qualifications:


Bachelor's degree in Business, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field (Master's degree preferred).
A minimum of 3 years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst with a strong focus on SAP DataSphere and SAP Analytical Cloud.
In-depth expertise in data warehousing, ETL processes, data modeling, and advanced analytics techniques.
Proficiency in SQL and familiarity with data visualization tools.
Exceptional problem-solving skills and analytical thinking.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Proven ability to work effectively within cross-functional teams.
Knowledge of industry best practices and emerging trends in business intelligence and data analytics.


Additional Information:


Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package.
Opportunities for career growth and professional development within our organization.
A collaborative and innovative work environment equipped with state-of-the-art data analytics tools.


If you are a seasoned professional with a passion for utilizing SAP DataSphere and SAP Analytical Cloud to drive advanced data-driven decision-making, we invite you to apply and become a pivotal part of our team at HBK. Join us in shaping the future of data analytics for our business's success.

If you are a seasoned professional with a passion for utilizing SAP DataSphere and SAP Analytical Cloud to drive advanced data-driven decision-making, we invite you to apply and become a pivotal part of our team at HBK. Join us in shaping the future of data analytics for our business's success.

Title: Senior Functional Data Analyst
Description:
Who is Clever?

Clever Advertising is a multinational digital brand serving the iGaming industry for the last 15 years with innovative advertising and technology solutions.

We are dedicated to your professional and personal growth in an environment that values knowledge-sharing and mentorship.




Why joining Clever?

Working with us means joining a diverse team where each member contributes to collective success, supporting one another through shared goals and passions. We not only focus on achieving excellent results but also enjoy the journey, making every day both fulfilling and fun.




Where will I work from?

Porto, Portugal.




What is my department like?

Our Technology Department is the driving force behind the innovations that propel our company forward. Committed to creating scalable and high-quality solutions, we work in a collaborative environment where every idea matters. Our teams of experts in development, infrastructure, security, and data intelligence are driven by a passion for solving complex challenges and delivering impactful results. We value diversity of thought and believe that the best solutions arise from collaboration between diverse and creative minds




What is my role like?

We are looking for an experienced Senior Functional Data Analyst to help consolidate and expand the Business Intelligence (BI) area within our IT department. This professional will be responsible for supporting leadership in defining standards and best practices for data visualization, using Power BI as the primary tool. Additionally, they will play a key role in communication and negotiation with managers, ensuring that BI solutions are effective and aligned with the company's strategic needs.




What will my daily tasks involve?

Assist in creating and implementing standards for the use of Power BI across the organization, ensuring consistency and quality in data visualizations.
Collaborate with IT leadership to develop and execute Business Intelligence strategies that support business objectives.
Work directly with managers to understand data needs and ensure that dashboards and reports are effective for decision-making. Facilitate communication between technical and business teams, ensuring that requirements are clear and feasible.
Create and optimize dashboards and reports in Power BI, ensuring that visualizations are intuitive, actionable, and aligned with business needs.
Monitor the use of BI solutions and implement improvements based on continuous feedback, aiming to enhance the effectiveness of data visualization tools.




What is expected from me?

Experience as a Product Manager, Functional Data Analyst or in related roles, with a strong focus on Business Intelligence and Power BI.
Excellent negotiation and communication skills to effectively interact with stakeholders at different levels and areas.
Proficiency in English, essential for collaboration with international teams and potential expansions in Malta.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, IT Management, or related fields. A Master's degree is a plus.




What can I expect from Clever?

A competitive remuneration package
Superior health benefits
Employee cafeteria featuring meals approved by our nutritionist
Wellbeing support through our Happiness Department, including 24/7 medical app access, complimentary nutritional consultations, psychological support, and wellness webinars.
A commitment to professional growth with tailored development plans and opportunities for internal career moves.
An education-rich workplace with access to the Clever Academy and language learning opportunities.
A balanced approach to work-life dynamics.




At Clever, we believe in diversity and inclusion as drivers of innovation. We foster a work environment free from discrimination, where everyone has equal opportunities to succeed.




Ready to make a Clever choice?

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Jumia (Full Time)
Description:
About Jumia:

Jumia believes that technology has the potential to transform everyday life in Africa for the better. Jumia was built to help consumers access millions of goods and services conveniently and at the best prices while opening up a new way for sellers to reach consumers and grow their businesses.

Listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in 2019, Jumia is the leading e-commerce company in Africa, operating in 11 countries. The Jumia platform consists of a marketplace, which connects sellers with consumers, a logistics service, which enables the shipment and delivery of packages from sellers to consumers, and a payment service, JumiaPay, which offers a safe and easy solution to facilitate online payment transactions. The company offers goods across a broad range of categories, such as phones and electronics, home appliances, fast-moving consumer goods, fashion and beauty.

What you will be doing


Lead the execution of data analysis projects, including collecting specifications, creating dashboards, and conducting in-depth analyses to drive business decisions
Develop and maintain complex SQL queries, Power BI dashboards, and Excel models to support various business units
Mentor and support junior colleagues in data analysis techniques, query optimization, and dashboard creation
Perform quality assurance on data outputs, including queries, dashboard results, and visualizations to ensure accuracy and reliability
Communicate analytical findings and insights to senior stakeholders in a clear, concise, and actionable manner
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to standardize processes, improve team performance, and enhance overall efficiency
Assist the team manager in handling ad-hoc requests and managing cross-team projects
Contribute to the development of best practices and documentation for data analysis processes.


What we are looking for


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related quantitative field
Minimum of 5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in the e-commerce or retail sector
Advanced proficiency in SQL, Power BI, and Excel; familiarity with JIRA and Confluence is a plus
Demonstrated experience in creating and maintaining complex dashboards and conducting in-depth data analysis
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to translate business requirements into analytical solutions
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data insights to both technical and non-technical audiences
Experience in mentoring junior team members and contributing to process improvements
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Knowledge of e-commerce metrics and KPIs is highly desirable
Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) and data visualization best practices
This job description outlines the key responsibilities and requirements for a Senior Data Analyst at Jumia, emphasizing the technical skills, leadership qualities, and industry knowledge needed for success in this role.


We Offer:


A unique experience in an entrepreneurial, yet structured environment
A unique opportunity of having strong impact in building the African e-commerce sector
The opportunity to become part of a highly professional and dynamic team
An unparalleled personal and professional growth as our longer term objective is to train the next generation of leaders


Please ensure to only apply for jobs with Jumia through our official website.

Jumia will never charge you a fee to apply for a job: be wary of websites that claim to help you apply for a Jumia job or that charge a fee to get you a job.

The company offers goods across a broad range of categories, such as phones and electronics, home appliances, fast-moving consumer goods, fashion and beauty.

What you will be doing

  • Lead the execution of data analysis projects, including collecting specifications, creating dashboards, and conducting in-depth analyses to drive business decisions
  • Develop and maintain complex SQL queries, Power BI dashboards, and Excel models to support various business units
  • Mentor and support junior colleagues in data analysis techniques, query optimization, and dashboard creation
  • Perform quality assurance on data outputs, including queries, dashboard results, and visualizations to ensure accuracy and reliability
  • Communicate analytical findings and insights to senior stakeholders in a clear, concise, and actionable manner
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to standardize processes, improve team performance, and enhance overall efficiency
  • Assist the team manager in handling ad-hoc requests and managing cross-team projects
  • Contribute to the development of best practices and documentation for data analysis processes.

What we are looking for

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related quantitative field
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in the e-commerce or retail sector
  • Advanced proficiency in SQL, Power BI, and Excel; familiarity with JIRA and Confluence is a plus
  • Demonstrated experience in creating and maintaining complex dashboards and conducting in-depth data analysis
  • Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to translate business requirements into analytical solutions
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data insights to both technical and non-technical audiences
  • Experience in mentoring junior team members and contributing to process improvements
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
  • Knowledge of e-commerce metrics and KPIs is highly desirable
  • Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) and data visualization best practices
  • This job description outlines the key responsibilities and requirements for a Senior Data Analyst at Jumia, emphasizing the technical skills, leadership qualities, and industry knowledge needed for success in this role.

We Offer:

  • A unique experience in an entrepreneurial, yet structured environment
  • A unique opportunity of having strong impact in building the African e-commerce sector
  • The opportunity to become part of a highly professional and dynamic team
  • An unparalleled personal and professional growth as our longer term objective is to train the next generation of leaders

Please ensure to only apply for jobs with Jumia through our official website.

Jumia will never charge you a fee to apply for a job: be wary of websites that claim to help you apply for a Jumia job or that charge a fee to get you a job.

Title: Data Visualization Engineer - Saudi Arabia
Description:
Make an impact by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there’s a constant need to be innovative.

Be part of the team that combines business knowledge, technological edge and a design experience. Our different backgrounds and know-how are key in developing solutions and experiences for digital clients.

Face challenges and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there’s always room for your energy and creativity.

About The Role

The Data Visualization Engineer is responsible for extracting, preparing, and cleansing data, as well as designing and creating visually engaging and informative data visualizations.

As a part of your job, you will:


Collaborate with data analysts and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and objectives for visualization projects.
Connect and integrate visualization tools with various data sources, ensuring seamless and efficient data access.
Extract, prepare, and cleanse data from various sources, ensuring data quality, integrity, and accuracy for visualization purposes.
Design and develop visually engaging and insightful data visualizations using appropriate tools and techniques.



What are we looking for?


BSc and/or MSc in Computer Science or similar;
Previous experience with Data Visualization, Business Intelligence, and ETL processes;
Proficiency in Power BI;
Proficiency in data prep tools or components as Tableau Prep, Power Query, Alteryx, or similar;
Solid understanding of data extraction, preparation, and cleansing techniques to ensure data quality and integrity;
Experience with database management systems, SQL, and various data formats, such as CSV, JSON, and XML;
Ability to connect and integrate visualization tools with various data sources, such as APIs, databases, or data lakes.



Personal traits:

Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams and Clients

Teamwork skills but also sense of autonomy

Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included

Willingness to collaborate with other players

Strong communication skills

We want people who like to roll up their sleeves and open their minds. Believe this is you? Come join the Team!

Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions – addressing Telecommunications, Energy & Utilities, Financial Services and other markets' strategic opportunities.

Serving Clients in 25+ countries, Celfocus delivers solutions such as accelerating digital network transformation in Autonomous Networks, elevating and monetising business services in B2B2x ecosystems, and providing highly relevant customer experiences through Hyper-personalisation solutions.
Show more
